1958        self.asperities_num_vertices = self.asperities_vertices.shape[0]
1959        """ Number of asperities vertices [-] """
1960        self.asperities_num_patches = self.asperities_triangles.shape[0]
1961        """ Number of asperities patches/triangles [-] """
1962        self.asperity_indices = match_sources
1963        """ List of indices matching each triangle to an asperity """
1964        self.num_asperities = len(self.asperity_indices)
1965        """ Number of distinct asperities """
1966
1967        # create asperities rotation matrices
1968        self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
1969            self.asperities_patches
1970        )
1971        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the asperities patches """
1972
1973        # create inner mesh
1974        vertices_inner, triangles_inner = combine_tet(*inner_mesh_files)
1975        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
1976            vertices_inner[:, :2] += offset_en
1977        assert (
1978            vertices_inner[:, 2].max() <= 0
1979        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the inner mesh."
1980        vertices_inner, triangles_inner = force_normals(
1981            vertices_inner, triangles_inner, normals_up=False
1982        )
1983        # extend upper plate interface
1984        extend_directions = ~np.roll(use_normals, 2)
1985        R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
1986            vertices_inner[triangles_inner]
1987        )
1988        vertices_combined, triangles_combined = extend_mesh(
1989            vertices_inner,
1990            triangles_inner,
1991            use_normals=use_normals,
1992            directions=extend_directions,
1993            normals_in=R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs[:, 2, :],
1994        )
1995        vertices_inf = vertices_combined[vertices_inner.shape[0] :, :].copy()
1996        vertices_combined, triangles_combined = force_normals(
1997            vertices_combined, triangles_combined, normals_up=False
1998        )
1999        vertices_simulated, vertices_imposed, triangles_simulated, triangles_imposed = (
2000            split_mesh(
2001                vertices_combined,
2002                triangles_combined,
2003                self.asperities_patches,
2004                max_distance=self.max_simulated_distance,
2005                max_depth=self.max_simulated_depth,
2006            )
2007        )
2008        ix_v_inf = np.concatenate(
2009            [
2010                np.flatnonzero(np.all(vertices_imposed == v, axis=1))
2011                for v in vertices_inf.tolist()
2012            ]
2013        )
2014        assert ix_v_inf.size == vertices_inf.shape[0]
2015        self.ix_tri_inf = np.any(np.isin(triangles_imposed, ix_v_inf), axis=1)
2016        """ Indices of infinity triangles """
2017
2018        # save inner mesh
2019        self.inner_vertices = vertices_simulated
2020        """ Vertex coordinates for the inner mesh [m] """
2021        self.inner_triangles = triangles_simulated
2022        """ Triangle definitions for the inner mesh [-] """
2023        self.inner_patches = self.inner_vertices[self.inner_triangles]
2024        """ Inner patches """
2025        self.inner_centroids = np.mean(self.inner_patches, axis=1)
2026        """ Centroids of inner patches [m] """
2027        self.inner_num_vertices = self.inner_vertices.shape[0]
2028        """ Number of inner vertices [-] """
2029        self.inner_num_patches = self.inner_triangles.shape[0]
2030        """ Number of inner patches/triangles [-] """
2031
2032        # create inner rotation matrices
2033        self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.inner_patches)
2034        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the inner patches """
2035
2036        # create a joint inner and asperities mesh for 2D projection purposes
2037        slab_vertices = np.concatenate(
2038            [self.inner_vertices, self.asperities_vertices], axis=0
2039        )
2040        slab_triangles = np.concatenate(
2041            [
2042                self.inner_triangles,
2043                self.asperities_triangles + self.inner_vertices.shape[0],
2044            ],
2045            axis=0,
2046        )
2047        slab_vertices, slab_triangles = remove_duplicate_vertices(
2048            slab_vertices, slab_triangles
2049        )
2050        self.slab_vertices = slab_vertices
2051        """ Vertex coordinates for the slab mesh (inner + asperities) [m] """
2052        self.slab_triangles = slab_triangles
2053        """ Triangle definitions for the slab mesh (inner + asperities) [-] """
2054
2055        # save outer mesh
2056        self.outer_vertices = vertices_imposed
2057        """ Vertex coordinates for the outer upper mesh [m] """
2058        self.outer_vertices_noninf = vertices_imposed
2059        """ Vertex coordinates for the outer upper mesh [m] """
2060        self.outer_triangles = triangles_imposed
2061        """ Triangle definitions for the outer upper mesh [-] """
2062        self.outer_triangles_noninf = triangles_imposed[~self.ix_tri_inf, :]
2063        """ Triangle definitions for the outer upper mesh [-], excluding extended patches """
2064        self.outer_patches = self.outer_vertices[self.outer_triangles]
2065        """ Outer upper patches """
2066        self.outer_centroids = np.mean(self.outer_patches, axis=1)
2067        """ Centroids of outer upper patches [m] """
2068        self.outer_num_vertices = self.outer_vertices.shape[0]
2069        """ Number of outer upper vertices [-] """
2070        self.outer_num_patches = self.outer_triangles.shape[0]
2071        """ Number of outer upper patches/triangles [-] """
2072
2073        # create outer upper rotation matrices
2074        self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.outer_patches)
2075        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the outer patches """
2076
2077        # create lower plate interface mesh
2078        vertices_lower, triangles_lower = combine_tet(*lower_mesh_files)
2079        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
2080            vertices_lower[:, :2] += offset_en
2081        vertices_lower[:, 2] += self.offset_lower
2082        assert (
2083            vertices_lower[:, 2].max() <= 0
2084        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the lower mesh."
2085        # extend in all directions
2086        R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
2087            vertices_lower[triangles_lower]
2088        )
2089        vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended = extend_mesh(
2090            vertices_lower,
2091            triangles_lower,
2092            use_normals=use_normals,
2093            normals_in=R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs[:, 2, :],
2094        )
2095        self.num_lower_extended = (
2096            triangles_lower_extended.shape[0] - triangles_lower.shape[0]
2097        )
2098        """ Number of triangles that were added to the lower plate interface """
2099        vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended = force_normals(
2100            vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended, normals_up=True
2101        )
2102        self.lower_vertices = vertices_lower_extended
2103        """ Vertex coordinates for the lower mesh [m] """
2104        self.lower_triangles = triangles_lower_extended
2105        """ Triangle definitions for the lower mesh [-] """
2106        self.lower_patches = self.lower_vertices[self.lower_triangles]
2107        """ Lower patches """
2108        self.lower_centroids = np.mean(self.lower_patches, axis=1)
2109        """ Centroids of lower patches [m] """
2110        self.lower_num_vertices = self.lower_vertices.shape[0]
2111        """ Number of lower vertices [-] """
2112        self.lower_num_patches = self.lower_triangles.shape[0]
2113        """ Number of lower patches/triangles [-] """
2114
2115        # create lower rotation matrices
2116        self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.lower_patches)
2117        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the lower patches """
2118
2119        # create a joint R tensor
2120        self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs = np.concatenate(
2121            [
2122                self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs,
2123                self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs,
2124                self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs,
2125                self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs,
2126            ],
2127            axis=0,
2128        )
2129        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for all patches """
2130
2131        # create a joint centroids array
2132        self.joint_centroids = np.concatenate(
2133            [
2134                self.inner_centroids,
2135                self.asperities_centroids,
2136                self.outer_centroids,
2137                self.lower_centroids,
2138            ],
2139            axis=0,
2140        )
2141        """ Centroids of all patches [m] """
2142
2143        # create a joint patches array
2144        self.joint_patches = np.concatenate(
2145            [
2146                self.inner_patches,
2147                self.asperities_patches,
2148                self.outer_patches,
2149                self.lower_patches,
2150            ],
2151            axis=0,
2152        )
2153        """ All patches [m] """
2154
2155        # create slice objects for all subsets in the joint arrays
2156        self.s_inner = np.s_[0 : self.inner_num_patches]
2157        """ Slice object to recover the inner patches from all patches """
2158        self.s_asperities = np.s_[
2159            self.inner_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2160            + self.asperities_num_patches
2161        ]
2162        """ Slice object to recover the asperities' patches from all patches """
2163        self.s_outer = np.s_[
2164            self.inner_num_patches
2165            + self.asperities_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2166            + self.asperities_num_patches
2167            + self.outer_num_patches
2168        ]
2169        """ Slice object to recover the outer patches from all patches """
2170        self.s_lower = np.s_[
2171            self.inner_num_patches
2172            + self.asperities_num_patches
2173            + self.outer_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2174            + self.asperities_num_patches
2175            + self.outer_num_patches
2176            + self.lower_num_patches
2177        ]
2178        """ Slice object to recover the lower patches from all patches """
2179        self.joint_num_patches = (
2180            self.inner_num_patches
2181            + self.asperities_num_patches
2182            + self.outer_num_patches
2183            + self.lower_num_patches
2184        )
2185        """ Total number of patches """
2186
2187        # calculate farfield motion unit vector
2188        if farfield_motion_type in (
2189            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM,
2190            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED,
2191        ):
2192            v_plate_vec = np.ascontiguousarray(
2193                np.broadcast_to(farfield_motion, (self.joint_num_patches, 3))
2194            )
2195        elif farfield_motion_type in (
2196            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_ROTATION,
2197            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER,
2198        ):
2199            # convert rotation format if necessary
2200            if farfield_motion_type == self.FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER:
2201                farfield_motion = np.rad2deg(
2202                    eulerpole2rotvec(np.deg2rad(farfield_motion))
2203                )
2204            # define coordinate systems
2205            crs_lla = ccrs.Geodetic()
2206            crs_xyz = ccrs.Geocentric()
2207            crs_utm = ccrs.UTM(zone=self.utmzone)
2208            # get locations of centroids in lon/lat and ECEF cartesian
2209            centroids_lla = crs_lla.transform_points(
2210                crs_utm, self.joint_centroids[:, 0], self.joint_centroids[:, 1]
2211            )
2212            centroids_xyz = crs_xyz.transform_points(
2213                crs_utm, self.joint_centroids[:, 0], self.joint_centroids[:, 1]
2214            )
2215            # calculate rotation from rotation vector
2216            farfield_motion_rad_s = np.deg2rad(farfield_motion) / 1e6 / SEC_PER_YEAR
2217            centroids_vel_xyz = np.cross(farfield_motion_rad_s, centroids_xyz)
2218            # project into local ENU
2219            v_plate_vec = np.stack(
2220                [
2221                    (R_ecef2enu(lo, la) @ centroids_vel_xyz[i, :])
2222                    for i, (lo, la) in enumerate(
2223                        zip(centroids_lla[:, 0], centroids_lla[:, 1])
2224                    )
2225                ]
2226            )
2227            # the infinitely extending patches are probably not covered by this
2228            # approximation and will yield NaNs, so we assign the same plate
2229            # velocity to them as the nearest non-infinite patch
2230            ix_inf = (
2231                np.flatnonzero(self.ix_tri_inf)
2232                + self.inner_num_patches
2233                + self.asperities_num_patches
2234            ).tolist() + (
2235                np.arange(self.lower_num_patches)[-self.num_lower_extended :]
2236                + self.inner_num_patches
2237                + self.asperities_num_patches
2238                + self.outer_num_patches
2239            ).tolist()
2240            ix_notinf = ~np.isin(np.arange(self.joint_num_patches), ix_inf)
2241            # loop over infinite patch indices
2242            for i in ix_inf:
2243                # find closest non-infinite patch
2244                j = np.argmin(
2245                    np.linalg.norm(
2246                        self.joint_centroids[ix_notinf, :]
2247                        - self.joint_centroids[i, :][None, :],
2248                        axis=1,
2249                    )
2250                )
2251                v_plate_vec[i, :] = v_plate_vec[ix_notinf, :][j, :]
2252
2253        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2254        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity at all patches in the dimensions of the rheology """
2255
2256        # project v_plate_vec onto each patch
2257        self.e_plate_tdcs = Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2258            self.v_plate_vec / np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate_vec, axis=1, keepdims=True),
2259            self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs,
2260        )
2261        """ Unit plate velocity direction in the TDCS [m] """
2262        self.e_plate_tdcs_proj = Fault3D.redistribute_normal(self.e_plate_tdcs)
2263        """ Projected unit plate velocity direction in TDCS [m] """
2264
2265        # create DDCS
2266        # angle between plate velocity and TDCS strike (already on same plane)
2267        alpha = np.arctan2(self.e_plate_tdcs_proj[:, 1], self.e_plate_tdcs_proj[:, 0])
2268        # inner
2269        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2270            [
2271                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2272                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2273                )
2274                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_inner])
2275            ]
2276        )
2277        self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2278            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2279        )
2280        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the inner patches """
2281        self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2282            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs
2283        )
2284        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the inner patches """
2285        # asperities
2286        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2287            [
2288                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2289                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2290                )
2291                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_asperities])
2292            ]
2293        )
2294        self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2295            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2296        )
2297        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the asperities patches """
2298        self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2299            "ijk,ilk->ijl",
2300            self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs,
2301            self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs,
2302        )
2303        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the asperities patches """
2304        # outer
2305        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2306            [
2307                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2308                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2309                )
2310                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_outer])
2311            ]
2312        )
2313        self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2314            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2315        )
2316        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the outer patches """
2317        self.R_outer_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2318            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs
2319        )
2320        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the outer patches """
2321        # lower
2322        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2323            [
2324                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2325                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2326                )
2327                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_lower])
2328            ]
2329        )
2330        self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2331            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2332        )
2333        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the lower patches """
2334        self.R_lower_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2335            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs
2336        )
2337        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the lower patches """
2338
2339        # create more joint R tensors
2340        self.R_joint_efcs_to_ddcs = np.concatenate(
2341            [
2342                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2343                self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs,
2344                self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs,
2345                self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs,
2346            ],
2347            axis=0,
2348        )
2349        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for all patches """
2350        self.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.concatenate(
2351            [
2352                self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2353                self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2354                self.R_outer_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2355                self.R_lower_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2356            ],
2357            axis=0,
2358        )
2359        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for all patches """
2360
2361        # project v_plate_vec onto each patch again, this time DDCS
2362        self.e_plate_ddcs_proj = Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2363            self.e_plate_tdcs_proj, self.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2]
2364        )
2365        """ Projected unit plate velocity direction in DDCS [m] """
2366        e_plate_tdcs_proj_3d = np.concatenate(
2367            [self.e_plate_tdcs_proj, np.zeros((self.e_plate_tdcs_proj.shape[0], 1))],
2368            axis=1,
2369        )
2370        e_plate_efcs_proj_3d = Fault3D.vectors_backward_rotation(
2371            e_plate_tdcs_proj_3d, self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs
2372        )
2373        assert np.allclose(
2374            np.concatenate(
2375                [
2376                    self.e_plate_ddcs_proj,
2377                    np.zeros((self.e_plate_ddcs_proj.shape[0], 1)),
2378                ],
2379                axis=1,
2380            ),
2381            Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2382                e_plate_efcs_proj_3d, self.R_joint_efcs_to_ddcs
2383            ),
2384        )
2385
2386        # compute the relevant stress kernels in DDCS, if not already provided
2387        if K_inner_asperities is None:
2388            print("Calculating asperity stress kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
2389            tic = perf_counter()
2390            K_inner_asperities = self.get_stress_kernel(
2391                self.asperities_patches,
2392                self.inner_centroids,
2393                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2394                self.mu,
2395                self.nu,
2396                rot_mats_tdcs=self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2397            )
2398            toc = perf_counter()
2399            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2400        else:
2401            assert isinstance(
2402                K_inner_asperities, np.ndarray
2403            ), f"Expected 'K_inner_asperities' NumPy array, got {type(K_inner_asperities)}."
2404            expected_shape = (self.inner_num_patches, 3, self.asperities_num_patches, 3)
2405            assert K_inner_asperities.shape == expected_shape, (
2406                f"Expected 'K_inner_asperities' shape of {expected_shape}, "
2407                f"got {K_inner_asperities.shape}."
2408            )
2409            print(f"Accepted input 'K_inner_asperities' of shape {expected_shape}.")
2410        self.K_inner_asperities = K_inner_asperities
2411        """ Stress kernel from the asperities to the inner mesh [Pa/m] """
2412        if K_inner_inner is None:
2413            print("Calculating internal stress kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
2414            tic = perf_counter()
2415            K_inner_inner = self.get_stress_kernel(
2416                self.inner_patches,
2417                self.inner_centroids,
2418                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2419                self.mu,
2420                self.nu,
2421                rot_mats_tdcs=self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2422            )
2423            toc = perf_counter()
2424            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2425        else:
2426            assert isinstance(
2427                K_inner_inner, np.ndarray
2428            ), f"Expected 'K_inner_inner' NumPy array, got {type(K_inner_inner)}."
2429            expected_shape = (self.inner_num_patches, 3, self.inner_num_patches, 3)
2430            assert K_inner_inner.shape == expected_shape, (
2431                f"Expected 'K_inner_inner' shape of {expected_shape}, "
2432                f"got {K_inner_inner.shape}."
2433            )
2434            print(f"Accepted input 'K_inner_inner' of shape {expected_shape}.")
2435        self.K_inner_inner = K_inner_inner
2436        """ Stress kernel within the inner mesh [Pa/m] """
2437
2438        # calculate horizontal cross sections
2439        if cross_sections is None:
2440            print("Calculating mesh cross sections... ", flush=True, end="")
2441            tic = perf_counter()
2442            # format mesh
2443            trimesh = meshcut.TriangleMesh(self.slab_vertices, self.slab_triangles)
2444            # get all cross sections
2445            all_cross_sections = [
2446                meshcut.cross_section_mesh(
2447                    trimesh,
2448                    meshcut.Plane(self.inner_centroids[i, :], [0, 0, 1]),
2449                    dist_tol=1,
2450                )
2451                for i in range(self.inner_num_patches)
2452            ]
2453            # eliminate those that have multiple segments
2454            cross_sections = [
2455                cs[0] if len(cs) == 1 else None for cs in all_cross_sections
2456            ]
2457            # eliminate those that are significantly shorter than the median, so probably wrong
2458            cs_lengths = np.array(
2459                [
2460                    shapely.LineString(cs).length if cs is not None else np.nan
2461                    for cs in cross_sections
2462                ]
2463            )
2464            cs_length_cutoff = np.nanmedian(cs_lengths) * 0.8
2465            for i in np.flatnonzero(cs_lengths < cs_length_cutoff):
2466                cross_sections[i] = None
2467            toc = perf_counter()
2468            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2469        else:
2470            assert isinstance(cross_sections, list) and all(
2471                [
2472                    (
2473                        isinstance(cs, np.ndarray)
2474                        and (cs.ndim == 2)
2475                        and (cs.shape[1] == 3)
2476                    )
2477                    or (cs is None)
2478                    for cs in cross_sections
2479                ]
2480            ), "Expected a list of Nones or well-shaped NumPy arrays as cross sections."
2481            print("Accepted input 'cross_sections'.")
2482        self.cross_sections = cross_sections
2483        """ Horizontal cross sections through the inner centroid along the slab """
2484
2485        # calculate the spline coefficients onto which to interpolate rheological values
2486        # convert the ENU coordinates of patch_centroids into a vertical (depth) and horizontal
2487        # (along-strike, constant depth) coordinate system, and normalize to (0, 1)
2488        # vertical (increasing towards greater depth)
2489        assert np.all(self.inner_centroids[:, 2] <= 0)
2490        patch_depths = (self.inner_centroids[:, 2] - self.slab_vertices[:, 2].max()) / (
2491            self.slab_vertices[:, 2].min() - self.slab_vertices[:, 2].max()
2492        )
2493        # horizontal
2494        patch_horiz = np.zeros_like(patch_depths)
2495        target_dir = np.array(
2496            [
2497                np.cos(np.deg2rad(self.orient_along)),
2498                np.sin(np.deg2rad(self.orient_along)),
2499            ]
2500        )
2501        successful_lines = [None for _ in range(patch_horiz.size)]
2502        # get all horizontal cut lines
2503        for i, cs in enumerate(self.cross_sections):
2504            # use the supplied cross-sections
2505            if cs is not None:
2506                # we can use Shapely for the distance along the line since the z-component does
2507                # not vary because of how we slice
2508                ls = shapely.LineString(cs)
2509                assert ls.is_simple and ls.is_valid, "LineString not valid or simple"
2510                # make sure the line points in the right direction
2511                ls_dir = np.array(
2512                    [
2513                        ls.coords[-1][1] - ls.coords[0][1],
2514                        ls.coords[-1][0] - ls.coords[0][0],
2515                    ]
2516                )
2517                dir_diff = np.arccos(
2518                    np.dot(target_dir, ls_dir) / np.linalg.norm(ls_dir)
2519                )
2520                if dir_diff > np.pi / 2:
2521                    ls = ls.reverse()
2522                # save for later use
2523                successful_lines[i] = ls
2524        # calculate all horizontal distances
2525        for i, test_ls in enumerate(successful_lines):
2526            # find closest existing line if the current one didn't work
2527            ls = test_ls
2528            if ls is None:
2529                for test_ix in np.argsort(np.abs(patch_depths[i] - patch_depths)):
2530                    if successful_lines[test_ix] is not None:
2531                        ls = successful_lines[test_ix]
2532                        break
2533            assert ls is not None
2534            # now calculate the normalized distance along the cross section until the centroid
2535            patch_horiz[i] = ls.line_locate_point(
2536                shapely.Point(self.inner_centroids[i, :]), normalized=True
2537            )
2538        patch_horiz[patch_horiz == 1] -= 1e-10
2539        # save
2540        self.inner_patch_2d_coords = np.stack([patch_depths, patch_horiz], axis=1)
2541        """
2542        2D normalized coordinates of the inner patches
2543        along horizontal & depth directions [-]
2544        """
2545
2546        # prepare quantities relating to slip tapering
2547        self.dists_inner_asperities = np.array(
2548            [
2549                [shapely.distance(p, shapely.Point(c)) for c in self.inner_centroids]
2550                for p in self.asperities_polygons
2551            ]
2552        )
2553        """
2554        Distances [m] between asperity triangles and inner centroids,
2555        shape (num_asperities, num_inner)
2556        """
2557        # for each asperity, get the indices of the triangle closest to each inner mesh centroid
2558        self.i_closest_asp_tri = np.array(
2559            [
2560                aix[np.argmin(self.dists_inner_asperities[aix, :], axis=0)]
2561                for aix in self.asperity_indices
2562            ]
2563        )
2564        """
2565        Indices of closest asperity triangle for each asperity and each inner patch,
2566        shape (num_asperities, num_inner)
2567        """
2568
2569    @classmethod
2570    def from_cfg_and_files(
2571        cls,
2572        fault_dict,
2573        K_inner_asperities_file=None,
2574        K_inner_inner_file=None,
2575        cross_sections_file=None,
2576        write_new_files=True,
2577        verbose=False,
2578    ):
2579        """
2580        Create a `Fault3D` object from a configuration dictionary and precomputed arrays
2581        stored to files using `write_big_files`.
2582
2583        Parameters
2584        ----------
2585        fault_dict : dict
2586            Dictionary of keyword arguments passed on to the initialization; from
2587            `SubductionSimulation3D.read_config_file`
2588        K_inner_asperities_file : str, optional
2589            File name for `K_inner_asperities`
2590        K_inner_inner_file : str, optional
2591            File name for `K_inner_inner`
2592        cross_sections_file : str, optional
2593            File name for `cross_sections`
2594        write_new_files : bool, optional
2595            Whether to save to files the kernels and cross sections if they were missing
2596        verbose : bool, optional
2597            Print what's happening
2598
2599        Returns
2600        -------
2601        fault : Fault3D
2602            The new `Fault3D` object
2603        """
2604        # check for K_inner_asperities
2605        if K_inner_asperities_file is not None:
2606            try:
2607                K_inner_asperities = np.load(K_inner_asperities_file)
2608            except FileNotFoundError:
2609                K_inner_asperities = None
2610                if verbose:
2611                    print(
2612                        f"Couldn't find '{K_inner_asperities_file}', "
2613                        "need to recompute K_inner_asperities"
2614                    )
2615            else:
2616                if verbose:
2617                    print(f"Loaded K_inner_asperities from '{K_inner_asperities_file}'")
2618            if "K_inner_asperities" in fault_dict:
2619                del fault_dict["K_inner_asperities"]
2620        else:
2621            K_inner_asperities = fault_dict.pop("K_inner_asperities", None)
2622        # check for K_inner_inner
2623        if K_inner_inner_file is not None:
2624            try:
2625                K_inner_inner = np.load(K_inner_inner_file)
2626            except FileNotFoundError:
2627                K_inner_inner = None
2628                if verbose:
2629                    print(
2630                        f"Couldn't find '{K_inner_inner_file}', "
2631                        "need to recompute K_inner_inner"
2632                    )
2633            else:
2634                if verbose:
2635                    print(f"Loaded K_inner_inner from '{K_inner_inner_file}'")
2636            if "K_inner_inner" in fault_dict:
2637                del fault_dict["K_inner_inner"]
2638        else:
2639            K_inner_inner = fault_dict.pop("K_inner_inner", None)
2640        # check for cross_sections
2641        if cross_sections_file is not None:
2642            try:
2643                with open(cross_sections_file, "rb") as f:
2644                    cross_sections = pickle.load(f)
2645            except FileNotFoundError:
2646                cross_sections = None
2647                if verbose:
2648                    print(
2649                        f"Couldn't find '{cross_sections_file}', "
2650                        "need to recompute cross_sections"
2651                    )
2652            else:
2653                if verbose:
2654                    print(f"Loaded cross_sections from '{cross_sections_file}'")
2655        else:
2656            cross_sections = None
2657        # create new object
2658        fault = cls(
2659            **fault_dict,
2660            K_inner_asperities=K_inner_asperities,
2661            K_inner_inner=K_inner_inner,
2662            cross_sections=cross_sections,
2663        )
2664        # save new files if desired
2665        if write_new_files:
2666            fault.write_big_files(
2667                K_inner_asperities_file=(
2668                    K_inner_asperities_file
2669                    if (K_inner_asperities_file is not None)
2670                    and (K_inner_asperities is None)
2671                    else None
2672                ),
2673                K_inner_inner_file=(
2674                    K_inner_inner_file
2675                    if (K_inner_inner_file is not None) and (K_inner_inner is None)
2676                    else None
2677                ),
2678                cross_sections_file=(
2679                    cross_sections_file
2680                    if (cross_sections_file is not None) and (cross_sections is None)
2681                    else None
2682                ),
2683                verbose=verbose,
2684            )
2685        # return new object
2686        return fault
2687
2688    def write_big_files(
2689        self,
2690        K_inner_asperities_file=None,
2691        K_inner_inner_file=None,
2692        cross_sections_file=None,
2693        verbose=False,
2694    ):
2695        """
2696        Write the arrays that are computationally expensive to files.
2697
2698        Parameters
2699        ----------
2700        K_inner_asperities_file : str, optional
2701            File name for `K_inner_asperities`
2702        K_inner_inner_file : str, optional
2703            File name for `K_inner_inner`
2704        cross_sections_file : str, optional
2705            File name for `cross_sections`
2706        """
2707        if K_inner_asperities_file is not None:
2708            np.save(K_inner_asperities_file, self.K_inner_asperities)
2709            if verbose:
2710                print(f"Saved K_inner_asperities to '{K_inner_asperities_file}'")
2711        if K_inner_inner_file is not None:
2712            np.save(K_inner_inner_file, self.K_inner_inner)
2713            if verbose:
2714                print(f"Saved K_inner_inner to '{K_inner_inner_file}'")
2715        if cross_sections_file is not None:
2716            with open(cross_sections_file, "wb") as f:
2717                pickle.dump(self.cross_sections, f, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)
2718                if verbose:
2719                    print(f"Saved cross_sections to '{cross_sections_file}'")
2720
2721    @staticmethod
2722    def vectors_forward_rotation(vectors, R_from_to):
2723        """
2724        Rotate vectors from EFCS to another coordinate system.
2725
2726        Parameters
2727        ----------
2728        vectors : numpy.ndarray
2729            Vectors arranged in the shape :math:`(n, 3)`
2730        R_from_to : numpy.ndarray
2731            Rotation matrices to use of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`
2732
2733        Returns
2734        -------
2735        vectors_rot : numpy.ndarray
2736            Rotated vectors in the same shape.
2737        """
2738        return np.einsum("ijk,ik->ij", R_from_to, vectors)
2739
2740    @staticmethod
2741    def vectors_backward_rotation(vectors, R_from_to):
2742        """
2743        Rotate vectors from another coordinate system to EFCS.
2744
2745        Parameters
2746        ----------
2747        vectors : numpy.ndarray
2748            Vectors arranged in the shape :math:`(n, 3)`
2749        R_from_to : numpy.ndarray
2750            Rotation matrices to use of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`
2751
2752        Returns
2753        -------
2754        vectors_rot : numpy.ndarray
2755            Rotated vectors in the same shape.
2756        """
2757        return np.einsum("ikj,ik->ij", R_from_to, vectors)
2758
2759    @staticmethod
2760    def get_stress_kernel(
2761        patches, centroids, rot_mats_efcs, mu, nu, rot_mats_tdcs=None
2762    ):
2763        """
2764        Calculate the stress kernel between every source and target patch
2765        and project onto the target coordinate system.
2766
2767        Parameters
2768        ----------
2769        patches : numpy.ndarray
2770            Source patches matrix of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`.
2771        centroids : numpy.ndarray
2772            Target centroids of shape :math:`(m, 3)`.
2773        rot_mats_efcs : numpy.ndarray
2774            Rotation matrices from EFCS to the target coordinate system
2775            of shape :math:`(m, 3, 3)`
2776        mu : float
2777            Shear modulus [Pa]
2778        nu : float
2779            Poisson's ratio [-]
2780        rot_mats_tdcs : numpy.ndarray, optional
2781            Rotation matrices from TDCS to the target coordinate system
2782            of shape :math:`(m, 3, 3)` (if the target is not TDCS)
2783
2784        Returns
2785        -------
2786        K : numpy.ndarray
2787            Stress kernel (tensor) of shape :math:`(m, 3, n, 3)`.
2788
2789        Notes
2790        -----
2791
2792        To convert source slip in DDCS into target stress in DDCS all at once,
2793        use a tensor product: `numpy.tensordot(K, slip, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)])`.
2794        """
2795
2796        # get dimensions and centroids
2797        num_source = patches.shape[0]
2798        num_target = centroids.shape[0]
2799
2800        # get normal directions
2801        e1 = rot_mats_efcs[:, 0, :]
2802        e2 = rot_mats_efcs[:, 1, :]
2803        e3 = rot_mats_efcs[:, 2, :]
2804
2805        # get stress tensor in EFCS for TDCS input
2806        strain_efcs = strain_matrix(obs_pts=centroids, tris=patches, nu=nu)
2807        stress_efcs = (
2808            strain_to_stress(
2809                strain=strain_efcs.transpose(0, 2, 3, 1).reshape(-1, 6), mu=mu, nu=nu
2810            )
2811            .reshape(num_target, num_source, 3, 6)
2812            .transpose(0, 3, 1, 2)
2813        )
2814
2815        # change input coordinate system from TDCS to target one
2816        if rot_mats_tdcs is not None:
2817            stress_efcs = np.einsum(
2818                "ijkl,kml->ijkm", stress_efcs, rot_mats_tdcs, optimize="optimal"
2819            )
2820
2821        # project to target coordinate system
2822        stress_efcs_3x3 = [
2823            np.stack(
2824                [
2825                    stress_efcs[:, 0, :, i].ravel(),
2826                    stress_efcs[:, 3, :, i].ravel(),
2827                    stress_efcs[:, 4, :, i].ravel(),
2828                    stress_efcs[:, 3, :, i].ravel(),
2829                    stress_efcs[:, 1, :, i].ravel(),
2830                    stress_efcs[:, 5, :, i].ravel(),
2831                    stress_efcs[:, 4, :, i].ravel(),
2832                    stress_efcs[:, 5, :, i].ravel(),
2833                    stress_efcs[:, 2, :, i].ravel(),
2834                ]
2835            )
2836            .reshape(3, 3, num_target, num_source)
2837            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2838            for i in range(3)
2839        ]
2840        path = np.einsum_path(
2841            "ik,ijkl,il->ij", e1, stress_efcs_3x3[0], e3, optimize="optimal"
2842        )[0]
2843        K = np.array(
2844            [
2845                [
2846                    np.einsum(
2847                        "ik,ijkl,il->ij", v, stress_efcs_3x3[i], e3, optimize=path
2848                    )
2849                    for i in range(3)
2850                ]
2851                for v in [e1, e2, e3]
2852            ]
2853        ).transpose(2, 0, 3, 1)
2854
2855        # done
2856        return K
2857
2858    @staticmethod
2859    def get_disp_kernel(obs_loc, patches, nu, rot_mats_tdcs=None):
2860        """
2861        Calculate the displacement kernel from a source mesh onto the observers.
2862        Defaults to TDCS input, can be changed by passing a rotation matrix.
2863
2864        Parameters
2865        ----------
2866        obs_loc : numpy.ndarray
2867            Three-column EFCS locations of surface observers of shape :math:`(m, 3)`.
2868        patches : numpy.ndarray
2869            Source patches matrix of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`.
2870        nu : float
2871            Poisson's ratio [-]
2872        rot_mats_tdcs : numpy.ndarray, optional
2873            Rotation matrices from TDCS to the target coordinate system
2874            of shape :math:`(m, 3, 3)` (if the target is not TDCS)
2875
2876        Returns
2877        -------
2878        G : numpy.ndarray
2879            Displacement kernel (tensor) of shape :math:`(m, 3, n, 3)`
2880            where :math:`m` is the number of observers and :math:`n` is the
2881            number of source patches.
2882
2883        Notes
2884        -----
2885
2886        To convert slip in TDCS into displacement in EFCS at all observers at once,
2887        use a tensor product: `numpy.tensordot(G, slip, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)])`.
2888        """
2889
2890        # get displacement tensor from TDCS to EFCS
2891        G = disp_matrix(obs_pts=obs_loc, tris=patches, nu=nu)
2892
2893        # change input coordinate system from TDCS to target one
2894        if rot_mats_tdcs is not None:
2895            G = np.einsum("ijkl,kml->ijkm", G, rot_mats_tdcs, optimize="optimal")
2896
2897        # done
2898        return G
2899
2900    @staticmethod
2901    def redistribute_normal(vectors):
2902        """
2903        Redistribute the normal (3rd) component onto the other directions, eliminating it
2904        but keeping the magnitude the same.
2905
2906        Parameters
2907        ----------
2908        vectors : numpy.ndarray
2909            Vectors arranged in the shape :math:`(n, 3)`
2910
2911        Returns
2912        -------
2913        vectors_rescaled : numpy.ndarray
2914            Rotated vectors in the shape :math:`(n, 2)`
2915        """
2916        ratio = np.sqrt(1 + (vectors[:, 2] / vectors[:, 1]) ** 2)
2917        vectors_rescaled = np.stack([vectors[:, 0], vectors[:, 1] * ratio], axis=1)
2918        assert np.allclose(
2919            np.linalg.norm(vectors, axis=1), np.linalg.norm(vectors_rescaled, axis=1)
2920        )
2921        return vectors_rescaled
2922
2923
2924class SubductionSimulation3D:
2925    """
2926    3D subduction simulation container class.
2927    """
2928
2929    def __init__(
2930        self,
2931        n_cycles_max,
2932        n_samples_per_eq,
2933        slip_taper_distance,
2934        rheo,
2935        fault,
2936        D_0,
2937        D_0_logsigma,
2938        T_rec,
2939        T_rec_logsigma,
2940        T_anchor,
2941        T_last,
2942        enforce_v_plate,
2943        t_obs,
2944        pts_surf,
2945        atol=1e-8,
2946        rtol=1e-6,
2947        spinup_atol=1e-6,
2948        spinup_rtol=1e-3,
2949        v_max=None,
2950        calculate_tapered_slip=True,
2951        final_nonuniform_slip=None,
2952        G_surf=None,
2953        v_init=None,
2954        eq_df=None,
2955        alpha_h_vec=None,
2956        eq_slip=None,
2957        slip_taper_vec=None,
2958        slip_taper_vec_nonuni=None,
2959        delta_tau_unbounded=None,
2960        delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni=None,
2961        delta_tau_taper=None,
2962        delta_tau_taper_nonuni=None,
2963        locked_slip=None,
2964        delta_tau_bounded_compressed=None,
2965        delta_tau_bounded_indices=None,
2966    ):
2967        r"""
2968        Create a 3D subduction simulation.
2969
2970        Parameters
2971        ----------
2972        n_cycles_max : int
2973            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
2974        n_samples_per_eq : int
2975            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
2976        slip_taper_distance : float
2977            Length scale over with to taper out the coseismic slip [m]
2978        rheo : Rheology
2979            Simulated upper plate interface's rheology.
2980        fault : Fault3D
2981            Fault object
2982        D_0 : numpy.ndarray
2983            Nominal coseismic displacement magnitude [m] of the locked asperities
2984            in the opposite direction of the plate velocity, dimensions (n_eq, n_asp)
2985        D_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2986            Standard deviation of the displacement magnitude in logarithmic space,
2987            same shape as D_0
2988        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
2989            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake, length n_eq
2990        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2991            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
2992        T_anchor : str
2993            Anchor date where observations end
2994        T_last : list
2995            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
2996        enforce_v_plate : bool
2997            Flag whether to allow the plate valocity in each patch to vary or not
2998            due to the random realizations of `D_0` and `T_rec`
2999        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
3000            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
3001            or as Timestamps
3002        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
3003            Observation coordinates [m] in EFCS, dimensions (n_stations, 2 or 3)
3004        atol : float
3005            Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
3006        rtol : float
3007            Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
3008        spinup_atol : float
3009            Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
3010        spinup_rtol : float
3011            Relative tolerance of spinup controller
3012        v_max : float, optional
3013            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches during integration
3014        calculate_tapered_slip : bool, optional
3015            If ``True`` (default: ``False``), also calculate the assumed tapered
3016            slip implied by the coseismic stress changes
3017        final_nonuniform_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
3018            A NumPy array that for all the observed earthquakes contains the amount of slip
3019            in all asperity patches [m] to be used after spinup.
3020        G_surf : numpy.ndarray, optional
3021            Skip the calculation of ``G_surf`` by passing it directly.
3022        v_init : numpy.ndarray, optional
3023            Skip the calculation of ``v_init`` by passing it directly.
3024        eq_df : pandas.DataFrame, optional
3025            Skip the calculation of ``eq_df`` by passing it directly.
3026        alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray, optional
3027            Skip the calculation of ``alpha_h_vec`` by passing it directly.
3028        eq_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
3029            Skip the calculation of ``eq_slip`` by passing it directly.
3030        slip_taper_vec : numpy.ndarray, optional
3031            Skip the calculation of ``slip_taper_vec`` by passing it directly.
3032        slip_taper_vec_nonuni : numpy.ndarray, optional
3033            Skip the calculation of ``slip_taper_vec_nonuni`` by passing it directly.
3034        delta_tau_unbounded : numpy.ndarray, optional
3035            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_unbounded`` by passing it directly.
3036        delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni : numpy.ndarray, optional
3037            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni`` by passing it directly.
3038        delta_tau_taper : numpy.ndarray, optional
3039            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_taper`` by passing it directly.
3040        delta_tau_taper_nonuni : numpy.ndarray, optional
3041            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_taper_nonuni`` by passing it directly.
3042        locked_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
3043            Skip the calculation of ``locked_slip`` by passing it directly.
3044        delta_tau_bounded_compressed : numpy.ndarray, optional
3045            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_bounded_compressed`` by passing it directly.
3046        delta_tau_bounded_indices : numpy.ndarray, optional
3047            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_bounded_indices`` by passing it directly.
3048        """
3049
3050        # save general sequence & fault parameters
3051        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
3052        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
3053        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
3054        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
3055        self.slip_taper_distance = float(slip_taper_distance)
3056        """ Length scale over with to taper out the coseismic slip [m] """
3057        self.atol = atol
3058        """ Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator """
3059        self.rtol = rtol
3060        """ Relative tolerance of ODE integrator """
3061        self.spinup_atol = spinup_atol
3062        """ Absolute tolerance of spinup controller """
3063        self.spinup_rtol = spinup_rtol
3064        """ Relative tolerance of spinup controller """
3065        self.v_max = None if v_max is None else float(v_max)
3066        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches during integration """
3067
3068        # define rheology & fault
3069        assert isinstance(rheo, Rheology)
3070        assert isinstance(fault, Fault3D)
3071        self.rheo = rheo
3072        """ Simulated upper plate interface's Rheology object """
3073        self.fault = fault
3074        """ Fault object """
3075
3076        # cast earthquake displacements as NumPy array
3077        self.D_0 = np.atleast_2d(D_0)
3078        """ Nominal coseismic displacement magnitudes [m] for each asperity (columns)
3079        and each earthquake (rows) """
3080        self.D_0_logsigma = np.atleast_2d(D_0_logsigma)
3081        """ Standard deviation of the displacement magnitudes in logarithmic space [-] """
3082        assert np.all(self.D_0 >= 0) and np.all(self.D_0_logsigma >= 0)
3083        assert self.D_0.shape == self.D_0_logsigma.shape
3084        assert self.D_0.shape[1] == self.fault.num_asperities
3085        # load recurrence times
3086        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
3087        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
3088        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
3089        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
3090        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
3091        """ Anchor date where observations end """
3092        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
3093        assert self.T_rec.size == self.T_rec_logsigma.size == self.D_0.shape[0]
3094        self.T_last = T_last
3095        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
3096        # calculate how many earthquakes happen per cycle in each asperity
3097        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
3098        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
3099        self.n_eq = self.D_0.shape[0]
3100        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
3101        self.n_eq_per_cycle = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
3102        """ Number of earthquakes per full cycle """
3103        self.n_slips = self.n_eq_per_cycle.sum()
3104        """ Number of total earthquake events """
3105        total_cycle_clip_inferred_per_asperity = (
3106            self.D_0 * self.n_eq_per_cycle[:, None]
3107        ).sum(axis=0)
3108        v_plate_inferred = (
3109            total_cycle_clip_inferred_per_asperity / self.T_fullcycle / SEC_PER_YEAR
3110        )
3111        assert np.all(v_plate_inferred[0] == v_plate_inferred)
3112        self.v_plate_inferred = v_plate_inferred[0]
3113        """ Inferred plate velocity [m/s] based on the EQ setup """
3114
3115        # check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
3116        # after a full earthquake cycle
3117        # this will fail once we have rotation-based plate velocity
3118        if self.fault.farfield_motion_type == Fault3D.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM:
3119            v_plate_vec_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.fault.v_plate_vec, axis=1)
3120            assert np.allclose(v_plate_vec_mag[0], v_plate_vec_mag)
3121            v_plate_mag = v_plate_vec_mag[0]
3122            total_cycle_slip_necessary = v_plate_mag * self.T_fullcycle * SEC_PER_YEAR
3123            assert np.allclose(
3124                total_cycle_clip_inferred_per_asperity, total_cycle_slip_necessary
3125            )
3126
3127        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
3128        # first, create realizations of occurence times
3129        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
3130        rng = np.random.default_rng()
3131        self.T_rec_per_eq = [
3132            rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n)
3133            for t, s, n in zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_cycle)
3134        ]
3135        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
3136        D_0_per_eq = [np.zeros((n, self.D_0.shape[1])) for n in self.n_eq_per_cycle]
3137        for i, (d, s, n) in enumerate(
3138            zip(self.D_0, self.D_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_cycle)
3139        ):
3140            d_nonzero = d > 0
3141            D_0_per_eq[i][:, d_nonzero] = rng.lognormal(
3142                np.log(d[d_nonzero]), s[d_nonzero], (n, (d_nonzero).sum())
3143            )
3144        self.D_0_per_eq = D_0_per_eq
3145        """ Coseismic slip magnitude [m] realization """
3146
3147        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
3148        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate_mag (enforced or not)
3149        # adjust that all asperities slip the same amount over an entire cycle
3150        D_0_per_eq_concat = np.concatenate(self.D_0_per_eq, axis=0)
3151        D_0_per_asp = D_0_per_eq_concat.sum(axis=0, keepdims=True)
3152        D_0_per_asp_mean = D_0_per_asp.mean()
3153        D_0_per_eq_concat_adj = D_0_per_eq_concat * D_0_per_asp_mean / D_0_per_asp
3154        D_0_per_eq_adj = np.split(
3155            D_0_per_eq_concat_adj, np.cumsum(self.n_eq_per_cycle)[:-1], axis=0
3156        )
3157        # adjust all individual recurrence times such that they have the same overall
3158        T_fullcycle_concat = np.array([t.sum() for t in self.T_rec_per_eq])
3159        T_fullcycle_mean = T_fullcycle_concat.mean()
3160        T_rec_per_eq_adj = [t * T_fullcycle_mean / t.sum() for t in self.T_rec_per_eq]
3161        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
3162        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
3163        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
3164        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
3165        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate_mag to vary or not """
3166        # get implied, effective plate velocity
3167        v_plate_eff_mag = (
3168            np.concatenate(D_0_per_eq_adj, axis=0).sum(axis=0)
3169            / np.array([t.sum() for t in T_rec_per_eq_adj])[:, None]
3170            / SEC_PER_YEAR
3171        ).ravel()
3172        assert np.allclose(v_plate_eff_mag[0], v_plate_eff_mag)
3173        # only need to keep single value
3174        v_plate_eff_mag = v_plate_eff_mag[0]
3175        if self.enforce_v_plate:
3176            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate_inferred / v_plate_eff_mag
3177            for i in range(self.n_eq):
3178                T_rec_per_eq_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
3179            v_plate_eff_mag = self.v_plate_inferred
3180        self.v_plate_eff_mag = v_plate_eff_mag
3181        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
3182        self.T_eff = T_rec_per_eq_adj[0].sum()
3183        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
3184        # calculate plate velocity vector on all patches,
3185        # with the lower interface going the opposite direction
3186        v_scale_ratio = self.v_plate_eff_mag / self.v_plate_inferred
3187        self.v_plate_vec_eff = self.fault.v_plate_vec * v_scale_ratio
3188        """ Effective plate velocity in 3D in all patches """
3189        self.v_plate_vec_eff_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate_vec_eff, axis=1)
3190        """ Effective plate velocity magnitude in all patches """
3191        # project the plate velocity onto the DDCS
3192        self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff = (
3193            self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj * self.v_plate_vec_eff_mag[:, None]
3194        )
3195        """ Projected, effective plate velocity in DDCS """
3196
3197        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
3198        if eq_df is None:
3199            year_offsets = [
3200                (pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")).n
3201                / 365.25
3202                for i in range(self.n_eq)
3203            ]
3204            eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
3205                [
3206                    self.T_eff
3207                    - (
3208                        np.cumsum(T_rec_per_eq_adj[i])
3209                        - T_rec_per_eq_adj[i]
3210                        + year_offsets[i]
3211                    )
3212                    for i in range(self.n_eq)
3213                ]
3214            )
3215            # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
3216            eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
3217            # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
3218            eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=np.concatenate(D_0_per_eq_adj, axis=0))
3219            eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
3220            eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
3221            # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
3222            agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
3223            agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.D_0.shape[1])})
3224            eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
3225            # convert time column to index and sort
3226            eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
3227            eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
3228            assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
3229        self.eq_df = eq_df
3230        """
3231        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
3232        for each asperity based on inferred plate velocity
3233        """
3234
3235        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
3236        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
3237        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate(
3238            [[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff], self.eq_df.index.values]
3239        )
3240        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
3241        logspace = np.logspace(
3242            0, np.log10(1 + T_frac), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False
3243        )
3244        p1 = np.arange(self.n_cycles_max).reshape(-1, 1, 1) * self.T_eff
3245        p2 = i_frac_cumsum[:-1].reshape(1, -1, 1)
3246        p3 = logspace.T[None, :, :]
3247        t_eval = (p1 - 1 + p2 + p3).ravel()
3248        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
3249        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
3250        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
3251        self.t_eval = np.sort(
3252            np.concatenate([t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff])
3253        )
3254        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
3255        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
3256        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
3257
3258        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
3259        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
3260        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
3261        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
3262        self.ix_break = [
3263            i * (self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
3264            for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)
3265        ]
3266        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
3267        p1 = np.asarray(self.ix_break)[: self.n_cycles_max, None]
3268        p2 = np.arange(1, 1 + self.n_slips)[None, :]
3269        self.ix_eq = (p1 + p2 * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1).ravel().tolist()
3270        """ Indices of earthquakes """
3271
3272        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
3273        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
3274        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
3275        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
3276            t_obs_dates = t_obs.values
3277            t_obs = (
3278                self.T_eff
3279                + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)).total_seconds().values
3280                / SEC_PER_YEAR
3281            )
3282        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
3283            if np.issubdtype(t_obs.dtype, np.datetime64):
3284                t_obs_dates = t_obs
3285                t_obs = (
3286                    self.T_eff
3287                    + (pd.DatetimeIndex(t_obs) - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor))
3288                    .total_seconds()
3289                    .values
3290                    / SEC_PER_YEAR
3291                )
3292            elif np.all(t_obs <= 0):
3293                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
3294                t_obs_dates = pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor) + t_obs * pd.Timedelta(
3295                    365.25, "D"
3296                )
3297                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
3298            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), (
3299                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of "
3300                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
3301            )
3302        else:
3303            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
3304        self.t_obs = t_obs
3305        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
3306        self.t_obs_dates = t_obs_dates
3307        """ Observation timesteps [datetime format] """
3308        # combine all possible timesteps
3309        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3310        t_eval_joint = np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted))
3311        # round to nearest second for numerical stability later
3312        t_eval_joint = np.round(t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR
3313        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(t_eval_joint)
3314        """
3315        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
3316        [decimal years since cycle start]
3317        """
3318        self.t_eval_obs = pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor) + (
3319            self.t_eval[
3320                np.logical_and(
3321                    self.t_eval - self.T_eff * (self.n_cycles_max - 1)
3322                    >= self.t_obs.min(),
3323                    self.t_eval - self.T_eff * (self.n_cycles_max - 1)
3324                    <= self.t_obs.max(),
3325                )
3326            ]
3327            - self.T_eff * self.n_cycles_max
3328        ) * pd.Timedelta(365.25, "D")
3329        """
3330        Timestamps of the internal evaluation timesteps that fall within
3331        the external observation time window
3332        """
3333        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
3334        ix_break_joint = np.isin(
3335            self.t_eval_joint,
3336            np.round(self.t_eval[self.ix_break] * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR,
3337        )
3338        self.ix_break_joint = np.flatnonzero(ix_break_joint)
3339        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
3340        ix_eq_joint = np.isin(
3341            self.t_eval_joint,
3342            np.round(self.t_eval[self.ix_eq] * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR,
3343        )
3344        self.ix_eq_joint = np.flatnonzero(ix_eq_joint)
3345        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
3346        ix_obs_joint = np.isin(
3347            self.t_eval_joint, np.round(t_obs_shifted * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR
3348        )
3349        self.ix_obs_joint = np.flatnonzero(ix_obs_joint)
3350        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
3351        assert not np.any(np.logical_and(ix_break_joint, ix_eq_joint))
3352        assert ix_break_joint.sum() == len(self.ix_break)
3353        assert ix_eq_joint.sum() == len(self.ix_eq)
3354        assert ix_obs_joint.sum() == self.t_obs.size
3355
3356        # get vectors of upper plate alpha_h
3357        if alpha_h_vec is None:
3358            alpha_h_vec, dominant_bases = self.rheo.get_param_vectors(
3359                self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 0],
3360                self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 1],
3361                self.fault.inner_centroids,
3362                self.fault.outer_vertices,
3363            )
3364            alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec[:, None]
3365        else:
3366            dominant_bases = None
3367        self.alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec
3368        r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_h` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
3369        self.dominant_bases = dominant_bases
3370        """ Index of which basis function is strongest at each patch [-] """
3371
3372        # get indices of first timestep after earthquake (for resets to zero)
3373        self.slips_obs = np.logical_and(
3374            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
3375        )
3376        """ Mask of which earthquakes in a cycle are observed """
3377        self.n_slips_obs = self.slips_obs.sum()
3378        """ Number of observed earthquakes [-] """
3379        if self.n_slips_obs > 0:
3380            i_slips_obs = [
3381                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
3382                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[self.slips_obs]
3383            ]
3384        else:
3385            i_slips_obs = None
3386        self.i_slips_obs = i_slips_obs
3387        """ Indices in t_obs for first observation after earthquakes [-] """
3388
3389        # project eq_df onto each patch using the directions of v_plate to get slip
3390        if eq_slip is None:
3391            total_slip_eff_asp = self.eq_df.sum(axis=0).values
3392            assert np.allclose(total_slip_eff_asp[0] - total_slip_eff_asp, 0)
3393            total_slip_from_v_plate = (
3394                self.v_plate_vec_eff_mag * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.T_eff
3395            )
3396            total_slip_from_v_plate_asp = total_slip_from_v_plate[
3397                self.fault.s_asperities
3398            ]
3399            if self.fault.farfield_motion_type == Fault3D.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM:
3400                assert np.allclose(
3401                    total_slip_from_v_plate[0] - total_slip_from_v_plate, 0
3402                )
3403            eq_df_frac = self.eq_df / self.T_eff / self.v_plate_inferred / SEC_PER_YEAR
3404            asp_eq_slip = [
3405                eq_df_frac.values[:, jasp][:, None]
3406                * total_slip_from_v_plate_asp[
3407                    self.fault.asperity_indices[jasp][None, :]
3408                ]
3409                for jasp in range(self.fault.num_asperities)
3410            ]
3411            eq_slip = np.concatenate(asp_eq_slip, axis=1)
3412        self.eq_slip = eq_slip
3413        """ Coseismic slip magnitude for each earthquake in each asperity [m] """
3414        self.eq_ddcs_proj = (
3415            self.eq_slip[:, :, None]
3416            * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, self.fault.s_asperities, :]
3417        )
3418        """ Coseismic slip for each earthquake in each asperity in DDCS [m] """
3419
3420        # calculate slip tapering
3421        if (slip_taper_vec is None) or (
3422            (final_nonuniform_slip is not None) and (slip_taper_vec_nonuni is None)
3423        ):
3424            # evaluate tapering function
3425            dist_vals_scaled = 1 - erf(
3426                self.fault.dists_inner_asperities / self.slip_taper_distance
3427            )
3428            # subset for the closest patches
3429            dist_vals_scaled_closest = np.take_along_axis(
3430                dist_vals_scaled, self.fault.i_closest_asp_tri, axis=0
3431            )
3432
3433        # apply to uniform events
3434        if slip_taper_vec is None:
3435            # get the slip magnitude in the relevant asperity triangles
3436            rel_asp_slip = self.eq_slip[
3437                :, self.fault.i_closest_asp_tri.ravel()
3438            ].reshape(
3439                self.n_slips, self.fault.num_asperities, self.fault.inner_num_patches
3440            )
3441            # get the slip taper for each EQ, asperity, and patch
3442            slip_taper_asp = rel_asp_slip * dist_vals_scaled_closest[None, :, :]
3443            # get the maximum
3444            slip_taper_mag = np.max(slip_taper_asp, axis=1)
3445            slip_taper_vec = (
3446                slip_taper_mag[:, :, None]
3447                * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, fault.s_inner, :]
3448            )
3449        self.slip_taper_vec = slip_taper_vec
3450        """ Tapered slip vector in the inner mesh for each earthquake in DDCS [m] """
3451
3452        # get unbounded delta_tau
3453        if delta_tau_unbounded is None:
3454            delta_tau_unbounded = np.tensordot(
3455                self.fault.K_inner_asperities[:, :2, :, :2],
3456                self.eq_ddcs_proj,
3457                axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3458            ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3459        self.delta_tau_unbounded = delta_tau_unbounded
3460        """ Array of unbounded coseismic stress changes [Pa] """
3461        if delta_tau_taper is None:
3462            delta_tau_taper = np.tensordot(
3463                self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
3464                self.slip_taper_vec,
3465                axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3466            ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3467        self.delta_tau_taper = delta_tau_taper
3468        """ Array of taper-induced coseismic stress changes [Pa] """
3469        self.delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded + self.delta_tau_taper
3470        """ Bounded (tapered) coseismic stress change [Pa] """
3471
3472        # generate a copy of delta_tau_bounded with non-uniform slip, if provided
3473        if final_nonuniform_slip is not None:
3474            # check shape
3475            assert isinstance(
3476                final_nonuniform_slip, np.ndarray
3477            ), "'final_nonuniform_slip' needs to be a NumPy array"
3478            assert (
3479                final_nonuniform_slip.shape[1] == self.fault.asperities_num_patches
3480            ), (
3481                "'final_nonuniform_slip' needs to be have a exactly "
3482                f"{self.fault.asperities_num_patches} columns, got "
3483                f"{final_nonuniform_slip.shape[1]}."
3484            )
3485            n_nonuni_slips = final_nonuniform_slip.shape[0]
3486            self.eq_ddcs_proj_nonuni = (
3487                final_nonuniform_slip[:, :, None]
3488                * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, self.fault.s_asperities, :]
3489            )
3490            """ Non-uniform slip for each observed earthquake and asperity in DDCS [m] """
3491            # calculate taper
3492            if slip_taper_vec_nonuni is None:
3493                rel_asp_slip_nonuni = final_nonuniform_slip[
3494                    :, self.fault.i_closest_asp_tri.ravel()
3495                ].reshape(
3496                    n_nonuni_slips,
3497                    self.fault.num_asperities,
3498                    self.fault.inner_num_patches,
3499                )
3500                slip_taper_asp_nonuni = (
3501                    rel_asp_slip_nonuni * dist_vals_scaled_closest[None, :, :]
3502                )
3503                slip_taper_mag_nonuni = np.max(slip_taper_asp_nonuni, axis=1)
3504                slip_taper_vec_nonuni = (
3505                    slip_taper_mag_nonuni[..., None]
3506                    * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, self.fault.s_inner, :]
3507                )
3508            self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni = slip_taper_vec_nonuni
3509            """ Non-uniform tapered slip for each observed earthquake and asperity in DDCS [m] """
3510            # calculate stress changes
3511            if delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni is None:
3512                delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni = np.tensordot(
3513                    self.fault.K_inner_asperities[:, :2, :, :2],
3514                    self.eq_ddcs_proj_nonuni,
3515                    axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3516                ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3517            self.delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni = delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni
3518            """ Array of unbounded non-uniform stress changes [Pa] """
3519            if delta_tau_taper_nonuni is None:
3520                delta_tau_taper_nonuni = np.tensordot(
3521                    self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
3522                    self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni,
3523                    axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3524                ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3525            self.delta_tau_taper_nonuni = delta_tau_taper_nonuni
3526            """ Array of taper-induced non-uniform coseismic stress changes [Pa] """
3527            delta_tau_bounded_nonuni = (
3528                self.delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni + self.delta_tau_taper_nonuni
3529            )
3530        else:
3531            delta_tau_bounded_nonuni = None
3532        self.delta_tau_bounded_nonuni = delta_tau_bounded_nonuni
3533        """ Bounded non-uniform stress change [Pa] """
3534
3535        # get the additional slip during the observed period
3536        if calculate_tapered_slip:
3537            slip_taper = self.slip_taper_vec.copy()
3538            if final_nonuniform_slip is not None:
3539                slip_taper[-n_nonuni_slips:, :, :] = self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni
3540            slip_taper_strike = (
3541                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=slip_taper[:, :, 0])
3542                .cumsum(axis=0)
3543                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3544                .values.T
3545            )
3546            slip_taper_dip = (
3547                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=slip_taper[:, :, 1])
3548                .cumsum(axis=0)
3549                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3550                .values.T
3551            )
3552            self.slip_taper = np.stack([slip_taper_strike, slip_taper_dip], axis=1)
3553            """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
3554
3555        # create the Green's matrices
3556        pts_surf = np.atleast_2d(pts_surf)
3557        assert (pts_surf.ndim == 2) and (pts_surf.shape[1] in [2, 3])
3558        if pts_surf.shape[1] == 2:
3559            pts_surf = np.concatenate(
3560                [pts_surf, np.zeros((pts_surf.shape[0], 1))], axis=1
3561            )
3562        self.pts_surf = np.ascontiguousarray(pts_surf)
3563        """ Coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
3564        self.n_observers = self.pts_surf.shape[0]
3565        """ Number of observers """
3566        if G_surf is None:
3567            print("Calculating displacement kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
3568            tic = perf_counter()
3569            G_surf = Fault3D.get_disp_kernel(
3570                self.pts_surf,
3571                self.fault.joint_patches,
3572                self.fault.nu,
3573                rot_mats_tdcs=self.fault.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs,
3574            )[:, :, :, :2]
3575            toc = perf_counter()
3576            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
3577        else:
3578            assert isinstance(
3579                G_surf, np.ndarray
3580            ), f"Expected 'G_surf' NumPy array, got {type(G_surf)}."
3581            expected_shape = (self.n_observers, 3, self.fault.joint_num_patches, 2)
3582            assert (
3583                G_surf.shape == expected_shape
3584            ), f"Expected 'G_surf' shape of {expected_shape}, got {G_surf.shape}."
3585            print(f"Accepted input 'G_surf' of shape {expected_shape}.")
3586        self.G_surf = G_surf
3587        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on all patches to surface motion """
3588
3589        # get slip timeseries for the non-simulated patches
3590        if final_nonuniform_slip is None:
3591            eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs = self.eq_ddcs_proj
3592        else:
3593            eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs = self.eq_ddcs_proj.copy()
3594            eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs[-n_nonuni_slips:, :, :] = self.eq_ddcs_proj_nonuni
3595        if locked_slip is None:
3596            locked_slip_strike = (
3597                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs[:, :, 0])
3598                .cumsum(axis=0)
3599                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3600                .values.T
3601            )
3602            locked_slip_dip = (
3603                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs[:, :, 1])
3604                .cumsum(axis=0)
3605                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3606                .values.T
3607            )
3608            locked_slip = np.stack([locked_slip_strike, locked_slip_dip], axis=1)
3609        self.locked_slip = locked_slip
3610        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan """
3611        self.outer_creep_slip = (
3612            self.t_obs[None, None, :]
3613            * SEC_PER_YEAR
3614            * self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_outer, :, None]
3615        )
3616        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the outer creep patches for observation timestamps """
3617        self.lower_creep_slip = (
3618            self.t_obs[None, None, :]
3619            * SEC_PER_YEAR
3620            * self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_lower, :, None]
3621        )
3622        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the lower creep patches for observation timestamps """
3623
3624        # pre-calculate the constant stressing rate from the asperities
3625        self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate = np.tensordot(
3626            self.fault.K_inner_asperities[:, :2, :, :2],
3627            self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_asperities, :],
3628            axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)],
3629        )
3630        """ Stressing rate from the locked asperities onto the simulated patches [Pa/s] """
3631
3632        # calculate initial velocity from steady-state stress balance
3633        if v_init is None:
3634            v_plate = self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_inner, :].ravel()
3635            K_ext_v_plate = self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate.ravel()
3636            K_int = self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2].reshape(
3637                v_plate.size, v_plate.size
3638            )
3639            v_init = np.linalg.lstsq(
3640                K_int, K_int @ v_plate + K_ext_v_plate, rcond=None
3641            )[0].reshape(self.fault.inner_num_patches, 2)
3642        else:
3643            expected_shape = (self.fault.inner_num_patches, 2)
3644            assert v_init.shape == expected_shape, (
