3645                "Couldn't load initial velocities due to shape mismatch:\n"
3646                f"Loaded = {v_init.shape}, expected = {expected_shape}."
3647            )
3648        self.v_init = v_init
3649        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """
3650
3651        # get compressed version of delta_tau_bounded that only has unique events
3652        if (delta_tau_bounded_compressed is None) or (
3653            delta_tau_bounded_indices is None
3654        ):
3655            delta_tau_bounded_compressed, delta_tau_bounded_indices = np.unique(
3656                self.delta_tau_bounded, axis=0, return_inverse=True
3657            )
3658        self.delta_tau_bounded_compressed = delta_tau_bounded_compressed
3659        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] for unique events """
3660        self.delta_tau_bounded_indices = delta_tau_bounded_indices
3661        """ Indices to convert the compressed coseismic stress changes into the full ones [-] """
3662
3663    def update_rheo(self, rheo):
3664        """
3665        Update the current simulation object to match a new rheology, keeping everything else
3666        the same.
3667
3668        Parameters
3669        ----------
3670        rheo : Rheology
3671            New rheology object.
3672        """
3673        # save rheology object
3674        assert isinstance(rheo, Rheology)
3675        self.rheo = rheo
3676        # update alpha_h_vec
3677        alpha_h_vec, dominant_bases = self.rheo.get_param_vectors(
3678            self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 0],
3679            self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 1],
3680            self.fault.inner_centroids,
3681            self.fault.outer_vertices,
3682        )
3683        alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec[:, None]
3684        self.alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec
3685        self.dominant_bases = dominant_bases
3686        # done
3687
3688    def get_vels(self, state):
3689        """
3690        Calculate the observed surface velocities from different contributions.
3691
3692        Parameters
3693        ----------
3694        state : numpy.ndarray
3695            State variable of fault interface.
3696
3697        Returns
3698        -------
3699        surf_vels_sim : numpy.ndarray
3700            Surface velocities [m/s] due to the simulated part of the fault interface.
3701        surf_vels_outer : numpy.ndarray
3702            Surface velocities [m/s] due to the outer part of the fault interface.
3703        surf_vels_lower : numpy.ndarray
3704            Surface velocities [m/s] due to the lower side of the fault interface.
3705        """
3706        surf_vels_sim = get_surface_displacements(
3707            state[self.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, :],
3708            self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_inner, :],
3709        )
3710        outer_creep_vel = self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_outer, :, None]
3711        surf_vels_outer = get_surface_displacements(
3712            outer_creep_vel, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_outer, :]
3713        )
3714        lower_creep_vel = self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_lower, :, None]
3715        surf_vels_lower = get_surface_displacements(
3716            lower_creep_vel, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_lower, :]
3717        )
3718        return surf_vels_sim, surf_vels_outer, surf_vels_lower
3719
3720    def get_euler_pole_kernel(self):
3721        """
3722        Calculate the displacement kernel that applies an Euler pole rotation
3723        to the observers.
3724
3725        Returns
3726        -------
3727        G_ep : numpy.ndarray
3728            Euler pole displacement kernel of shape :math:`(m, 2, 3)`,
3729            where :math:`m` is the number of observers.
3730        """
3731        assert self.fault.utmzone is not None
3732        # calculate observer locations in ECEF and LLA coordinates
3733        crs_lla = ccrs.Geodetic()
3734        crs_utm = ccrs.UTM(zone=self.fault.utmzone)
3735        crs_xyz = ccrs.Geocentric()
3736        loc_obs_lla = crs_lla.transform_points(
3737            crs_utm, self.pts_surf[:, 0], self.pts_surf[:, 1]
3738        )
3739        loc_obs_xyz = crs_xyz.transform_points(
3740            crs_utm, self.pts_surf[:, 0], self.pts_surf[:, 1]
3741        )
3742        # create kernel
3743        R_cross_obs = [crossmat(x1, x2, x3) for x1, x2, x3 in loc_obs_xyz]
3744        R_ecef2enu_obs = [R_ecef2enu(lo, la) for lo, la in loc_obs_lla[:, :2]]
3745        G_ep = np.stack(
3746            [
3747                (R_ecef2enu_obs[i] @ R_cross_obs[i])[:2, :]
3748                for i in range(self.pts_surf.shape[0])
3749            ]
3750        )
3751        # done
3752        return G_ep
3753
3754    @staticmethod
3755    def read_config_file(config_file):
3756        """
3757        Read a configuration file and return it as parsed dictionaries.
3758
3759        Parameters
3760        ----------
3761        config_file : str
3762            Path to INI configuration file.
3763
3764        Returns
3765        -------
3766        rheo_dict : dict
3767            Parsed configuration file for the rheology object.
3768        fault_dict : dict
3769            Parsed configuration file for the fault object.
3770        sim_dict : dict
3771            Parsed configuration file for the simulation object.
3772        """
3773
3774        # load configuration file
3775        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
3776        cfg.optionxform = str
3777        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
3778            cfg.read_file(f)
3779        cfg_sim, cfg_fault, cfg_rheo = cfg["simulation"], cfg["fault"], cfg["rheology"]
3780
3781        # create rheology dictionary
3782        rheo_dict = {
3783            "v_0": cfg_rheo.getfloat("v_0"),
3784            "alpha_h_mat": np.atleast_2d(json.loads(cfg_rheo["alpha_h_mat"])),
3785            "degree": cfg_rheo.getint("degree"),
3786            "boundary_width": cfg_rheo.getfloat("boundary_width"),
3787            "alpha_h_boundary": cfg_rheo.getfloat("alpha_h_boundary"),
3788        }
3789
3790        # prepare fault dictionary
3791        farfield_motion_type = cfg_fault.getint("farfield_motion_type")
3792        if farfield_motion_type == Fault3D.FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED:
3793            farfield_motion = np.load(cfg_fault["farfield_motion"])
3794        else:
3795            farfield_motion = np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_fault["farfield_motion"]))
3796        # load custom stress kernels
3797        K_inner_asperities_file = cfg_fault.get("K_inner_asperities_file")
3798        K_inner_asperities = (
3799            None
3800            if K_inner_asperities_file is None
3801            else np.load(K_inner_asperities_file)
3802        )
3803        K_inner_inner_file = cfg_fault.get("K_inner_inner_file")
3804        K_inner_inner = (
3805            None if K_inner_inner_file is None else np.load(K_inner_inner_file)
3806        )
3807
3808        # create fault dictionary
3809        fault_dict = {
3810            "inner_mesh_files": json.loads(cfg_fault["inner_mesh_files"]),
3811            "asperity_mesh_files": json.loads(cfg_fault["asperity_mesh_files"]),
3812            "lower_mesh_files": json.loads(cfg_fault["lower_mesh_files"]),
3813            "downdip_direction": cfg_fault.get("downdip_direction"),
3814            "mu": cfg_fault.getfloat("mu"),
3815            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
3816            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
3817            "farfield_motion": farfield_motion,
3818            "farfield_motion_type": farfield_motion_type,
3819            "max_simulated_distance": cfg_fault.getfloat("max_simulated_distance"),
3820            "max_simulated_depth": cfg_fault.getfloat("max_simulated_depth"),
3821            "orient_along": cfg_fault.getfloat("orient_along"),
3822            "utmzone": cfg_fault.getint("utmzone"),
3823            "lon0": cfg_fault.getfloat("lon0"),
3824            "lat0": cfg_fault.getfloat("lat0"),
3825            "offset_lower": cfg_fault.getfloat("offset_lower", 0),
3826            "K_inner_asperities": K_inner_asperities,
3827            "K_inner_inner": K_inner_inner,
3828        }
3829
3830        # prepare simulation dictionary
3831        # load earthquake setup file
3832        eq_setup = pd.read_csv(cfg_sim.get("eq_file"), index_col=0)
3833        assert (eq_setup.shape[1] - 3) % 2 == 0
3834        num_asperities = (eq_setup.shape[1] - 3) // 2
3835        T_last = eq_setup["T_last"].tolist()
3836        T_rec = eq_setup["T_rec"].values
3837        T_rec_logsigma = eq_setup["T_rec_logsigma"].values
3838        D_0 = eq_setup[[f"D_0_{i}" for i in range(num_asperities)]].values
3839        D_0_logsigma = eq_setup[
3840            [f"D_0_logsigma_{i}" for i in range(num_asperities)]
3841        ].values
3842        # load observation timestamps
3843        t_obs = np.load(cfg_sim.get("t_obs_file"))
3844        # load observer locations
3845        obs_loc = pd.read_csv(cfg_sim.get("obs_loc_file"), index_col=0)
3846        pts_surf = obs_loc.values
3847        # load final nonuniform slip file
3848        final_nonuniform_slip_file = cfg_sim.get("final_nonuniform_slip_file")
3849        final_nonuniform_slip = (
3850            None
3851            if final_nonuniform_slip_file is None
3852            else np.load(final_nonuniform_slip_file)
3853        )
3854        # load initial velocity file
3855        v_init_file = cfg_sim.get("v_init_file")
3856        v_init = None if v_init_file is None else np.load(v_init_file)
3857        # load custom displacement kernel
3858        G_surf_file = cfg_sim.get("G_surf_file")
3859        G_surf = None if G_surf_file is None else np.load(G_surf_file)
3860
3861        # create simulation dictionary
3862        sim_dict = {
3863            "n_cycles_max": cfg_sim.getint("n_cycles_max"),
3864            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_sim.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
3865            "slip_taper_distance": cfg_sim.getfloat("slip_taper_distance"),
3866            "D_0": D_0,
3867            "D_0_logsigma": D_0_logsigma,
3868            "T_rec": T_rec,
3869            "T_rec_logsigma": T_rec_logsigma,
3870            "T_anchor": cfg_sim.get("T_anchor"),
3871            "T_last": T_last,
3872            "enforce_v_plate": cfg_sim.getboolean("enforce_v_plate"),
3873            "t_obs": t_obs,
3874            "pts_surf": pts_surf,
3875            "atol": cfg_sim.getfloat("atol"),
3876            "rtol": cfg_sim.getfloat("rtol"),
3877            "spinup_atol": cfg_sim.getfloat("spinup_atol"),
3878            "spinup_rtol": cfg_sim.getfloat("spinup_rtol"),
3879            "v_max": cfg_sim.getfloat("v_max"),
3880            "final_nonuniform_slip": final_nonuniform_slip,
3881            "G_surf": G_surf,
3882            "v_init": v_init,
3883        }
3884
3885        # done
3886        return rheo_dict, fault_dict, sim_dict
3887
3888    @classmethod
3889    def from_cfg_objs_and_files(
3890        cls,
3891        sim_dict,
3892        rheo,
3893        fault,
3894        G_surf_file=None,
3895        write_new_files=True,
3896        verbose=False,
3897    ):
3898        """
3899        Create a `SubductionSimulation3D` object from a configuration dictionary,
3900        precomputed objects and files.
3901
3902        Parameters
3903        ----------
3904        sim_dict : dict
3905            Dictionary of keyword arguments passed on to the initialization; from
3906            `SubductionSimulation3D.read_config_file`
3907        rheo : Rheology
3908            Simulated upper plate interface's rheology.
3909        fault : Fault3D
3910            Fault object
3911        G_surf_file : str, optional
3912            File name for `G_surf`
3913        write_new_files : bool, optional
3914            Whether to save to files the kernels and cross sections if they were missing
3915        verbose : bool, optional
3916            Print what's happening
3917
3918        Returns
3919        -------
3920        sim : Fault3D
3921            The new `Fault3D` object
3922        """
3923        # check for G_surf
3924        if G_surf_file is not None:
3925            try:
3926                G_surf = np.load(G_surf_file)
3927            except FileNotFoundError:
3928                G_surf = None
3929                if verbose:
3930                    print(f"Couldn't find '{G_surf_file}', " "need to recompute G_surf")
3931            else:
3932                if verbose:
3933                    print(f"Loaded G_surf from '{G_surf_file}'")
3934            if "G_surf" in sim_dict:
3935                del sim_dict["G_surf"]
3936        else:
3937            G_surf = sim_dict.pop("G_surf", None)
3938        # create new object
3939        sim = cls(**sim_dict, rheo=rheo, fault=fault, G_surf=G_surf)
3940        # save new files if desired
3941        if write_new_files:
3942            if (G_surf_file is not None) and (G_surf is None):
3943                np.save(G_surf_file, sim.G_surf)
3944                if verbose:
3945                    print(f"Saved G_surf to '{G_surf_file}'")
3946        # return new object
3947        return sim
3948
3949    def write_run_files(self, folder):
3950        """
3951        Write all the data required to run the simulation into files and save type and
3952        shape information as a JSON. Output files will be overwritten.
3953
3954        Parameters
3955        ----------
3956        folder : str
3957            Folder to use for the output files. Gets created if it doesn't exist.
3958        """
3959        # imports
3960        import json
3961        from pathlib import Path
3962
3963        # check for folder, raises error if it's a file
3964        folder = Path(folder)
3965        folder.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
3966        # set up data
3967        data = {
3968            "t_eval_joint_sec": self.t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR,
3969            "ix_break_joint": self.ix_break_joint.astype("int32"),
3970            "ix_eq_joint": self.ix_eq_joint.astype("int32"),
3971            "K_inner_inner_onfault": self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
3972            "K_inner_asperities_v_plate": self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate,
3973            "v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff_inner": self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[
3974                self.fault.s_inner, :
3975            ],
3976            "v_init": self.v_init,
3977            "delta_tau_bounded_compressed": self.delta_tau_bounded_compressed,
3978            "delta_tau_bounded_indices": self.delta_tau_bounded_indices.astype("int32"),
3979            "v_0": np.atleast_1d(self.rheo.v_0),
3980            "alpha_h_vec": np.squeeze(self.alpha_h_vec),
3981            "mu_over_2vs": np.atleast_1d(self.fault.mu_over_2vs),
3982        }
3983        # set up info dictionary
3984        info = {}
3985        # write data
3986        for key, value in data.items():
3987            # write data
3988            with open(folder / f"{key}.bin", mode="wb") as fdata:
3989                np.ascontiguousarray(value).tofile(fdata)
3990            # attach info
3991            info[key] = {"dtype": str(value.dtype), "shape": value.shape}
3992        # write info
3993        with open(folder / "runfiles.json", mode="wt") as finfo:
3994            json.dump(info, finfo, indent=2)
3995
3996    def run(self, reference_velocity_index=None, verbose=False, rho=None):
3997        """
3998        Run a full simulation.
3999        """
4000        # run forward integration
4001        if isinstance(self.rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic) or isinstance(
4002            self.rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D
4003        ):
4004            if rho is None:  # use default method
4005                sim_state = flat_run_rdlog(
4006                    self.t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR,
4007                    self.ix_break_joint,
4008                    self.ix_eq_joint,
4009                    self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
4010                    self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate,
4011                    self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_inner, :],
4012                    self.v_init,
4013                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
4014                    self.delta_tau_bounded_nonuni,
4015                    self.rheo.v_0,
4016                    self.alpha_h_vec,
4017                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
4018                    self.v_max,
4019                    self.atol,
4020                    self.rtol,
4021                    self.spinup_atol,
4022                    self.spinup_rtol,
4023                    verbose,
4024                )
4025            else:  # use regularized version
4026                sim_state = flat_run_rdreg(
4027                    self.t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR,
4028                    self.ix_break_joint,
4029                    self.ix_eq_joint,
4030                    self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
4031                    self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate,
4032                    self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_inner, :],
4033                    self.v_init,
4034                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
4035                    self.delta_tau_bounded_nonuni,
4036                    self.slip_taper_vec,
4037                    self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni,
4038                    rho,
4039                    self.alpha_h_vec,
4040                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
4041                    self.v_max,
4042                    self.atol,
4043                    self.rtol,
4044                    self.spinup_atol,
4045                    self.spinup_rtol,
4046                    verbose,
4047                )
4048        else:
4049            raise NotImplementedError
4050        # extract the observations that were actually requested
4051        obs_state = sim_state[:, :, self.ix_obs_joint]
4052        # convert to surface displacements
4053        surf_disps_sim = get_surface_displacements(
4054            obs_state[: self.fault.inner_num_patches, :, :],
4055            self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_inner, :],
4056        )
4057        surf_disps_locked = get_surface_displacements(
4058            self.locked_slip, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_asperities, :]
4059        )
4060        surf_disps_outer = get_surface_displacements(
4061            self.outer_creep_slip, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_outer, :]
4062        )
4063        surf_disps_lower = get_surface_displacements(
4064            self.lower_creep_slip, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_lower, :]
4065        )
4066        # remove effect of reference velocity on surf_disps_sim if desired
4067        if reference_velocity_index is not None:
4068            ref_patch_vel = obs_state[
4069                self.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, reference_velocity_index
4070            ]
4071            ref_surf_vel = get_surface_displacements(
4072                ref_patch_vel[:, :, None], self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_inner, :]
4073            )
4074            ref_surf_vel_ts = ref_surf_vel * (
4075                (self.t_obs - self.t_obs[0]) * SEC_PER_YEAR
4076            )
4077            surf_disps_sim -= ref_surf_vel_ts
4078        return (
4079            sim_state,
4080            obs_state,
4081            surf_disps_sim,
4082            surf_disps_locked,
4083            surf_disps_outer,
4084            surf_disps_lower,
4085        )
4086
4087    def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
4088        r"""
4089        Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens
4090        and at the beginning (taking into account NaN values).
4091
4092        Parameters
4093        ----------
4094        surf_disps : numpy.ndarray
4095            Surface displacements of shape :math:`(n_\text{stations}, 3, n_\text{observations})`
4096        """
4097        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
4098        obs_mask = np.isfinite(obs_zeroed)
4099        if not np.all(obs_mask):
4100            # need to loop over every station to find first valid observation after event
4101            periods_from = [0] + self.i_slips_obs
4102            periods_to = self.i_slips_obs + [obs_zeroed.shape[2]]
4103            for i_stat in range(obs_zeroed.shape[0]):
4104                for i_comp in range(obs_zeroed.shape[1]):
4105                    # iterate over all periods between bounds or earthquakes
4106                    for i_from, i_to in zip(periods_from, periods_to):
4107                        offset = None
4108                        for j in range(i_from, i_to):
4109                            # skip if data is masked
4110                            if obs_mask[i_stat, i_comp, j]:
4111                                if offset is None:
4112                                    # save new offset for this period
4113                                    offset = obs_zeroed[i_stat, i_comp, j]
4114                                # apply current offset
4115                                obs_zeroed[i_stat, i_comp, j] -= offset
4116        else:
4117            # no NaNs
4118            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, :, 0][:, :, None]
4119            if self.i_slips_obs is not None:
4120                for i in range(self.n_slips_obs):
4121                    obs_zeroed[:, :, self.i_slips_obs[i] :] -= obs_zeroed[
4122                        :, :, self.i_slips_obs[i]
4123                    ][:, :, None]
4124        return obs_zeroed
4125
4126    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
4127        """
4128        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
4129
4130        Parameters
4131        ----------
4132        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
4133            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
4134        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
4135            Noisy surface observations.
4136
4137        Returns
4138        -------
4139        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4140        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4141        """
4142        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4143
4144        # some helper variables
4145        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf[:, 0])
4146        i_off = 1.5 * np.std(obs_zeroed, axis=(0, 2))
4147        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
4148        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
4149            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
4150        )
4151        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
4152        if n_slips_obs > 0:
4153            i_slips_obs = [
4154                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
4155                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
4156            ]
4157            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
4158        else:
4159            t_last_slips = []
4160        # start plot
4161        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=3, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
4162        for tslip in t_last_slips:
4163            for a in ax:
4164                a.axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
4165        for j, io in enumerate(i_off):
4166            for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
4167                if obs_noisy is not None:
4168                    ax[j].plot(
4169                        self.t_obs,
4170                        obs_noisy[ix, j, :] + i * io,
4171                        ".",
4172                        c="k",
4173                        rasterized=True,
4174                    )
4175                ax[j].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, j, :] + i * io, c=f"C{i}")
4176            ax[j].set_ylabel(f"$x_{j + 1}$ [m]")
4177        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
4178        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
4179        return fig, ax
4180
4181    def plot_eq_stress(self, tdcs=True):
4182        """
4183        Plot the stress changes induced by the different earthquakes.
4184
4185        Parameters
4186        ----------
4187        tdcs : bool, optional
4188            If ``True`` (default), plot in TDCS, otherwise in DDCS.
4189
4190        Returns
4191        -------
4192        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4193        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4194        """
4195        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4196        import matplotlib.gridspec as gridspec
4197        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm, Normalize
4198        from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
4199        from cmcrameri import cm
4200
4201        # get unique earthquakes
4202        (
4203            _,
4204            unique_indices,
4205        ) = np.unique(self.eq_df.values, True, axis=0)
4206        n_unique = unique_indices.size
4207        # rotate if necessary
4208        if tdcs:
4209            labels = ["Magnitude", "Strike", "Dip"]
4210            delta_tau_bounded = np.einsum(
4211                "ikj,lik->lij",
4212                self.fault.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2],
4213                self.delta_tau_bounded,
4214            )
4215            eq_proj = np.einsum(
4216                "ikj,lik->lij",
4217                self.fault.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2],
4218                self.eq_ddcs_proj,
4219            )
4220        else:
4221            labels = ["Magnitude", "$R-45$", "$R+45$"]
4222            delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_bounded
4223            eq_proj = self.eq_ddcs_proj
4224        # get slip data range and norm
4225        s_max = np.ceil(np.max(self.eq_df.max()))
4226        s_norm = Normalize(vmin=-s_max, vmax=s_max)
4227        eq_proj_mag = np.linalg.norm(eq_proj, axis=2)
4228        # start figures
4229        figs = [plt.figure() for _ in range(n_unique)]
4230        axes = []
4231        for i, fig in enumerate(figs):
4232            gs = gridspec.GridSpec(2, 20, figure=fig)
4233            ax_mag = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :10], projection="3d")
4234            ax_cbar_tau = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 12])
4235            ax_cbar_slip = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 17])
4236            ax_dip = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, :10], projection="3d")
4237            ax_strike = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 10:], projection="3d")
4238            axes3d = [ax_mag, ax_dip, ax_strike]
4239            axes.append(axes3d)
4240            colls_inner = [None for _ in range(3)]
4241            colls_asp = [None for _ in range(3)]
4242            for j, ax in enumerate(axes3d):
4243                # plot inner mesh
4244                colls_inner[j] = ax.plot_trisurf(
4245                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4246                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4247                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4248                    triangles=self.fault.inner_triangles,
4249                    antialiased=True,
4250                    linewidths=0,
4251                )
4252                # plot asperities
4253                colls_asp[j] = ax.plot_trisurf(
4254                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4255                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4256                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4257                    triangles=self.fault.asperities_triangles,
4258                    antialiased=True,
4259                    linewidths=0,
4260                )
4261                # make prettier
4262                ax.view_init(elev=20, azim=-135)
4263                ax.set_title(labels[j])
4264                ax.set_xlabel("E [km]")
4265                ax.set_ylabel("N [km]")
4266                ax.set_zlabel("U [km]")
4267                ax.set_box_aspect(
4268                    [
4269                        ub - lb
4270                        for lb, ub in (getattr(ax, f"get_{a}lim")() for a in "xyz")
4271                    ]
4272                )
4273            # create data norms for delta_tau
4274            dtau = delta_tau_bounded[unique_indices[i], :, :]
4275            dtau_mag = np.linalg.norm(dtau, axis=1)
4276            dtau_mag_oom = 10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(dtau_mag)))
4277            dtau_norm = SymLogNorm(
4278                vmin=-dtau_mag_oom, vmax=dtau_mag_oom, linthresh=dtau_mag_oom / 1e3
4279            )
4280            # color inner mesh according to stress change in the different components, and
4281            # color asperities according to slip
4282            # top left: magnitude
4283            colls_inner[0].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau_mag])
4284            colls_asp[0].set_facecolor(
4285                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj_mag[unique_indices[i], :]]
4286            )
4287            # bottom left: strike
4288            colls_inner[1].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau[:, 0]])
4289            colls_asp[1].set_facecolor(
4290                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj[unique_indices[i], :, 0]]
4291            )
4292            # bottom right: dip
4293            colls_inner[2].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau[:, 1]])
4294            colls_asp[2].set_facecolor(
4295                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj[unique_indices[i], :, 1]]
4296            )
4297            # add colorbars
4298            fig.colorbar(
4299                ScalarMappable(norm=dtau_norm, cmap=cm.vik),
4300                cax=ax_cbar_tau,
4301                label=r"$\Delta \tau$ [Pa]",
4302            )
4303            fig.colorbar(
4304                ScalarMappable(norm=s_norm, cmap=cm.bam),
4305                cax=ax_cbar_slip,
4306                label=r"$\Delta s$ [m]",
4307            )
4308        # finish
4309        return figs, axes
4310
4311    def plot_field(self, quantity, log=True, label=None):
4312        """
4313        Plot a quantity on top of the fault mesh.
4314
4315        Parameters
4316        ----------
4317        quantity : numpy.ndarray
4318            Field quantity of the same shape as the inner mesh.
4319        log : bool, optional
4320            If ``True`` (default), use a logarithmic colorscale.
4321        label : str, optional
4322            Label of the colorbar.
4323
4324        Returns
4325        -------
4326        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4327        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4328        """
4329        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4330        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm, LogNorm, Normalize
4331        from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
4332        from cmcrameri import cm
4333
4334        # check data input size
4335        assert isinstance(quantity, np.ndarray)
4336        assert quantity.size == self.fault.inner_num_patches, (
4337            f"Expected input quantity to be of size {self.fault.inner_num_patches}, "
4338            f"got {quantity.shape}"
4339        )
4340        # get data range and norm
4341        if log:
4342            q_oom = 10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(np.abs(quantity))))
4343            if np.any(quantity < 0):
4344                q_norm = SymLogNorm(vmin=-q_oom, vmax=q_oom, linthresh=q_oom / 1e5)
4345                q_cmap = cm.vik
4346            else:
4347                q_norm = LogNorm(
4348                    vmin=10 ** np.floor(np.log10(np.min(quantity))), vmax=q_oom
4349                )
4350                q_cmap = cm.batlow
4351        else:
4352            q_absmax = np.max(np.abs(quantity))
4353            if np.any(quantity < 0):
4354                q_norm = Normalize(vmin=-q_absmax, vmax=q_absmax)
4355                q_cmap = cm.vik
4356            else:
4357                q_norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=q_absmax)
4358                q_cmap = cm.batlow
4359        # start figure
4360        fig = plt.figure()
4361        ax = fig.add_subplot(projection="3d")
4362        # plot inner mesh
4363        coll = ax.plot_trisurf(
4364            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4365            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4366            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4367            triangles=self.fault.inner_triangles,
4368            antialiased=True,
4369            linewidths=0,
4370        )
4371        # make prettier
4372        ax.view_init(elev=20, azim=-135)
4373        ax.set_xlabel("E [km]")
4374        ax.set_ylabel("N [km]")
4375        ax.set_zlabel("U [km]")
4376        ax.set_box_aspect(
4377            [ub - lb for lb, ub in (getattr(ax, f"get_{a}lim")() for a in "xyz")]
4378        )
4379        # set mesh colors
4380        coll.set_facecolor([q_cmap(q_norm(q)) for q in quantity])
4381        # add colorbar
4382        fig.colorbar(ScalarMappable(norm=q_norm, cmap=q_cmap), ax=ax, label=label)
4383        # finish
4384        return fig, ax
4385
4386
4387@dataclass
4388class SEASResult:
4389    """Class that contains self-consistent fault, surface, and rheological data"""
4390
4391    slip: np.ndarray | None = None
4392    sliprate: np.ndarray | None = None
4393    disp: np.ndarray | None = None
4394    vel: np.ndarray | None = None
4395    v_plate: np.ndarray | None = None
4396    alpha_h: np.ndarray | None = None
4397    t_eff: float | None = None
4398    n_samples: int | None = field(init=False)
4399    n_patches: int | None = field(init=False)
4400    n_stations: int | None = field(init=False)
4401    n_observations: int | None = field(init=False)
4402    _slipdeficit: np.ndarray | None = field(default=None, init=False)
4403    _coupling: np.ndarray | None = field(default=None, init=False)
4404    _global_mask: np.ndarray | None = field(default=None, init=False)
4405
4406    def __post_init__(self):
4407        """Perform checks and initialize sizes"""
4408        n_dims = [
4409            arr.ndim
4410            for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate, self.disp, self.vel]
4411            if arr is not None
4412        ]
4413        if len(n_dims) > 0:
4414            assert len(set(n_dims)) == 1
4415            n_dims = n_dims[0]
4416            if n_dims == 3:
4417                dim_off = 0
4418                self.n_samples = 1
4419            elif n_dims == 4:
4420                dim_off = 1
4421                n_samples = [
4422                    arr.shape[0]
4423                    for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate, self.disp, self.vel]
4424                    if arr is not None
4425                ]
4426                assert len(set(n_samples)) == 1
4427                self.n_samples = n_samples[0]
4428            else:
4429                raise ValueError
4430            n_observations = [
4431                arr.shape[dim_off + 2]
4432                for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate, self.disp, self.vel]
4433                if arr is not None
4434            ]
4435            assert len(set(n_observations)) == 1
4436            self.n_observations = n_observations[0]
4437            n_stations = [
4438                arr.shape[dim_off + 0]
4439                for arr in [self.disp, self.vel]
4440                if arr is not None
4441            ]
4442            assert len(set(n_stations)) == 1
4443            self.n_stations = n_stations[0]
4444            n_patches = [
4445                arr.shape[dim_off + 0]
4446                for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate]
4447                if arr is not None
4448            ]
4449            assert len(set(n_patches)) == 1
4450            self.n_patches = n_patches[0]
4451        else:
4452            n_dims = None  # no time-variable arrays
4453            self.n_samples = None
4454            self.n_observations = None
4455            self.n_stations = None
4456            self.n_patches = None
4457        if self.v_plate is not None:
4458            assert self.v_plate.shape[1] == 2
4459            if self.n_patches is None:
4460                self.n_patches = self.v_plate.shape[0]
4461            else:
4462                assert self.n_patches == self.v_plate.shape[0]
4463        if self.alpha_h is not None:
4464            if self.alpha_h.ndim == 1:
4465                dim_off = 0
4466                if self.n_samples is None:
4467                    self.n_samples = 1
4468                else:
4469                    assert self.n_samples == 1
4470            elif self.alpha_h.ndim == 2:
4471                dim_off = 1
4472                if self.n_samples is None:
4473                    self.n_samples = self.alpha_h.shape[0]
4474                else:
4475                    assert self.n_samples == self.alpha_h.shape[0]
4476            else:
4477                raise ValueError
4478            if self.n_patches is None:
4479                self.n_patches = self.alpha_h.shape[dim_off + 0]
4480            else:
4481                assert self.n_patches == self.alpha_h.shape[dim_off + 0]
4482
4483    def __repr__(self):
4484        """String representation of object"""
4485        dims_str = ", ".join(
4486            [
4487                f"{n}={getattr(self, n)}"
4488                for n in [
4489                    "n_samples",
4490                    "n_observations",
4491                    "n_stations",
4492                    "n_patches",
4493                    "t_eff",
4494                ]
4495            ]
4496        )
4497        repr_str = f"SEASResult({dims_str}):\n"
4498        repr_str += "\n".join(
4499            [
4500                f"  {n}: {'missing' if getattr(self, n) is None
4501                       else str(getattr(self, n).shape)}"
4502                for n in ["slip", "sliprate", "disp", "vel", "v_plate", "alpha_h"]
4503            ]
4504        )
4505        return repr_str
4506
4507    def get_slipdeficit(self):
4508        """
4509        Calculate the slip deficit on the fault.
4510
4511        Returns
4512        -------
4513        numpy.ndarray
4514            Normalized slip dificit with shape `(n_samples, n_patches, n_observations).
4515        """
4516        if (self.slip is None) or (self.v_plate is None) or (self.t_eff is None):
4517            raise ValueError(
4518                "Need 'slip', 'v_plate', and 't_eff' to be set "
4519                "to calculate slip deficit."
4520            )
4521        else:
4522            v_plate_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate, axis=1)
4523            slip_vp = np.linalg.norm(self.slip, axis=-2) * np.cos(
4524                np.pi / 4 - np.arctan2(self.slip[..., 1, :], self.slip[..., 0, :])
4525            )
4526            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4527                return 1 - slip_vp / (v_plate_mag[:, None] * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.t_eff)
4528            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4529                return 1 - slip_vp / (
4530                    v_plate_mag[None, :, None] * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.t_eff
4531                )
4532
4533    @property
4534    def slipdeficit(self):
4535        # need to calculate if it's the first time
4536        if self._slipdeficit is None:
4537            self._slipdeficit = self.get_slipdeficit()
4538        # return calculated value
4539        return self._slipdeficit
4540
4541    def get_coupling(self):
4542        """
4543        Calculate the kinematic coupling on the fault.
4544
4545        Returns
4546        -------
4547        numpy.ndarray
4548            Normalized kinematic coupling, same shape as `slip`.
4549        """
4550        if (self.sliprate is None) or (self.v_plate is None):
4551            raise ValueError(
4552                "Need 'sliprate' and 'v_plate' to be set "
4553                "to calculate kinematic coupling."
4554            )
4555        else:
4556            v_plate_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate, axis=1)
4557            sliprate_vp = np.linalg.norm(self.sliprate, axis=-2) * np.cos(
4558                np.pi / 4
4559                - np.arctan2(self.sliprate[..., 1, :], self.sliprate[..., 0, :])
4560            )
4561            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4562                return 1 - sliprate_vp / v_plate_mag[:, None]
4563            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4564                return 1 - sliprate_vp / v_plate_mag[None, :, None]
4565
4566    @property
4567    def coupling(self):
4568        # need to calculate if it's the first time
4569        if self._coupling is None:
4570            self._coupling = self.get_coupling()
4571        # return calculated value
4572        return self._coupling
4573
4574    def get_global_mask(self):
4575        """
4576        Calculate indices where all displacements are missing.
4577
4578        Returns
4579        -------
4580        numpy.ndarray
4581            List of indices [-].
4582        """
4583        if self.disp is None:
4584            raise ValueError("Need 'disp' to be set to calculate mask.")
4585        else:
4586            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4587                return np.flatnonzero(np.all(np.isnan(self.disp), axis=(0, 1)))
4588            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4589                return np.flatnonzero(np.all(np.isnan(self.disp[0, ...]), axis=(0, 1)))
4590
4591    @property
4592    def global_mask(self):
4593        # need to calculate if it's the first time
4594        if self._global_mask is None:
4595            self._global_mask = self.get_global_mask()
4596        # return calculated value
4597        return self._global_mask
4598
4599    @classmethod
4600    def from_sim_run_output(
4601        cls, sim, sim_state, surf_disps_sim, surf_disps_outer, surf_disps_lower
4602    ):
4603        """
4604        Create a SEASResult object from the the output of `SubductionSimulation3D.run`.
4605
4606        Parameters
4607        ----------
4608        sim : SubductionSimulation3D
4609            Simulation object
4610        obs_state : numpy.ndarray
4611            `obs_state` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4612        surf_disps_sim : numpy.ndarray
4613            `surf_disps_sim` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4614        surf_disps_outer : numpy.ndarray
4615            `surf_disps_outer` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4616        surf_disps_lower : numpy.ndarray
4617            `surf_disps_lower` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4618
4619        Returns
4620        -------
4621        SEASResult
4622        """
4623        slip = (
4624            sim_state[: sim.fault.inner_num_patches, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]
4625            - sim_state[: sim.fault.inner_num_patches, :, sim.ix_break_joint[-2]][
4626                :, :, None
4627            ]
4628            + sim.slip_taper
4629        )
4630        sliprate = sim_state[sim.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]
4631        disp = sim.zero_obs_at_eq(surf_disps_sim + surf_disps_outer + surf_disps_lower)
4632        vel = sum(sim.get_vels(sim_state[:, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]))
4633        v_plate = sim.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[sim.fault.s_inner, :]
4634        alpha_h = sim.alpha_h_vec
4635        return cls(slip, sliprate, disp, vel, v_plate, alpha_h)
4636
4637    @staticmethod
4638    def load(path):
4639        """Load a pickled instance of this object"""
4640        with open(path, mode="rb") as f:
4641            return pickle.load(f)
4642
4643    def save(self, path):
4644        """Save instance to a pickled file"""
4645        with open(path, "wb") as f:
4646            pickle.dump(self, f, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)
SEC_PER_YEAR = 31557600.0

Seconds per decimal year of 365.25 days

def R_ecef2enu(lon, lat): 
32def R_ecef2enu(lon, lat):
33    """
34    Generate the rotation matrix used to express a vector written in ECEF (XYZ)
35    coordinates as a vector written in local east, north, up (ENU) coordinates
36    at the position defined by geodetic latitude and longitude. See Chapter 4
37    and Appendix 4.A in [misraenge2010]_ for details.
38
39    Parameters
40    ----------
41    lon : float
42        Longitude [] of vector position.
43    lat : float
44        Latitude [] of vector position.
45
46    Returns
47    -------
48        The 3-by-3 rotation matrix.
49
50    References
51    ----------
52
53    .. [misraenge2010] Misra, P., & Enge, P. (2010),
54       *Global Positioning System: Signals, Measurements, and Performance*,
55       Lincoln, Mass: Ganga-Jamuna Press.
56
57    """
58    try:
59        lon, lat = np.deg2rad(float(lon)), np.deg2rad(float(lat))
60    except (TypeError, ValueError) as e:
61        raise ValueError(
62            "Input longitude & latitude are not convertible to scalars "
63            f"(got {lon} and {lat})."
64        ).with_traceback(e.__traceback__) from e
65    return np.array(
66        [
67            [-np.sin(lon), np.cos(lon), 0],
68            [-np.sin(lat) * np.cos(lon), -np.sin(lat) * np.sin(lon), np.cos(lat)],
69            [np.cos(lat) * np.cos(lon), np.cos(lat) * np.sin(lon), np.sin(lat)],
70        ]
71    )

Generate the rotation matrix used to express a vector written in ECEF (XYZ) coordinates as a vector written in local east, north, up (ENU) coordinates at the position defined by geodetic latitude and longitude. See Chapter 4 and Appendix 4.A in [misraenge2010]_ for details.

Parameters
  • lon (float): Longitude [] of vector position.
  • lat (float): Latitude [] of vector position.
Returns
  • The 3-by-3 rotation matrix.
References

.. [misraenge2010] Misra, P., & Enge, P. (2010), Global Positioning System: Signals, Measurements, and Performance, Lincoln, Mass: Ganga-Jamuna Press.

def crossmat(x1: float, x2: float, x3: float) -> numpy.ndarray: 
74def crossmat(x1: float, x2: float, x3: float) -> np.ndarray:
75    """
76    Create the matrix for an input vector that if premultiplied with another
77    vector will give the same results as cross-multiplying the other vector
78    with the input vector.
79
80    Parameters
81    ----------
82    x1
83        First element
84    x2
85        Second element
86    x3
87        Third element
88
89    Returns
90    -------
91        Cross-product matrix
92    """
93    return np.array([[0, x3, -x2], [-x3, 0, x1], [x2, -x1, 0]])

Create the matrix for an input vector that if premultiplied with another vector will give the same results as cross-multiplying the other vector with the input vector.

Parameters
  • x1: First element
  • x2: Second element
  • x3: Third element
Returns
  • Cross-product matrix
def correct_custom_utm(coordinates, utmzone, lon0, lat0): 
 96def correct_custom_utm(coordinates, utmzone, lon0, lat0):
 97    """
 98    Correct for a custom UTM Longitude/Latitude offsets by converting input coordinates
 99    back into Longitude/Latitude, re-adding the offsets, and then converting it back to UTM.
100
101    Parameters
102    ----------
103    coordinates : numpy.ndarray
104        2D ECEF pseudo-UTM coordinates [m]
105    utmzone : int
106        UTM zone
107    lon0 : float, optional
108        Longitude offset []
109    lat0 : float, optional
110        Latitude offset []
111
112    Returns
113    -------
114    coordinates_utm : numpy.ndarray
115        2D coordinates in standard UTM [m]
116    """
117    # define coordinate systems
118    crs_lla = ccrs.Geodetic()
119    crs_utm = ccrs.UTM(zone=utmzone)
120    # get reference point in UTM
121    coords_ref = np.array(crs_utm.transform_point(lon0, lat0, crs_lla))
122    # add reference to current coordinates
123    coordinates_utm = coordinates + coords_ref[None, :]
124    # # convert to lon/lat
125    # coordinates_lla = crs_lla.transform_points(
126    #     crs_utm, coordinates[:, 0], coordinates[:, 1])
127    # # add offsets
128    # if lon0 is not None:
129    #     coordinates_lla[:, 0] += lon0
130    # if lat0 is not None:
131    #     coordinates_lla[:, 1] += lat0
132    # # convert back to UTM
133    # coordinates_utm = crs_utm.transform_points(
134    #     crs_lla, coordinates_lla[:, 0], coordinates_lla[:, 1])[:, :2]
135    # done
136    return coordinates_utm

Correct for a custom UTM Longitude/Latitude offsets by converting input coordinates back into Longitude/Latitude, re-adding the offsets, and then converting it back to UTM.

Parameters
  • coordinates (numpy.ndarray): 2D ECEF pseudo-UTM coordinates [m]
  • utmzone (int): UTM zone
  • lon0 (float, optional): Longitude offset []
  • lat0 (float, optional): Latitude offset []
Returns
  • coordinates_utm (numpy.ndarray): 2D coordinates in standard UTM [m]
def read_tet(filename, delete_invalid=True): 
139def read_tet(filename, delete_invalid=True):
140    r"""Read .tet files
141
142    Open a `.tet` file and read the :math:`m` vertices and :math:`n` triangles.
143    It checks for duplicate vertices and eliminates them.
144
145    Parameters
146    ----------
147    filename : str
148        Path to the .tet file
149
150    Returns
151    -------
152    vertices : numpy.ndarray
153        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations
154    triangles : numpy.ndarray
155        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle
156
157    Raises
158    ------
159    RuntimeWarning
160        If not all triangles are triangles or if they have extreme aspect ratios.
161    """
162    # get line number where it switches from vertices to triangles
163    with open(filename, mode="rt") as f:
164        for m, line in enumerate(f):
165            if "TRGL" in line:
166                break
167    # load vertices
168    vertices = np.loadtxt(filename, max_rows=m, usecols=(2, 3, 4), dtype=float)
169    # load triangles
170    triangles = np.loadtxt(filename, skiprows=m, usecols=(1, 2, 3), dtype=int) - 1
171    # check for duplicate vertices
172    vertices, triangles = remove_duplicate_vertices(vertices, triangles)
173    # check triangles
174    invalid_tris = np.flatnonzero([np.unique(tri).size != 3 for tri in triangles])
175    if delete_invalid:
176        del_ix = []
177    if invalid_tris.size > 0:
178        warn(
179            f"Invalid triangle(s) in file '{filename}' found at line(s)"
180            f" {invalid_tris + 1 + m}",
181            RuntimeWarning,
182        )
183        if delete_invalid:
184            del_ix.extend(invalid_tris.tolist())
185    # check aspect ratios
186    ratios = np.empty(triangles.shape[0])
187    for i, subtri in enumerate(vertices[triangles]):
188        elens = cdist(subtri, subtri).ravel()[[1, 2, 5]]
189        ratios[i] = elens.max() / elens.min()
190    if np.any(np.log10(ratios) > 1):
191        liney_tris = np.flatnonzero(np.log10(ratios) > 1)
192        ratioinfo = "\n".join(
193            [f"line={i + 1 + m}, index={i}, ratio={ratios[i]}" for i in liney_tris]
194        )
195        warn(
196            f"Found triangles with large aspect ratio in file '{filename}' "
197            f"at:\n{ratioinfo}",
198            RuntimeWarning,
199        )
200        if delete_invalid:
201            del_ix.extend(liney_tris.tolist())
202    # delete triangles if desired, keeping vertices without checking if needed
203    if delete_invalid:
204        del_ix = list(set(del_ix))
205        keep = np.ones(triangles.shape[0], dtype=bool)
206        keep[del_ix] = False
207        triangles = triangles[keep, :]
208    # done
209    return vertices, triangles

Read .tet files

Open a .tet file and read the \( m \) vertices and \( n \) triangles. It checks for duplicate vertices and eliminates them.

Parameters
  • filename (str): Path to the .tet file
Returns
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle
Raises
  • RuntimeWarning: If not all triangles are triangles or if they have extreme aspect ratios.
def write_tet(filename, vertices, triangles): 
212def write_tet(filename, vertices, triangles):
213    r"""Write .tet files
214
215    Write :math:`m` vertices and :math:`n` triangles to a `.tet` file.
216
217    Parameters
218    ----------
219    filename : str
220        Path to the .tet file
221    vertices : numpy.ndarray
222        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations
223    triangles : numpy.ndarray
224        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle
225    """
226    # check
227    assert triangles.ndim == vertices.ndim == 2
228    assert np.max(triangles) == vertices.shape[0] - 1
229    # get line number where it switches from vertices to triangles
230    with open(filename, mode="wt") as f:
231        for i, v in enumerate(vertices):
232            f.write(f"VRTX {i + 1} {v[0]:f} {v[1]:f} {v[2]:f}\n")
233        for i, t in enumerate(triangles + 1):
234            f.write(f"TRGL {t[0]:d} {t[1]:d} {t[2]:d}\n")
235    # done
236    return

Write .tet files

Write \( m \) vertices and \( n \) triangles to a .tet file.

Parameters
  • filename (str): Path to the .tet file
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle
def force_normals(vertices, triangles, normals_up): 
239def force_normals(vertices, triangles, normals_up):
240    """
241    Enforce a direction for all the normals in the mesh.
242
243    Parameters
244    ----------
245    vertices : numpy.ndarray
246        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations
247    triangles : numpy.ndarray
248        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle
249    normals_up : bool
250        If ``True``, force the normals to point upwards, if ``False``, downwards
251
252    Returns
253    -------
254    vertices : numpy.ndarray
255        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations
256    triangles : numpy.ndarray
257        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle
258    """
259    # get current orientations
260    signs = np.sign(
261        [
262            np.cross(
263                vertices[triangles[i, 1]] - vertices[triangles[i, 0]],
264                vertices[triangles[i, 2]] - vertices[triangles[i, 0]],
265            )
266            for i in range(triangles.shape[0])
267        ]
268    )
269    # find the ones that need to be flipped
270    if normals_up:
271        change_dirs = signs[:, 2] < 0
272    else:
273        change_dirs = signs[:, 2] > 0
274    # flip by changing the order of the second and third element
275    if change_dirs.sum() > 0:
276        triangles[np.ix_(change_dirs, [1, 2])] = triangles[np.ix_(change_dirs, [2, 1])]
277    # done
278    return vertices, triangles

Enforce a direction for all the normals in the mesh.

Parameters
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle
  • normals_up (bool): If True, force the normals to point upwards, if False, downwards
Returns
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle
def combine_tet(*args, return_sources=False): 
281def combine_tet(*args, return_sources=False):
282    """
283    Combine multiple .tet files into a single combination of :math:`m` vertices
284    and :math:`n` triangles. It checks for duplicate vertices and eliminates them.
285    Parameters
286    ----------
287    *args : tuple
288        Paths to `.tet` mesh files.
289    return_sources : bool, optional
290        If ``True``, return a nested list matching each triangle index to a
291        source file
292
293    Returns
294    -------
295    vertices : numpy.ndarray
296        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations
297    triangles : numpy.ndarray
298        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle
299    match_sources : list
300        Nested list that contains the indices of the triangles belonging to
301        each individual source mesh file (i.e., the ith list in `match_sources`
302        contains all the indices for the ith file).
303    """
304
305    # quick return if it's just a single mesh
306    if len(args) == 1:
307        vertices, triangles = read_tet(args[0])
308        if return_sources:
309            match_sources = [np.arange(triangles.shape[0])]
310
311    # full workflow
312    else:
313
314        # load meshes
315        list_verts_tris = [read_tet(mf) for mf in args]
316        list_num_vertices = [vt[0].shape[0] for vt in list_verts_tris]
317        list_num_patches = [vt[1].shape[0] for vt in list_verts_tris]
318        num_vertices = sum(list_num_vertices)
319        num_patches = sum(list_num_patches)
320
321        # create empty arrays
322        vertices = np.empty((num_vertices, 3))
323        triangles = np.empty((num_patches, 3), dtype=int)
324
325        # fill them sequentially
326        # this also make the triangle indices continuous
327        iv, it = 0, 0
328        for vt, nv, nt in zip(list_verts_tris, list_num_vertices, list_num_patches):
329            vertices[iv : iv + nv, :] = vt[0]
330            triangles[it : it + nt, :] = vt[1] + iv
331            iv += nv
332            it += nt
333        assert num_vertices == iv, f"{num_vertices} != {iv}"
334        assert num_patches == it, f"{num_patches} != {it}"
335        assert triangles.max() < num_vertices, f"{triangles.max()} >= {num_vertices}!"
336
337        # check for duplicate vertices
338        vertices, triangles, old_indices = remove_duplicate_vertices(
339            vertices, triangles, return_old_indices=True
340        )
341
342        # if desired, create list of source indices
343        if return_sources:
344            # create raw list
345            num_sources = len(list_verts_tris)
346            match_sources = [
347                np.arange(sum(list_num_patches[:i]), sum(list_num_patches[: i + 1]))
348                for i in range(num_sources)
349            ]
350            # update it from the deduplicated set
351            if old_indices is not None:
352                for inew, iold in enumerate(old_indices):
353                    for i in range(num_sources):
354                        match_sources[i][match_sources[i] == iold] = inew
355
356    # done
357    if return_sources:
358        return vertices, triangles, match_sources
359    else:
360        return vertices, triangles

Combine multiple .tet files into a single combination of \( m \) vertices and \( n \) triangles. It checks for duplicate vertices and eliminates them.

Parameters
  • *args (tuple): Paths to .tet mesh files.
  • return_sources (bool, optional): If True, return a nested list matching each triangle index to a source file
Returns
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle
  • match_sources (list): Nested list that contains the indices of the triangles belonging to each individual source mesh file (i.e., the ith list in match_sources contains all the indices for the ith file).
def remove_duplicate_vertices(vertices, triangles, return_old_indices=False): 
363def remove_duplicate_vertices(vertices, triangles, return_old_indices=False):
364    """
365    Given a set of vertices and triangles, remove any potentially
366    present duplicate vertices.
367
368    Parameters
369    ----------
370    vertices : numpy.ndarray
371        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations
372    triangles : numpy.ndarray
373        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle
374    return_old_indices : bool, optional
375        If ``True``, return a list that matches old vertex indices to
376        the new ones.
377
378    Returns
379    -------
380    vertices : numpy.ndarray
381        :math:`(m, 3)` array of vertices locations without duplicates
382    triangles : numpy.ndarray
383        :math:`(n, 3)` array of vertex indices forming a triangle, reindexed
384    old_indices : numpy.ndarray
385        Array containing all the old indices, indexed to the new ones.
386    """
387
388    # check if there are duplicates
389    _, unique_indices, unique_counts = np.unique(
390        vertices, return_index=True, return_counts=True, axis=0
391    )
392
393    # there are duplicate values
394    if np.any(unique_counts > 1):
395        # sort the unique indices
396        isort = np.argsort(unique_indices)
397        unique_indices = unique_indices[isort]
398        unique_counts = unique_counts[isort]
399        # keep old state for testing
400        old_patches = vertices[triangles]
401        # release ties to previous variables
402        vertices = vertices.copy()
403        triangles = triangles.copy()
404        # match unique to duplicate vertex indices
405        match_indices = {
406            i: [
407                j
408                for j in np.flatnonzero(np.all(vertices == vertices[i, :], axis=1))
409                if j not in unique_indices
410            ]
411            for ii, i in enumerate(unique_indices)
412            if unique_counts[ii] > 1
413        }
414        duplicate_indices = [
415            i for i in range(vertices.shape[0]) if i not in unique_indices
416        ]
417        # double-check that every duplicate index is taken care of
418        assert all(
419            [
420                di in [mi for sublist in match_indices.values() for mi in sublist]
421                for di in duplicate_indices
422            ]
423        )
424        # loop over every duplicate element
425        for iuniq, idups in match_indices.items():
426            # replace the duplicate index with the unique one
427            triangles[np.isin(triangles, idups)] = iuniq
428        # re-index all the vertices
429        old_indices = np.arange(vertices.shape[0])[unique_indices]
430        for inew, iold in enumerate(old_indices):
431            triangles[triangles == iold] = inew
432        # delete all duplicate rows
433        vertices = vertices[unique_indices, :]
434        # check that everything has worked
435        new_patches = vertices[triangles]
436        assert np.all(old_patches == new_patches)
437        assert np.unique(vertices, axis=0).shape[0] == vertices.shape[0]
438    elif return_old_indices:
439        old_indices = None
440
441    # done
442    if return_old_indices:
443        return vertices, triangles, old_indices
444    else:
445        return vertices, triangles

Given a set of vertices and triangles, remove any potentially present duplicate vertices.

Parameters
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle
  • return_old_indices (bool, optional): If True, return a list that matches old vertex indices to the new ones.
Returns
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of vertices locations without duplicates
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of vertex indices forming a triangle, reindexed
  • old_indices (numpy.ndarray): Array containing all the old indices, indexed to the new ones.
def extend_mesh( vertices_in, triangles_in, dist_inf=10000000.0, directions=[True, True, True, True], use_normals=[False, False, False, False], normals_in=None): 
448def extend_mesh(
449    vertices_in,
450    triangles_in,
451    dist_inf=1e7,
452    directions=[True, True, True, True],
453    use_normals=[False, False, False, False],
454    normals_in=None,
455):
456    """
457    Extend the mesh in the x and y directions along the respective other axis and
458    constant z value. Includes corners.
459
460    Parameters
461    ----------
462    vertices_in : numpy.ndarray
463        :math:`(m, 3)` array of input vertices locations
464    triangles_in : numpy.ndarray
465        :math:`(n, 3)` array of input vertex indices forming a triangle
466    dist_inf : float, optional
467        The distance to be considered infinite.
468    directions : list, optional
469        List of boolean flags indicating whether to extend a certain direction
470        or not, ordered as [pos_x, pos_y, neg_x, neg_y].
471        By default, all sides are extended. Set to ``False`` sides that should
472        be excluded. Corners are only included if both directions are included.
473    use_normals : list, optional
474        List of boolean flags indicating whether to use the triangle's plane angle
475        when extending or not, ordered the same as `directions`.
476        By default, all sides are extended at constant :math:`z` value.
477    normals_in : numpy.ndarray, optional
478        :math:`(n, 3)` array of normal vectors of each triangle
479
480    Returns
481    -------
482    vertices_out : numpy.ndarray
483        :math:`(p, 3)` array of output vertices locations
484    triangles_out : dict
485        :math:`(q, 3)` array of output vertex indices
486    """
487
488    # input checks
489    assert dist_inf > 0
490    if any(use_normals):
491        assert isinstance(normals_in, np.ndarray)
492
493    # build list of directions
494    check_axes = [0, 1, 0, 1]
495    check_dirs = [1, 1, -1, -1]
496    off_axes = [(a + 1) % 2 for a in check_axes]
497    off_dirs = [1, -1, -1, 1]
498
499    # initialize output
500    n_off = vertices_in.shape[0]
501    vertices_out = []
502    triangles_out = []
503    corner_help = []
504    if any(use_normals):
505        centroids = np.mean(vertices_in[triangles_in], axis=1)
506
507    # for each side and direction, create vertices and triangles
508    for b, a, d, oa, od, n in zip(
509        directions, check_axes, check_dirs, off_axes, off_dirs, use_normals
510    ):
511        if not b:
512            corner_help.append([])
513            continue
514        # get all vertex indices at border
515        i_max = np.argwhere(
516            np.isclose(vertices_in[:, a], d * np.max(d * vertices_in[:, a]))
517        ).ravel()
518        n_max = i_max.size
519        if n_max == 1:
520            # the side is not a clear boundary, but is instead defined
521            # by an intersection - let's hope they have the same depth
522            i_max = np.argwhere(
523                np.isclose(vertices_in[:, 2], vertices_in[i_max, 2])
524            ).ravel()
525            n_max = i_max.size
526            # if it's still just a single value, we can't find the border,
527            # and therefore can't extend it - let's hope it was the free surface
528            if n_max == 1:
529                warn(f"Can't extend axis {a} in the {d:+d} direction.")
530                corner_help.append([])
531                continue
532        # sort both by increasing off-axes value
533        sort_i = np.argsort(vertices_in[i_max, oa])[::od]
534        i_max = i_max[sort_i]
535        if n:
536            # translate along plane angle
537            # find the triangles with two vertices on the boundary
538            tri_contains_border = np.isin(triangles_in, i_max)
539            i_tri_at_border = tri_contains_border.sum(axis=1) == 2
540            assert i_tri_at_border.sum() == n_max - 1
541            # sort index by rising centroid off-axes
542            sort_i_tri = np.argsort(centroids[i_tri_at_border, oa])[::od]
543            i_tri_at_border = np.flatnonzero(i_tri_at_border)[sort_i_tri]
544            # get the respective normal vectors
545            normal_at_border = normals_in[i_tri_at_border, :].copy()
546            # make sure the normal shows up
547            i_normal_down = np.flatnonzero(normal_at_border[:, 2] < 0)
548            normal_at_border[i_normal_down, :] *= -1
549            # get the angles of the normals w.r.t. the vertical
550            ang = np.arccos(
551                normal_at_border[:, 2] / np.linalg.norm(normal_at_border, axis=1)
552            )
553            # take the average angle
554            ang = circmean(ang)
555            sign = np.sign(np.mean(normal_at_border[:, a]))
556            # create final border points by translating the maximum border
557            # vertex by the average angle
558            new_vert = vertices_in[i_max, :].copy()
559            i_border_max = np.argmax(d * new_vert[:, a])
560            new_vert[:, [a, 0]] = new_vert[i_border_max, [a, 0]][None, :]
561            tilted_dir = np.zeros((1, 3))
562            tilted_dir[0, 2] = -np.sin(ang) * dist_inf * sign * d
563            tilted_dir[0, a] = np.cos(ang) * dist_inf * d
564            new_vert += tilted_dir
565        else:
566            # just translation along z
567            new_vert = vertices_in[i_max, :].copy()
568            new_vert[:, a] += d * dist_inf
569        # create new triangles between (1, 2) original and (2, 1) new vertices
570        i_new = np.arange(n_off, n_off + i_max.size)
571        new_tri = np.concatenate(
572            [
573                [[i_max[i], i_max[i + 1], i_new[i]] for i in range(n_max - 1)],
574                [[i_max[i + 1], i_new[i + 1], i_new[i]] for i in range(n_max - 1)],
575            ]
576        )
577        # append
578        vertices_out.append(new_vert)
579        triangles_out.append(new_tri)
580        # save indices of first and last old and new vertices for corner calculation
581        corner_help.append([i_max[0], i_max[-1], i_new[0], i_new[-1]])
582        # progress
583        n_off += n_max
584
585    # concatenate new vertices and indices
586    temp_vertices_out = np.concatenate(
587        [vertices_in, np.concatenate(vertices_out, axis=0)], axis=0
588    )
589
590    # check for corners to add
591    for i1, b in enumerate(directions):
592        i2 = (i1 + 1) % 4
593        # we only have corners if both the current and next directions are extended
594        if (not b) or not (directions[i2]):
595            continue
596        # get the axes and directions of both cornering sides
597        a1, ch1 = check_axes[i1], corner_help[i1]
598        a2, ch2 = check_axes[i2], corner_help[i2]
599        if not (ch1 and ch2):
600            continue
601        # get the index of the corner vertex
602        i_max1, i_new1 = ch1[1], ch1[3]
603        i_max2, i_new2 = ch2[0], ch2[2]
604        assert i_max1 == i_max2, f"{i1, b}: {i_max1} != {i_max2}"
605        # translate to get the new almost-infinitely-far vertex
606        new_vert = np.zeros((1, 3))
607        new_vert[0, a1] = temp_vertices_out[i_new1, a1]
608        new_vert[0, a2] = temp_vertices_out[i_new2, a2]
609        if np.logical_xor(use_normals[i1], use_normals[i2]):
610            # use the side that uses normals as the indicator for depth
611            if use_normals[i1]:
612                new_vert[0, 2] = temp_vertices_out[i_new1, 2]
613            else:
614                new_vert[0, 2] = temp_vertices_out[i_new2, 2]
615        else:
616            # average the two corner depths
617            new_vert[0, 2] = (
618                temp_vertices_out[i_new1, 2] + temp_vertices_out[i_new2, 2]
619            ) / 2
620        # create new triangles
621        i_new = n_off
622        new_tri = np.array([[i_max1, i_new1, i_new], [i_max1, i_new, i_new2]])
623        # append
624        vertices_out.append(new_vert)
625        triangles_out.append(new_tri)
626        # progress
627        n_off += 1
628
629    # concatenate new vertices and indices
630    vertices_out = np.concatenate([vertices_in, np.concatenate(vertices_out)], axis=0)
631    triangles_out = np.concatenate(
632        [triangles_in, np.concatenate(triangles_out)], axis=0
633    )
634
635    # done
636    return vertices_out, triangles_out

Extend the mesh in the x and y directions along the respective other axis and constant z value. Includes corners.

Parameters
  • vertices_in (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of input vertices locations
  • triangles_in (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of input vertex indices forming a triangle
  • dist_inf (float, optional): The distance to be considered infinite.
  • directions (list, optional): List of boolean flags indicating whether to extend a certain direction or not, ordered as [pos_x, pos_y, neg_x, neg_y]. By default, all sides are extended. Set to False sides that should be excluded. Corners are only included if both directions are included.
  • use_normals (list, optional): List of boolean flags indicating whether to use the triangle's plane angle when extending or not, ordered the same as directions. By default, all sides are extended at constant \( z \) value.
  • normals_in (numpy.ndarray, optional): \( (n, 3) \) array of normal vectors of each triangle
Returns
  • vertices_out (numpy.ndarray): \( (p, 3) \) array of output vertices locations
  • triangles_out (dict): \( (q, 3) \) array of output vertex indices
def split_mesh(vertices, triangles, patches=None, max_distance=None, max_depth=None): 
639def split_mesh(vertices, triangles, patches=None, max_distance=None, max_depth=None):
640    """
641    Split the mesh into an inside and outside region based on distance to
642    other patches and/or depth.
643
644    Resets the triangle indices for the two returned meshes.
645    It also does not check whether the vertices and triangles are
646    outside of the patches.
647
648    Parameters
649    ----------
650    vertices : numpy.ndarray
651        :math:`(m, 3)` array of input vertices locations
652    triangles : numpy.ndarray
653        :math:`(n, 3)` array of input vertex indices forming a triangle
654    patches : numpy.ndarray, optional
655        :math:`(n, 3, 3)` array of patches to avoid
656    max_distance : float, optional
657        Maximum distance of the mash centroids away from the ``patches`` vertices
658        to keep in the inside mesh.
659    max_depth : float, optional
660        Only keep mesh centroids in the inside mesh if they are above ``max_depth``.
661
662    Returns
663    -------
664    vertices_inside : numpy.ndarray
665        Inside vertices
666    vertices_outside : numpy.ndarray
667        Outside vertices
668    triangles_inside : numpy.ndarray
669        Inside triangles
670    triangles_outside : numpy.ndarray
671        Outside triangles
672    """
673    # check if we're actually doing something
674    assert (max_depth is not None) or (
675        (max_distance is not None) and (patches is not None)
676    )
677    # initialize list of vertex indices to split off
678    ix_v_split = []
679    # find indices of vertices below below max_depth
680    if max_depth is not None:
681        ix_v_split.extend(np.flatnonzero(vertices[:, 2] < -max_depth).tolist())
682    # find indices more than horizontal max_distance away from patches
683    if max_distance is not None:
684        # get unique vertex coordinates of asperities
685        asp_vert_unique = np.unique(patches.reshape(-1, 3), axis=0)
686        # get distance between all asperity vertices and all other vertices
687        dists = cdist(vertices, asp_vert_unique)
688        # get minimum distance to asperities
689        min_dists = np.min(dists, axis=1)
690        # get indices where that minimum is larger than max_distance
691        ix_v_split.extend(np.flatnonzero(min_dists > max_distance).tolist())
692    # get indices of triangles containing any of the split-off vertices
693    ix_t_split = np.any(np.isin(triangles, np.unique(ix_v_split)), axis=1)
694    ix_t_keep = ~ix_t_split
695    # get unique vertex indices to split off or kept (there is overlap)
696    ix_v_split = np.unique(triangles[ix_t_split, :].ravel())
697    ix_v_keep = np.unique(triangles[ix_t_keep, :].ravel())
698    # split vertices
699    vertices_outside = vertices[ix_v_split, :].copy()
700    vertices_inside = vertices[ix_v_keep, :].copy()
701    # split triangles
702    triangles_outside = triangles[ix_t_split, :].copy()
703    triangles_inside = triangles[ix_t_keep, :].copy()
704    # adjust vertex indices
705    ix_old = np.arange(vertices.shape[0])
706    ix_old_inside = ix_old[ix_v_keep]
707    ix_old_outside = ix_old[ix_v_split]
708    for inew, iold in enumerate(ix_old_inside):
709        triangles_inside[triangles_inside == iold] = inew
710    for inew, iold in enumerate(ix_old_outside):
711        triangles_outside[triangles_outside == iold] = inew
712    # done
713    return vertices_inside, vertices_outside, triangles_inside, triangles_outside

Split the mesh into an inside and outside region based on distance to other patches and/or depth.

Resets the triangle indices for the two returned meshes. It also does not check whether the vertices and triangles are outside of the patches.

Parameters
  • vertices (numpy.ndarray): \( (m, 3) \) array of input vertices locations
  • triangles (numpy.ndarray): \( (n, 3) \) array of input vertex indices forming a triangle
  • patches (numpy.ndarray, optional): \( (n, 3, 3) \) array of patches to avoid
  • max_distance (float, optional): Maximum distance of the mash centroids away from the patches vertices to keep in the inside mesh.
  • max_depth (float, optional): Only keep mesh centroids in the inside mesh if they are above max_depth.
Returns
  • vertices_inside (numpy.ndarray): Inside vertices
  • vertices_outside (numpy.ndarray): Outside vertices
  • triangles_inside (numpy.ndarray): Inside triangles
  • triangles_outside (numpy.ndarray): Outside triangles
def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec): 
716def dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec):
717    r"""
718    Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction
719    rate in linear space.
720
721    Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit
722    formulation for the slip acceleration :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}`:
723
724    :math:`\frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt}`
725
726    Recognizing that :math:`\tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E` and assuming
727    constant effective normal stress leads to
728    :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt}`, which
729    can be rearranged to give the final expression
730
731    :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt}`
732
733    Parameters
734    ----------
735    dtaudt : numpy.ndarray
736        Traction derivative :math:`\frac{d \tau}{dt}` [Pa/s] in linear space
737    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
738        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
739
740    Returns
741    -------
742    dzetadt : numpy.ndarray
743        Velocity derivative :math:`\frac{d \zeta}{dt}` [1/s] in logarithmic space.
744    """
745    return dtaudt / alpha_h_vec

Return the velocity derivative in logarithmic space given the current traction rate in linear space.

Taking the derivative of the steady-state friction gives an explicit formulation for the slip acceleration \( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \):

\( \frac{df_{ss}}{dt} = (a-b) \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \)

Recognizing that \( \tau = f_{ss} \sigma_E \) and assuming constant effective normal stress leads to \( \frac{d \tau}{dt} = \sigma_E \frac{df_{ss}}{dt} \), which can be rearranged to give the final expression

\( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} = \frac{1}{(a-b) \sigma_E} \frac{d \tau}{dt} \)

Parameters
  • dtaudt (numpy.ndarray): Traction derivative \( \frac{d \tau}{dt} \) [Pa/s] in linear space
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
Returns
  • dzetadt (numpy.ndarray): Velocity derivative \( \frac{d \zeta}{dt} \) [1/s] in logarithmic space.
def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec): 
748def get_new_vel_rdlog(zeta_minus, delta_tau, alpha_h_vec):
749    r"""
750    Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an
751    instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the
752    derivation from the expression in ``RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel``:
753
754    :math:`\log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
755
756    and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for :math:`\zeta`
757    to give us the final result
758
759    :math:`\zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h`
760
761    Parameters
762    ----------
763    zeta_minus : numpy.ndarray
764        Initial velocity :math:`\zeta_{-}` [-] in logarithmic space
765    delta_tau : numpy.ndarray, optional
766        Traction stress change :math:`\Delta \tau` [Pa]
767    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
768        Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
769
770    Returns
771    -------
772    zeta_plus : numpy.ndarray
773        Velocity :math:`\zeta_{+}` [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
774
775    See Also
776    --------
777    alpha_h
778    """
779    return zeta_minus + delta_tau / alpha_h_vec
