Calculate the instantaneous velocity change (in logarithmic space) due to an instantaneous stress change to the fault patches. We can kickstart the derivation from the expression in RateStateSteadyLinear.get_new_vel:

\( \log (v_{+}/v_0) = \log (v_{-}/v_0) + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h \)

and realize that we only have to plug in our definition for \( \zeta \) to give us the final result

\( \zeta_{+} = \zeta_{-} + \Delta\tau / \alpha_h \)

Parameters
  • zeta_minus (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity \( \zeta_{-} \) [-] in logarithmic space
  • delta_tau (numpy.ndarray, optional): Traction stress change \( \Delta \tau \) [Pa]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
Returns
  • zeta_plus (numpy.ndarray): Velocity \( \zeta_{+} \) [-] in logarithmic space after stress change
See Also

alpha_h

def flat_ode_rdlog( t, state, n_patches, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext_v_plate, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
782def flat_ode_rdlog(
783    t,
784    state,
785    n_patches,
786    v_plate_vec,
787    K_int,
788    K_ext_v_plate,
789    v_0,
790    alpha_h_vec,
791    mu_over_2vs,
792):
793    r"""
794    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
795    rate-dependent rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed
796    constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
797
798    Parameters
799    ----------
800    t : float
801        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
802    state : numpy.ndarray
803        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
804        containing (in order) the cumulative slip and current velocity,
805        and flattened so that its total length is `n_patches * 2 * 2`.
806    n_patches : float
807        Number of patches in the state array.
808    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
809        2D plate velocities.
810    K_int : numpy.ndarray
811        4D tensor with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
812    K_ext_v_plate : numpy.ndarray
813        Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
814    v_0 : float
815        Reference velocity [m/s]
816    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
817        1D column rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
818    mu_over_2vs : float
819        Radiation damping factor
820
821    Returns
822    -------
823    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
824        1D array with the state derivative.
825    """
826    # reshape input state
827    state2d = state.reshape(2 * n_patches, 2)
828    # extract total velocities
829    zeta = state2d[n_patches:, :]
830    v = v_0 * np.exp(zeta)
831    # get shear strain rate
832    rad_damp_factor = mu_over_2vs * v / alpha_h_vec
833    dtaudt = (
834        np.tensordot(K_int, v - v_plate_vec, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)]) - K_ext_v_plate
835    ) / (1 + rad_damp_factor)
836    # get ODE
837    dstatedt = np.concatenate((v, dzetadt_rdlog(dtaudt, alpha_h_vec)))
838    # return
839    return dstatedt.ravel()

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with rate-dependent rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the cumulative slip and current velocity, and flattened so that its total length is n_patches * 2 * 2.
  • n_patches (float): Number of patches in the state array.
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): 2D plate velocities.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 4D tensor with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext_v_plate (numpy.ndarray): Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): 1D column rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
def flat_ode_rdreg( t, state, n_patches, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext_v_plate, rho, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs): 
842def flat_ode_rdreg(
843    t,
844    state,
845    n_patches,
846    v_plate_vec,
847    K_int,
848    K_ext_v_plate,
849    rho,
850    alpha_h_vec,
851    mu_over_2vs,
852):
853    r"""
854    Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with
855    regularized rate-dependent rheology in the upper plate interface, and an
856    imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).
857
858    Parameters
859    ----------
860    t : float
861        Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
862    state : numpy.ndarray
863        1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches,
864        containing (in order) the cumulative slip and current velocity,
865        and flattened so that its total length is `n_patches * 2 * 2`.
866    n_patches : float
867        Number of patches in the state array.
868    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
869        2D plate velocities.
870    K_int : numpy.ndarray
871        4D tensor with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
872    K_ext_v_plate : numpy.ndarray
873        Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
874    rho : float
875        :math:`f_0 / (a-b)` [-]
876    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
877        1D column rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`
878    mu_over_2vs : float
879        Radiation damping factor
880
881    Returns
882    -------
883    dstatedt : numpy.ndarray
884        1D array with the state derivative.
885    """
886    # reshape input state
887    state2d = state.reshape(2 * n_patches, 2)
888    # extract variables
889    # slip = state2d[:n_patches, :]
890    traction = state2d[n_patches:, :]
891    # get current velocity
892    vel = v_plate_vec * np.exp(-rho) * np.sinh(traction / alpha_h_vec)
893    # get traction rate
894    dtractiondt = (
895        np.tensordot(K_int, vel - v_plate_vec, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)]) - K_ext_v_plate
896    )
897    # form state derivative
898    dstatedt = np.concatenate((vel, dtractiondt))
899    # return
900    return dstatedt.ravel()

Flattened ODE derivative function for a subduction fault with regularized rate-dependent rheology in the upper plate interface, and an imposed constant plate velocity at the lower interface (which can be ignored).

Parameters
  • t (float): Current time (needs to be in function call for solve_ivp).
  • state (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the current state of the creeping fault patches, containing (in order) the cumulative slip and current velocity, and flattened so that its total length is n_patches * 2 * 2.
  • n_patches (float): Number of patches in the state array.
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): 2D plate velocities.
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): 4D tensor with the stress kernel mapping creeping patches to themselves.
  • K_ext_v_plate (numpy.ndarray): Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
  • rho (float): \( f_0 / (a-b) \) [-]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): 1D column rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \)
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor
Returns
  • dstatedt (numpy.ndarray): 1D array with the state derivative.
def flat_run_rdlog( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, K_int, K_ext_v_plate, v_plate_vec, v_init, delta_tau_bounded, delta_tau_bounded_nonuni, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs, v_max, atol, rtol, spinup_atol, spinup_rtol, verbose): 
 903def flat_run_rdlog(
 904    t_eval,
 905    i_break,
 906    i_eq,
 907    K_int,
 908    K_ext_v_plate,
 909    v_plate_vec,
 910    v_init,
 911    delta_tau_bounded,
 912    delta_tau_bounded_nonuni,
 913    v_0,
 914    alpha_h_vec,
 915    mu_over_2vs,
 916    v_max,
 917    atol,
 918    rtol,
 919    spinup_atol,
 920    spinup_rtol,
 921    verbose,
 922):
 923    r"""
 924    Run the rate-dependent simulation.
 925
 926    Parameters
 927    ----------
 928    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
 929        Evaluation times [s]
 930    i_break : numpy.ndarray
 931        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
 932    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
 933        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
 934    K_int : numpy.ndarray
 935        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
 936    K_ext_v_plate : numpy.ndarray
 937        Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
 938    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
 939        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
 940    v_init : numpy.ndarray
 941        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
 942    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
 943        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
 944    v_0 : float
 945        Reference velocity [m/s]
 946    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
 947        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
 948    mu_over_2vs : float
 949        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
 950        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
 951    v_max : float
 952        Maximum velocity that a patch can have during the integration [m/s], or None
 953        if not limit.
 954    atol : float
 955        Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
 956    rtol : float
 957        Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
 958    spinup_atol : float
 959        Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
 960    spinup_rtol : float
 961        Relative tolerance of spinup controller
 962    verbose : bool
 963        Print integration progress.
 964
 965    Returns
 966    -------
 967    sim_state : numpy.ndarray
 968        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
 969    """
 970
 971    # initialize parameters
 972    n_eval = t_eval.size
 973    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[0]
 974    n_patches = K_int.shape[0]
 975    assert np.all(np.diff(t_eval) > 0)
 976    assert (
 977        n_patches
 978        == K_ext_v_plate.shape[0]
 979        == v_plate_vec.shape[0]
 980        == v_init.shape[0]
 981        == alpha_h_vec.shape[0]
 982    )
 983
 984    # initialize arrays
 985    signs = np.sign(v_plate_vec)
 986    assert np.all(signs == np.sign(v_init)) and np.all(signs > 0)
 987    v_init = np.abs(v_init)
 988    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_patches, 2))
 989    zeta_minus_upper = np.log(v_init / v_0)
 990    sim_state = np.full((2 * n_patches, 2, n_eval), np.nan)
 991    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, zeta_minus_upper))
 992
 993    # make flat ODE function arguments
 994    args = (n_patches, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext_v_plate, v_0, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs)
 995
 996    # integrate
 997    spun_up = 0
 998    i_slip = 0
 999    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1000    i = 0
1001    if delta_tau_bounded_nonuni is not None:
1002        # need to get the indices of the last n_slips_obs events
1003        n_slips_obs = delta_tau_bounded_nonuni.shape[0]
1004        i_eq_nonuni = i_eq[-n_slips_obs:].tolist()
1005    else:
1006        i_eq_nonuni = []
1007    if verbose:
1008        print("0", end="", flush=True)
1009        ii = 1
1010    while i < steps.size - 1:
1011        # get indices
1012        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1013        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1014        # call integrator
1015        sol = solve_ivp(
1016            flat_ode_rdlog,
1017            t_span=[ti, tf],
1018            y0=state_plus.ravel(),
1019            t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1020            method="RK45",
1021            args=args,
1022            atol=atol,
1023            rtol=rtol,
1024        )
1025        success = sol.success
1026        if success:
1027            sol = sol.y.reshape(2 * n_patches, 2, -1)
1028        else:
1029            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1030        # save state to output array
1031        sim_state[:, :, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1032        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1033        if i == steps.size - 2:
1034            break
1035        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1036        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1037            if verbose:
1038                print(f"{ii}", end="", flush=True)
1039                ii += 1
1040            old_full_state = sim_state[
1041                :, :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1042            ]
1043            new_full_state = sim_state[:, :, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1044            old_zeta_upper = old_full_state[n_patches:, :, -1]
1045            new_zeta_upper = new_full_state[n_patches:, :, -1]
1046            lhs_upper = np.abs(new_zeta_upper - old_zeta_upper)
1047            rhs_upper = spinup_atol + spinup_rtol * np.fmax(
1048                np.abs(new_zeta_upper), np.abs(old_zeta_upper)
1049            )
1050            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
1051            if stop_now:
1052                spun_up = jf
1053                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1054                if verbose:
1055                    print(">", end="", flush=True)
1056                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1057        elif (not spun_up) and (jf in i_break) and verbose:
1058            print(f"{ii}", end="", flush=True)
1059            ii += 1
1060        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1061            break
1062        # apply step change only if there is one
1063        if jf in i_eq:
1064            if verbose:
1065                print(".", end="", flush=True)
1066            state_upper = sol[:, :, -1]
1067            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:n_patches, :]
1068            zeta_minus_upper = state_upper[n_patches:, :]
1069            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.copy()
1070            if spun_up and (jf in i_eq_nonuni):
1071                i_slip_nonuni = i_eq_nonuni.index(jf)
1072                zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(
1073                    zeta_minus_upper,
1074                    delta_tau_bounded_nonuni[i_slip_nonuni, :, :],
1075                    alpha_h_vec,
1076                )
1077            else:
1078                zeta_plus_upper = get_new_vel_rdlog(
1079                    zeta_minus_upper, delta_tau_bounded[i_slip, :, :], alpha_h_vec
1080                )
1081            if v_max is not None:
1082                v_plus_upper = v_0 * np.exp(zeta_plus_upper)
1083                v_plus_upper_norm = np.linalg.norm(v_plus_upper, axis=1)
1084                if np.any(v_plus_upper_norm > v_max):
1085                    v_plus_upper *= (
1086                        np.clip(v_plus_upper_norm, a_min=None, a_max=v_max)
1087                        / v_plus_upper_norm
1088                    )[:, None]
1089                    zeta_plus_upper = np.log(v_plus_upper / v_0)
1090            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, zeta_plus_upper))
1091            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1092        else:
1093            state_plus = sol[:, :, -1]
1094        # advance
1095        i += 1
1096
1097    # warn if we never spun up
1098    if not spun_up:
1099        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1100
1101    # convert from log to linear velocity
1102    sim_state[n_patches:, :, :] = v_0 * np.exp(sim_state[n_patches:, :, :])
1103
1104    # done
1105    return sim_state

Run the rate-dependent simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext_v_plate (numpy.ndarray): Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor \( \mu / 2 v_s \), where \( \mu \) is the shear modulus [Pa] and \( v_s \) is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
  • v_max (float): Maximum velocity that a patch can have during the integration [m/s], or None if not limit.
  • atol (float): Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
  • rtol (float): Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
  • spinup_atol (float): Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
  • spinup_rtol (float): Relative tolerance of spinup controller
  • verbose (bool): Print integration progress.
Returns
  • sim_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
def flat_run_rdreg( t_eval, i_break, i_eq, K_int, K_ext_v_plate, v_plate_vec, v_init, delta_tau_bounded, delta_tau_bounded_nonuni, slip_taper_vec, slip_taper_vec_nonuni, rho, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs, v_max, atol, rtol, spinup_atol, spinup_rtol, verbose): 
1108def flat_run_rdreg(
1109    t_eval,
1110    i_break,
1111    i_eq,
1112    K_int,
1113    K_ext_v_plate,
1114    v_plate_vec,
1115    v_init,
1116    delta_tau_bounded,
1117    delta_tau_bounded_nonuni,
1118    slip_taper_vec,
1119    slip_taper_vec_nonuni,
1120    rho,
1121    alpha_h_vec,
1122    mu_over_2vs,
1123    v_max,
1124    atol,
1125    rtol,
1126    spinup_atol,
1127    spinup_rtol,
1128    verbose,
1129):
1130    r"""
1131    Run the regularized rate-dependent simulation.
1132
1133    Parameters
1134    ----------
1135    t_eval : numpy.ndarray
1136        Evaluation times [s]
1137    i_break : numpy.ndarray
1138        Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
1139    i_eq : numpy.ndarray
1140        Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
1141    K_int : numpy.ndarray
1142        Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
1143    K_ext_v_plate : numpy.ndarray
1144        Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
1145    v_plate_vec : numpy.ndarray
1146        Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
1147    v_init : numpy.ndarray
1148        Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
1149    delta_tau_bounded : numpy.ndarray
1150        Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
1151    delta_tau_bounded_nonuni : numpy.ndarray
1152        Bounded coseismic stress change for nonuniform earthquakes [Pa]
1153    slip_taper_vec : numpy.ndarray
1154        Tapered slip [m]
1155    slip_taper_vec_nonuni : numpy.ndarray
1156        Tapered slip for nonuniform earthquakes [m]
1157    rho : float
1158        :math:`f_0 / (a-b)` [-]
1159    alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray
1160        Upper interface rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa]
1161    mu_over_2vs : float
1162        Radiation damping factor :math:`\mu / 2 v_s`, where :math:`\mu` is the shear
1163        modulus [Pa] and :math:`v_s` is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
1164    v_max : float
1165        Maximum velocity that a patch can have during the integration [m/s], or None
1166        if not limit.
1167    atol : float
1168        Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
1169    rtol : float
1170        Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
1171    spinup_atol : float
1172        Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
1173    spinup_rtol : float
1174        Relative tolerance of spinup controller
1175    verbose : bool
1176        Print integration progress.
1177
1178    Returns
1179    -------
1180    sim_state : numpy.ndarray
1181        Full state variable at the end of the integration.
1182    """
1183
1184    # initialize parameters
1185    n_eval = t_eval.size
1186    n_slips = delta_tau_bounded.shape[0]
1187    n_patches = K_int.shape[0]
1188    assert np.all(np.diff(t_eval) > 0)
1189    assert (
1190        n_patches
1191        == K_ext_v_plate.shape[0]
1192        == v_plate_vec.shape[0]
1193        == v_init.shape[0]
1194        == alpha_h_vec.shape[0]
1195    )
1196    assert not np.logical_xor(delta_tau_bounded_nonuni is None, slip_taper_vec is None)
1197
1198    # initialize arrays
1199    s_minus_upper = np.zeros((n_patches, 2))
1200    # tau_minus_upper = rho * np.broadcast_to(alpha_h_vec, (n_patches, 2))
1201    tau_minus_upper = np.arcsinh(v_init / v_plate_vec * np.exp(rho)) * alpha_h_vec
1202    sim_state = np.full((2 * n_patches, 2, n_eval), np.nan)
1203    state_plus = np.concatenate((s_minus_upper, tau_minus_upper))
1204
1205    # make flat ODE function arguments
1206    args = (n_patches, v_plate_vec, K_int, K_ext_v_plate, rho, alpha_h_vec, mu_over_2vs)
1207
1208    # integrate
1209    spun_up = 0
1210    i_slip = 0
1211    steps = np.sort(np.concatenate((i_eq, i_break)))
1212    i = 0
1213    if delta_tau_bounded_nonuni is not None:
1214        # need to get the indices of the last n_slips_obs events
1215        n_slips_obs = delta_tau_bounded_nonuni.shape[0]
1216        i_eq_nonuni = i_eq[-n_slips_obs:].tolist()
1217    else:
1218        i_eq_nonuni = []
1219    if verbose:
1220        print("0", end="", flush=True)
1221        ii = 1
1222    while i < steps.size - 1:
1223        # get indices
1224        ji, jf = steps[i], steps[i + 1]
1225        ti, tf = t_eval[ji], t_eval[jf]
1226        # call integrator
1227        sol = solve_ivp(
1228            flat_ode_rdreg,
1229            t_span=[ti, tf],
1230            y0=state_plus.ravel(),
1231            t_eval=t_eval[ji : jf + 1],
1232            method="RK45",
1233            args=args,
1234            atol=atol,
1235            rtol=rtol,
1236        )
1237        success = sol.success
1238        if success:
1239            sol = sol.y.reshape(2 * n_patches, 2, -1)
1240        else:
1241            raise RuntimeError("Integrator failed.")
1242        # save state to output array
1243        sim_state[:, :, ji : jf + 1] = sol
1244        # can already stop here if this is the last interval
1245        if i == steps.size - 2:
1246            break
1247        # at the end of a full cycle, check the early stopping criteria
1248        if (not spun_up) and (i > n_slips) and (jf in i_break):
1249            if verbose:
1250                print(f"{ii}", end="", flush=True)
1251                ii += 1
1252            old_full_state = sim_state[
1253                :, :, steps[i - 2 * n_slips - 1] : steps[i - n_slips]
1254            ]
1255            new_full_state = sim_state[:, :, steps[i - n_slips] : steps[i + 1]]
1256            old_tau_upper = old_full_state[n_patches:, :, -1]
1257            new_tau_upper = new_full_state[n_patches:, :, -1]
1258            lhs_upper = np.abs(new_tau_upper - old_tau_upper)
1259            rhs_upper = spinup_atol + spinup_rtol * np.fmax(
1260                np.abs(new_tau_upper), np.abs(old_tau_upper)
1261            )
1262            stop_now = np.all(lhs_upper <= rhs_upper)
1263            if stop_now:
1264                spun_up = jf
1265                # advance i to the last cycle (don't forget the general advance later)
1266                if verbose:
1267                    print(">", end="", flush=True)
1268                i = steps.size - n_slips - 3
1269        elif (not spun_up) and (jf in i_break) and verbose:
1270            print(f"{ii}", end="", flush=True)
1271            ii += 1
1272        elif spun_up and (jf in i_break):
1273            break
1274        # apply step change only if there is one
1275        if jf in i_eq:
1276            if verbose:
1277                print(".", end="", flush=True)
1278            state_upper = sol[:, :, -1]
1279            s_minus_upper = state_upper[:n_patches, :]
1280            tau_minus_upper = state_upper[n_patches:, :]
1281            s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper.copy()
1282            if spun_up and (jf in i_eq_nonuni):
1283                i_slip_nonuni = i_eq_nonuni.index(jf)
1284                s_plus_upper = (
1285                    s_minus_upper + slip_taper_vec_nonuni[i_slip_nonuni, :, :]
1286                )
1287                tau_plus_upper = (
1288                    tau_minus_upper + delta_tau_bounded_nonuni[i_slip_nonuni, :, :]
1289                )
1290            else:
1291                s_plus_upper = s_minus_upper + slip_taper_vec[i_slip, :, :]
1292                tau_plus_upper = tau_minus_upper + delta_tau_bounded[i_slip, :, :]
1293            if v_max is not None:
1294                v_plus_upper = (
1295                    v_plate_vec * np.exp(-rho) * np.sinh(tau_plus_upper / alpha_h_vec)
1296                )
1297                v_plus_upper_norm = np.linalg.norm(v_plus_upper, axis=1)
1298                if np.any(v_plus_upper_norm > v_max):
1299                    v_plus_upper *= (
1300                        np.clip(v_plus_upper_norm, a_min=None, a_max=v_max)
1301                        / v_plus_upper_norm
1302                    )[:, None]
1303                    tau_plus_upper = (
1304                        np.arcsinh((v_plus_upper / v_plate_vec) * np.exp(rho))
1305                        * alpha_h_vec
1306                    )
1307            state_plus = np.concatenate((s_plus_upper, tau_plus_upper))
1308            i_slip = (i_slip + 1) % n_slips
1309        else:
1310            state_plus = sol[:, :, -1]
1311        # advance
1312        i += 1
1313
1314    # warn if we never spun up
1315    if not spun_up:
1316        print(f"Simulation did not spin up after {len(i_break) - 1} cycles!")
1317
1318    # convert from traction to linear velocity
1319    sim_state[n_patches:, :, :] = (
1320        v_plate_vec[:, :, None]
1321        * np.exp(-rho)
1322        * np.sinh(sim_state[n_patches:, :, :] / alpha_h_vec[:, :, None])
1323    )
1324
1325    # done
1326    return sim_state

Run the regularized rate-dependent simulation.

Parameters
  • t_eval (numpy.ndarray): Evaluation times [s]
  • i_break (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of cycle breaks [-]
  • i_eq (numpy.ndarray): Integer indices of earthquakes within sequence [-]
  • K_int (numpy.ndarray): Internal stress kernel [Pa/m]
  • K_ext_v_plate (numpy.ndarray): Stressing rate induced by the locked asperities.
  • v_plate_vec (numpy.ndarray): Plate velocity for all creeping patches [m/s]
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray): Initial velocity of the fault patches, in the dimensions of the rheology
  • delta_tau_bounded (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa]
  • delta_tau_bounded_nonuni (numpy.ndarray): Bounded coseismic stress change for nonuniform earthquakes [Pa]
  • slip_taper_vec (numpy.ndarray): Tapered slip [m]
  • slip_taper_vec_nonuni (numpy.ndarray): Tapered slip for nonuniform earthquakes [m]
  • rho (float): \( f_0 / (a-b) \) [-]
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray): Upper interface rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]
  • mu_over_2vs (float): Radiation damping factor \( \mu / 2 v_s \), where \( \mu \) is the shear modulus [Pa] and \( v_s \) is the shear wave velocity [m/s]
  • v_max (float): Maximum velocity that a patch can have during the integration [m/s], or None if not limit.
  • atol (float): Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
  • rtol (float): Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
  • spinup_atol (float): Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
  • spinup_rtol (float): Relative tolerance of spinup controller
  • verbose (bool): Print integration progress.
Returns
  • sim_state (numpy.ndarray): Full state variable at the end of the integration.
def get_surface_displacements(obs_slip_ts, G): 
1329def get_surface_displacements(obs_slip_ts, G):
1330    """
1331    Calculate the surface displacements given a slip timeseries and the Green's functions.
1332
1333    Parameters
1334    ----------
1335    slip_ts : numpy.ndarray
1336        Array of shape `(n_patches, 2, n_eval)` where `n_patches` is the number
1337        of patches and `n_eval` is the number of timesteps.
1338    G : numpy.ndarray
1339        4D tensor of Green's functions of shape :math:`(m, 3, n, 3)`.
1340
1341    Returns
1342    -------
1343    surf_disp : numpy.ndarray
1344        Surface displacement timeseries.
1345    """
1346    # this is equivalent to calling the single-timestep tensor product in a loop
1347    # over the n_eval time steps
1348    return np.tensordot(G[:, :, :, :2], obs_slip_ts, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)])

Calculate the surface displacements given a slip timeseries and the Green's functions.

Parameters
  • slip_ts (numpy.ndarray): Array of shape (n_patches, 2, n_eval) where n_patches is the number of patches and n_eval is the number of timesteps.
  • G (numpy.ndarray): 4D tensor of Green's functions of shape \( (m, 3, n, 3) \).
Returns
  • surf_disp (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacement timeseries.
def rotation_matrix_around_vector(theta, vector): 
1351def rotation_matrix_around_vector(theta, vector):
1352    """
1353    Calculates the rotation matrix used to rotate a right-handed coordinate system
1354    counterclockwise around a vector when multiplied from the right.
1355
1356    Parameters
1357    ----------
1358    theta : float
1359        Rotation angle [rad]
1360    vector : numpy.ndarray
1361        Unit rotation vector
1362
1363    Returns
1364    -------
1365    R : numpy.ndarray
1366        Rotation matrix
1367    """
1368    assert vector.size == 3
1369    return (
1370        np.cos(theta) * np.eye(3)
1371        + np.sin(-theta) * np.cross(vector, -np.eye(3))
1372        + (1 - np.cos(theta)) * np.outer(vector, vector)
1373    )

Calculates the rotation matrix used to rotate a right-handed coordinate system counterclockwise around a vector when multiplied from the right.

Parameters
  • theta (float): Rotation angle [rad]
  • vector (numpy.ndarray): Unit rotation vector
Returns
  • R (numpy.ndarray): Rotation matrix
def eulerpole2rotvec(euler_pole, euler_pole_covariance=None): 
1376def eulerpole2rotvec(euler_pole, euler_pole_covariance=None):
1377    r"""
1378    Convert an Euler pole (and optionally, its formal covariance) into a rotation
1379    vector and associated covariance matrix. Based on [goudarzi14]_.
1380
1381    Parameters
1382    ----------
1383    euler_pole
1384        NumPy Array containing the longitude [rad], latitude [rad], and rotation
1385        rate [rad/time] of the Euler pole.
1386    euler_pole_covariance
1387        If ``rotation_covariance`` was given, the propagated uncertainty for the Euler
1388        Pole for all three components.
1389
1390    Returns
1391    -------
1392    rotation_vector
1393        Rotation vector [rad/time] containing the diagonals of the :math:`3 \times 3`
1394        rotation matrix specifying the Euler pole in cartesian, ECEF coordinates.
1395    rotation_covariance
1396        If ``euler_pole_covariance`` was given, formal :math:`3 \times 3` covariance
1397        matrix [rad^2/time^2] of the rotation vector.
1398
1399    See Also
1400    --------
1401    rotvec2eulerpole : Inverse function
1402    """
1403    # readability
1404     = euler_pole[2]
1405    sinlat, coslat = np.sin(euler_pole[1]), np.cos(euler_pole[1])
1406    sinlon, coslon = np.sin(euler_pole[0]), np.cos(euler_pole[0])
1407    # rotation vector, eq. 5 (no scaling)
1408    _x =  * coslat * coslon
1409    _y =  * coslat * sinlon
1410    _z =  * sinlat
1411    rotation_vector = np.array([_x, _y, _z])
1412    # uncertainty, eq. 6 (no scaling)
1413    if euler_pole_covariance is not None:
1414        jac = np.array(
1415            [
1416                [- * coslat * sinlon, - * sinlat * coslon, coslat * coslon],
1417                [ * coslat * coslon, - * sinlat * sinlon, coslat * sinlon],
1418                [0,  * coslat, sinlat],
1419            ]
1420        )
1421        rotation_covariance = jac @ euler_pole_covariance @ jac.T
1422    # return
1423    if euler_pole_covariance is not None:
1424        return rotation_vector, rotation_covariance
1425    else:
1426        return rotation_vector

Convert an Euler pole (and optionally, its formal covariance) into a rotation vector and associated covariance matrix. Based on [goudarzi14]_.

Parameters
  • euler_pole: NumPy Array containing the longitude [rad], latitude [rad], and rotation rate [rad/time] of the Euler pole.
  • euler_pole_covariance: If rotation_covariance was given, the propagated uncertainty for the Euler Pole for all three components.
Returns
  • rotation_vector: Rotation vector [rad/time] containing the diagonals of the \( 3 \times 3 \) rotation matrix specifying the Euler pole in cartesian, ECEF coordinates.
  • rotation_covariance: If euler_pole_covariance was given, formal \( 3 \times 3 \) covariance matrix [rad^2/time^2] of the rotation vector.
See Also

rotvec2eulerpole: Inverse function

class Rheology(abc.ABC): 
1429class Rheology(ABC):
1430    """
1431    Abstract base class for rheologies.
1432    """

Abstract base class for rheologies.

class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology): 
1435class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic(Rheology):
1436    r"""
1437    Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively
1438    becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by
1439
1440    :math:`f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E`
1441
1442    where :math:`f_{ss}` is the steady-state friction, :math:`f_0` is a reference
1443    friction, :math:`a` and :math:`b` are the rate-and-state frictional parameters,
1444    :math:`\zeta = \log (v / v_0)` is the logarithmic velocity, :math:`\tau` is the shear
1445    stress, and :math:`\sigma_E` is the effective fault normal stress.
1446    """
1447
1448    def __init__(
1449        self,
1450        v_0,
1451        alpha_h,
1452        alpha_h_mid=None,
1453        mid_transition=None,
1454        alpha_h_deep=None,
1455        deep_transition=None,
1456        boundary_width=None,
1457        alpha_h_boundary=None,
1458    ):
1459        r"""
1460        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
1461
1462        Parameters
1463        ----------
1464        v_0 : float
1465            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
1466        alpha_h : float
1467            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
1468            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
1469            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
1470        """
1471        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
1472        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1473        # input check
1474        assert not np.logical_xor(alpha_h_boundary is None, boundary_width is None)
1475        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
1476        # set number of variables
1477        self.n_vars = 2
1478        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
1479        # initialization
1480        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
1481        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
1482        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
1483        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1484        self.alpha_h_mid = (
1485            float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None else self.alpha_h
1486        )
1487        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1488        self.alpha_h_deep = (
1489            float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None else self.alpha_h_mid
1490        )
1491        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1492        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
1493            float(alpha_h_boundary)
1494            if alpha_h_boundary is not None
1495            else self.alpha_h_deep
1496        )
1497        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1498        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
1499        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
1500        self.deep_transition = (
1501            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
1502        )
1503        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
1504        self.boundary_width = None if boundary_width is None else float(boundary_width)
1505        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """
1506
1507    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_centroids, outer_vertices):
1508        r"""
1509        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
1510        varies log-linearly with depth.
1511        """
1512
1513        # input checks
1514        patch_depths = -patch_centroids[:, 2]
1515        assert np.all(patch_depths >= 0)
1516
1517        # first part: general depth-dependent alpha_h
1518        # start knots list
1519        knots = [np.min(patch_depths)]
1520        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
1521        # add optional mid transition
1522        if self.mid_transition is not None:
1523            knots.append(self.mid_transition)
1524            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
1525        # add optional deep transition
1526        if self.deep_transition is not None:
1527            knots.append(self.deep_transition)
1528            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
1529        # add final value if necessary for constant alpha_h
1530        if len(knots) == 1:
1531            knots.append(np.max(patch_depths))
1532            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
1533        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
1534        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
1535        alpha_h_vec = 10 ** interp1d(
1536            knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h), fill_value="extrapolate"
1537        )(patch_depths)
1538
1539        # second part: make borders to non-simulated patches gradually stronger
1540        if self.alpha_h_boundary is not None:
1541            # distances from inner patch centroids to vertices
1542            dists = cdist(patch_centroids, outer_vertices)
1543            # minimum distances
1544            min_dists = np.min(dists, axis=1)
1545            # alpha_h_vec if this distance was the only metric
1546            boundary_vec = (
1547                (self.boundary_width - min_dists)
1548                / self.boundary_width
1549                * np.log10(self.alpha_h_boundary)
1550            )
1551            # final alpha_h_vec is the element-wise maximum of the two
1552            alpha_h_vec = np.fmax(10**boundary_vec, alpha_h_vec)
1553
1554        # done
1555        return alpha_h_vec

Implement a steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the ageing law (effectively becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by

\( f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E \)

where \( f_{ss} \) is the steady-state friction, \( f_0 \) is a reference friction, \( a \) and \( b \) are the rate-and-state frictional parameters, \( \zeta = \log (v / v_0) \) is the logarithmic velocity, \( \tau \) is the shear stress, and \( \sigma_E \) is the effective fault normal stress.

RateStateSteadyLogarithmic( v_0, alpha_h, alpha_h_mid=None, mid_transition=None, alpha_h_deep=None, deep_transition=None, boundary_width=None, alpha_h_boundary=None) 
1448    def __init__(
1449        self,
1450        v_0,
1451        alpha_h,
1452        alpha_h_mid=None,
1453        mid_transition=None,
1454        alpha_h_deep=None,
1455        deep_transition=None,
1456        boundary_width=None,
1457        alpha_h_boundary=None,
1458    ):
1459        r"""
1460        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
1461
1462        Parameters
1463        ----------
1464        v_0 : float
1465            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
1466        alpha_h : float
1467            Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E`,
1468            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
1469            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
1470        """
1471        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
1472        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1473        # input check
1474        assert not np.logical_xor(alpha_h_boundary is None, boundary_width is None)
1475        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
1476        # set number of variables
1477        self.n_vars = 2
1478        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
1479        # initialization
1480        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
1481        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
1482        self.alpha_h = float(alpha_h)
1483        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1484        self.alpha_h_mid = (
1485            float(alpha_h_mid) if alpha_h_mid is not None else self.alpha_h
1486        )
1487        r""" Middle rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1488        self.alpha_h_deep = (
1489            float(alpha_h_deep) if alpha_h_deep is not None else self.alpha_h_mid
1490        )
1491        r""" Deep rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1492        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
1493            float(alpha_h_boundary)
1494            if alpha_h_boundary is not None
1495            else self.alpha_h_deep
1496        )
1497        r""" Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1498        self.mid_transition = None if mid_transition is None else float(mid_transition)
1499        """ Depth [m] for the middle transition point """
1500        self.deep_transition = (
1501            None if deep_transition is None else float(deep_transition)
1502        )
1503        """ (Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point """
1504        self.boundary_width = None if boundary_width is None else float(boundary_width)
1505        """ (Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point """

Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.

Parameters
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
  • alpha_h (float): Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \), where \( a \) and \( b \) [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties, and \( \sigma_E \) [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
alpha_h

Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

n_vars

Number of variables to track by rheology [-]

v_0

Reference velocity \( v_0 \) [m/s]

alpha_h_mid

Middle rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

alpha_h_deep

Deep rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

alpha_h_boundary

Boundary-layer rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

mid_transition

Depth [m] for the middle transition point

deep_transition

(Upper) Depth [m] for the deep transition point

boundary_width

(Downdip) Width [m] of the deep transition point

def get_param_vectors(self, patch_centroids, outer_vertices): 
1507    def get_param_vectors(self, patch_centroids, outer_vertices):
1508        r"""
1509        Calculate the depth-dependent array of :math:`\alpha_h`, assuming it
1510        varies log-linearly with depth.
1511        """
1512
1513        # input checks
1514        patch_depths = -patch_centroids[:, 2]
1515        assert np.all(patch_depths >= 0)
1516
1517        # first part: general depth-dependent alpha_h
1518        # start knots list
1519        knots = [np.min(patch_depths)]
1520        vals_alpha_h = [self.alpha_h]
1521        # add optional mid transition
1522        if self.mid_transition is not None:
1523            knots.append(self.mid_transition)
1524            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_mid)
1525        # add optional deep transition
1526        if self.deep_transition is not None:
1527            knots.append(self.deep_transition)
1528            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
1529        # add final value if necessary for constant alpha_h
1530        if len(knots) == 1:
1531            knots.append(np.max(patch_depths))
1532            vals_alpha_h.append(self.alpha_h_deep)
1533        vals_alpha_h = np.array(vals_alpha_h)
1534        # interpolate alpha_n and alpha_eff
1535        alpha_h_vec = 10 ** interp1d(
1536            knots, np.log10(vals_alpha_h), fill_value="extrapolate"
1537        )(patch_depths)
1538
1539        # second part: make borders to non-simulated patches gradually stronger
1540        if self.alpha_h_boundary is not None:
1541            # distances from inner patch centroids to vertices
1542            dists = cdist(patch_centroids, outer_vertices)
1543            # minimum distances
1544            min_dists = np.min(dists, axis=1)
1545            # alpha_h_vec if this distance was the only metric
1546            boundary_vec = (
1547                (self.boundary_width - min_dists)
1548                / self.boundary_width
1549                * np.log10(self.alpha_h_boundary)
1550            )
1551            # final alpha_h_vec is the element-wise maximum of the two
1552            alpha_h_vec = np.fmax(10**boundary_vec, alpha_h_vec)
1553
1554        # done
1555        return alpha_h_vec

Calculate the depth-dependent array of \( \alpha_h \), assuming it varies log-linearly with depth.

class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D(Rheology): 
1558class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D(Rheology):
1559    r"""
1560    Implement a 2D steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the aging law (effectively
1561    becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by
1562
1563    :math:`f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E`
1564
1565    where :math:`f_{ss}` is the steady-state friction, :math:`f_0` is a reference
1566    friction, :math:`a` and :math:`b` are the rate-and-state frictional parameters,
1567    :math:`\zeta = \log (v / v_0)` is the logarithmic velocity, :math:`\tau` is the shear
1568    stress, and :math:`\sigma_E` is the effective fault normal stress.
1569
1570    The 2D spatial variation is implemented with B-Splines. Towards the boundaries
1571    of the simulated regions, the rheological strength is forced to a certain value
1572    regardless of the 2D spline-based variability.
1573    """
1574
1575    # helper class
1576    class CustomBasisFunction:
1577        def __init__(self, full_knots_depth, full_knots_horiz, degree, ix_d, ix_h):
1578            self.bd = BSpline.basis_element(
1579                full_knots_depth[ix_d : ix_d + degree + 2], extrapolate=False
1580            )
1581            self.bh = BSpline.basis_element(
1582                full_knots_horiz[ix_h : ix_h + degree + 2], extrapolate=False
1583            )
1584
1585        def __call__(self, d, h):
1586            return np.nan_to_num(self.bd(d)) * np.nan_to_num(self.bh(h))
1587
1588    def __init__(
1589        self,
1590        v_0,
1591        alpha_h_mat,
1592        degree=1,  # knots_depth=None, knots_horiz=None,
1593        boundary_width=None,
1594        alpha_h_boundary=None,
1595    ):
1596        r"""
1597        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
1598
1599        Parameters
1600        ----------
1601        v_0 : float
1602            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
1603        alpha_h_mat : numpy.ndarray
1604            2D rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa],
1605            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
1606            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
1607            The first dimension corresponds to depth, the second to horizontal distance.
1608        degree : int
1609            Degree [-] of the B-Splines used to represent the 2D variability of `alpha_h_mat`.
1610        # knots_depth : list, optional
1611        #     If not `None`, a sorted list of knot values between 0 and 1 of fractional depths
1612        #     where the knots for the spline interpolation for `alpha_h_mat` are located.
1613        #     Defaults to uniform knot spacing.
1614        # knots_horiz : list, optional
1615        #     Same as `knots_depth` for for the horizontal direction.
1616        boundary_width : float
1617            The width of the transition zone [m] to the boundary `alpha_h` value.
1618        alpha_h_boundary : float
1619            The value of `alpha_h` [Pa] at the boundaries of the simulation.
1620        """
1621
1622        # input check
1623        assert not np.logical_xor(alpha_h_boundary is None, boundary_width is None)
1624        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
1625        assert (
1626            isinstance(alpha_h_mat, np.ndarray) and alpha_h_mat.ndim == 2
1627        ), "'alpha_h_mat' needs to be a 2D NumPy array."
1628
1629        # initialization
1630        self.n_vars = 2
1631        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
1632        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
1633        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
1634        self.alpha_h_mat = alpha_h_mat.astype(float)
1635        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1636        self.degree = int(degree)
1637        """ Degree of the B-Splines [-] """
1638        self.boundary_width = None if boundary_width is None else float(boundary_width)
1639        """ Width [m] of the boundary zone """
1640        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
1641            None if alpha_h_boundary is None else float(alpha_h_boundary)
1642        )
1643        r""" Boundary rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1644
1645        # prepare 2d spline creation
1646        self.num_bases_depth = self.alpha_h_mat.shape[0]
1647        """ Number of bases [-] in the depth direction """
1648        self.num_bases_horiz = self.alpha_h_mat.shape[1]
1649        """ Number of bases [-] in the horizontal direction """
1650        num_knots_depth = self.num_bases_depth - self.degree + 1
1651        num_knots_horiz = self.num_bases_horiz - self.degree + 1
1652        inner_knots_depth = (
1653            np.linspace(0, 1, num=num_knots_depth)
1654            if num_knots_depth > 1
1655            else np.array([])
1656        )
1657        inner_knots_horiz = (
1658            np.linspace(0, 1, num=num_knots_horiz)
1659            if num_knots_horiz > 1
1660            else np.array([])
1661        )
1662        full_knots_depth = np.concatenate(
1663            [[0] * self.degree, inner_knots_depth, [1] * self.degree]
1664        )
1665        full_knots_horiz = np.concatenate(
1666            [[0] * self.degree, inner_knots_horiz, [1] * self.degree]
1667        )
1668
1669        # create 2D basis functions
1670        self.bases = np.array(
1671            [
1672                [
1673                    RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D.CustomBasisFunction(
1674                        full_knots_depth, full_knots_horiz, self.degree, ix_d, ix_h
1675                    )
1676                    for ix_h in range(self.num_bases_horiz)
1677                ]
1678                for ix_d in range(self.num_bases_depth)
1679            ]
1680        )
1681        """ Matrix of 2D spline basis functions """
1682
1683    def get_param_vectors(
1684        self, patch_depths, patch_horiz, patch_centroids, outer_vertices
1685    ):
1686        r"""
1687        Calculate the 2D-varying array of :math:`\alpha_h` and how it is made.
1688        """
1689        # first part: general 2d-varying alpha_h
1690        bases_eval = np.stack(
1691            [b(patch_depths, patch_horiz) for b in self.bases.ravel()], axis=-1
1692        ).reshape(patch_depths.size, self.num_bases_depth, self.num_bases_horiz)
1693        alpha_h_vec_raw = 10 ** np.sum(
1694            bases_eval * np.log10(self.alpha_h_mat[None, :, :]), axis=(1, 2)
1695        )
1696        # get flattened indices of dominant bases
1697        dominant_bases = np.argmax(bases_eval.reshape(alpha_h_vec_raw.size, -1), axis=1)
1698
1699        # second part: make borders to non-simulated patches gradually stronger
1700        if self.alpha_h_boundary is None:
1701            alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec_raw
1702        else:
1703            # distances from inner patch centroids to vertices
1704            dists = cdist(patch_centroids, outer_vertices)
1705            # minimum distances
1706            min_dists = np.min(dists, axis=1)
1707            # alpha_h_vec if this distance was the only metric
1708            boundary_vec = 10 ** (
1709                (self.boundary_width - min_dists)
1710                / self.boundary_width
1711                * np.log10(self.alpha_h_boundary)
1712            )
1713            # final alpha_h_vec is the element-wise maximum of the two
1714            alpha_h_vec = np.fmax(boundary_vec, alpha_h_vec_raw)
1715            # set to NaN where the boundary condition took over
1716            bc_strongest = np.argmax(
1717                np.vstack([alpha_h_vec_raw, boundary_vec]), axis=0
1718            ).astype(bool)
1719            dominant_bases[bc_strongest] = -1
1720
1721        # done
1722        return alpha_h_vec, dominant_bases
1723
1724    def get_valid_domain(self, patch_depths, patch_horiz, ix_estim_rows, ix_estim_cols):
1725        """
1726        Calculate the domain where the given row and column indices are unaffected
1727        by the other indices.
1728        """
1729        # start again with bases evaluation
1730        bases_eval = np.stack(
1731            [b(patch_depths, patch_horiz) for b in self.bases.ravel()], axis=-1
1732        ).reshape(patch_depths.size, self.num_bases_depth, self.num_bases_horiz)
1733        # find all non-estimated rows and columns
1734        ix_const_rows = [
1735            i for i in range(self.num_bases_depth) if i not in ix_estim_rows
1736        ]
1737        ix_const_cols = [
1738            i for i in range(self.num_bases_horiz) if i not in ix_estim_cols
1739        ]
1740        # find all evaluation indices that have non-zero effects from ix_const_*
1741        ix_const_mat = ~np.logical_or(
1742            np.any(
1743                bases_eval[
1744                    np.ix_(
1745                        list(range(patch_depths.size)),
1746                        ix_const_rows,
1747                        list(range(self.num_bases_horiz)),
1748                    )
1749                ]
1750                != 0,
1751                axis=(1, 2),
1752            ),
1753            np.any(
1754                bases_eval[
1755                    np.ix_(
1756                        list(range(patch_depths.size)),
1757                        list(range(self.num_bases_depth)),
1758                        ix_const_cols,
1759                    )
1760                ]
1761                != 0,
1762                axis=(1, 2),
1763            ),
1764        )
1765        # done
1766        return ix_const_mat

Implement a 2D steady-state rate-and-state rheology using the aging law (effectively becoming a rate-dependent rheology) with velocity in logarithmic space defined by

\( f_{ss} = f_0 + (a - b) * \zeta = \tau / \sigma_E \)

where \( f_{ss} \) is the steady-state friction, \( f_0 \) is a reference friction, \( a \) and \( b \) are the rate-and-state frictional parameters, \( \zeta = \log (v / v_0) \) is the logarithmic velocity, \( \tau \) is the shear stress, and \( \sigma_E \) is the effective fault normal stress.

The 2D spatial variation is implemented with B-Splines. Towards the boundaries of the simulated regions, the rheological strength is forced to a certain value regardless of the 2D spline-based variability.

RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D( v_0, alpha_h_mat, degree=1, boundary_width=None, alpha_h_boundary=None) 
1588    def __init__(
1589        self,
1590        v_0,
1591        alpha_h_mat,
1592        degree=1,  # knots_depth=None, knots_horiz=None,
1593        boundary_width=None,
1594        alpha_h_boundary=None,
1595    ):
1596        r"""
1597        Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.
1598
1599        Parameters
1600        ----------
1601        v_0 : float
1602            Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
1603        alpha_h_mat : numpy.ndarray
1604            2D rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa],
1605            where :math:`a` and :math:`b` [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties,
1606            and :math:`\sigma_E` [Pa] is effective fault normal stress.
1607            The first dimension corresponds to depth, the second to horizontal distance.
1608        degree : int
1609            Degree [-] of the B-Splines used to represent the 2D variability of `alpha_h_mat`.
1610        # knots_depth : list, optional
1611        #     If not `None`, a sorted list of knot values between 0 and 1 of fractional depths
1612        #     where the knots for the spline interpolation for `alpha_h_mat` are located.
1613        #     Defaults to uniform knot spacing.
1614        # knots_horiz : list, optional
1615        #     Same as `knots_depth` for for the horizontal direction.
1616        boundary_width : float
1617            The width of the transition zone [m] to the boundary `alpha_h` value.
1618        alpha_h_boundary : float
1619            The value of `alpha_h` [Pa] at the boundaries of the simulation.
1620        """
1621
1622        # input check
1623        assert not np.logical_xor(alpha_h_boundary is None, boundary_width is None)
1624        assert float(v_0) > 0, "RateStateSteadyLogarithmic needs to have positive v_0."
1625        assert (
1626            isinstance(alpha_h_mat, np.ndarray) and alpha_h_mat.ndim == 2
1627        ), "'alpha_h_mat' needs to be a 2D NumPy array."
1628
1629        # initialization
1630        self.n_vars = 2
1631        """ Number of variables to track by rheology [-] """
1632        self.v_0 = float(v_0)
1633        """ Reference velocity :math:`v_0` [m/s] """
1634        self.alpha_h_mat = alpha_h_mat.astype(float)
1635        r""" Rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1636        self.degree = int(degree)
1637        """ Degree of the B-Splines [-] """
1638        self.boundary_width = None if boundary_width is None else float(boundary_width)
1639        """ Width [m] of the boundary zone """
1640        self.alpha_h_boundary = (
1641            None if alpha_h_boundary is None else float(alpha_h_boundary)
1642        )
1643        r""" Boundary rate-and-state parameter :math:`(a - b) * \sigma_E` [Pa] """
1644
1645        # prepare 2d spline creation
1646        self.num_bases_depth = self.alpha_h_mat.shape[0]
1647        """ Number of bases [-] in the depth direction """
1648        self.num_bases_horiz = self.alpha_h_mat.shape[1]
1649        """ Number of bases [-] in the horizontal direction """
1650        num_knots_depth = self.num_bases_depth - self.degree + 1
1651        num_knots_horiz = self.num_bases_horiz - self.degree + 1
1652        inner_knots_depth = (
1653            np.linspace(0, 1, num=num_knots_depth)
1654            if num_knots_depth > 1
1655            else np.array([])
1656        )
1657        inner_knots_horiz = (
1658            np.linspace(0, 1, num=num_knots_horiz)
1659            if num_knots_horiz > 1
1660            else np.array([])
1661        )
1662        full_knots_depth = np.concatenate(
1663            [[0] * self.degree, inner_knots_depth, [1] * self.degree]
1664        )
1665        full_knots_horiz = np.concatenate(
1666            [[0] * self.degree, inner_knots_horiz, [1] * self.degree]
1667        )
1668
1669        # create 2D basis functions
1670        self.bases = np.array(
1671            [
1672                [
1673                    RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D.CustomBasisFunction(
1674                        full_knots_depth, full_knots_horiz, self.degree, ix_d, ix_h
1675                    )
1676                    for ix_h in range(self.num_bases_horiz)
1677                ]
1678                for ix_d in range(self.num_bases_depth)
1679            ]
1680        )
1681        """ Matrix of 2D spline basis functions """

Setup the rheology parameters for a given fault.

Parameters
  • v_0 (float): Reference velocity [m/s] used for the transformation into logarithmic space.
  • alpha_h_mat (numpy.ndarray): 2D rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa], where \( a \) and \( b \) [-] are the rate-and-state frictional properties, and \( \sigma_E \) [Pa] is effective fault normal stress. The first dimension corresponds to depth, the second to horizontal distance.
  • degree (int): Degree [-] of the B-Splines used to represent the 2D variability of alpha_h_mat.

  • # knots_depth (list, optional):

  • # If not None, a sorted list of knot values between 0 and 1 of fractional depths

  • # where the knots for the spline interpolation for alpha_h_mat are located.
  • # Defaults to uniform knot spacing.

  • # knots_horiz (list, optional):

  • # Same as knots_depth for for the horizontal direction.

  • boundary_width (float): The width of the transition zone [m] to the boundary alpha_h value.
  • alpha_h_boundary (float): The value of alpha_h [Pa] at the boundaries of the simulation.
n_vars

Number of variables to track by rheology [-]

v_0

Reference velocity \( v_0 \) [m/s]

alpha_h_mat

Rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

degree

Degree of the B-Splines [-]

boundary_width

Width [m] of the boundary zone

alpha_h_boundary

Boundary rate-and-state parameter \( (a - b) * \sigma_E \) [Pa]

num_bases_depth

Number of bases [-] in the depth direction

num_bases_horiz

Number of bases [-] in the horizontal direction

bases

Matrix of 2D spline basis functions

def get_param_vectors(self, patch_depths, patch_horiz, patch_centroids, outer_vertices): 
1683    def get_param_vectors(
1684        self, patch_depths, patch_horiz, patch_centroids, outer_vertices
1685    ):
1686        r"""
1687        Calculate the 2D-varying array of :math:`\alpha_h` and how it is made.
1688        """
1689        # first part: general 2d-varying alpha_h
1690        bases_eval = np.stack(
1691            [b(patch_depths, patch_horiz) for b in self.bases.ravel()], axis=-1
1692        ).reshape(patch_depths.size, self.num_bases_depth, self.num_bases_horiz)
1693        alpha_h_vec_raw = 10 ** np.sum(
1694            bases_eval * np.log10(self.alpha_h_mat[None, :, :]), axis=(1, 2)
1695        )
1696        # get flattened indices of dominant bases
1697        dominant_bases = np.argmax(bases_eval.reshape(alpha_h_vec_raw.size, -1), axis=1)
1698
1699        # second part: make borders to non-simulated patches gradually stronger
1700        if self.alpha_h_boundary is None:
1701            alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec_raw
1702        else:
1703            # distances from inner patch centroids to vertices
1704            dists = cdist(patch_centroids, outer_vertices)
1705            # minimum distances
1706            min_dists = np.min(dists, axis=1)
1707            # alpha_h_vec if this distance was the only metric
1708            boundary_vec = 10 ** (
1709                (self.boundary_width - min_dists)
1710                / self.boundary_width
1711                * np.log10(self.alpha_h_boundary)
1712            )
1713            # final alpha_h_vec is the element-wise maximum of the two
1714            alpha_h_vec = np.fmax(boundary_vec, alpha_h_vec_raw)
1715            # set to NaN where the boundary condition took over
1716            bc_strongest = np.argmax(
1717                np.vstack([alpha_h_vec_raw, boundary_vec]), axis=0
1718            ).astype(bool)
1719            dominant_bases[bc_strongest] = -1
1720
1721        # done
1722        return alpha_h_vec, dominant_bases

Calculate the 2D-varying array of \( \alpha_h \) and how it is made.

def get_valid_domain(self, patch_depths, patch_horiz, ix_estim_rows, ix_estim_cols): 
1724    def get_valid_domain(self, patch_depths, patch_horiz, ix_estim_rows, ix_estim_cols):
1725        """
1726        Calculate the domain where the given row and column indices are unaffected
1727        by the other indices.
1728        """
1729        # start again with bases evaluation
1730        bases_eval = np.stack(
1731            [b(patch_depths, patch_horiz) for b in self.bases.ravel()], axis=-1
1732        ).reshape(patch_depths.size, self.num_bases_depth, self.num_bases_horiz)
1733        # find all non-estimated rows and columns
1734        ix_const_rows = [
1735            i for i in range(self.num_bases_depth) if i not in ix_estim_rows
1736        ]
1737        ix_const_cols = [
1738            i for i in range(self.num_bases_horiz) if i not in ix_estim_cols
1739        ]
1740        # find all evaluation indices that have non-zero effects from ix_const_*
1741        ix_const_mat = ~np.logical_or(
1742            np.any(
1743                bases_eval[
1744                    np.ix_(
1745                        list(range(patch_depths.size)),
1746                        ix_const_rows,
1747                        list(range(self.num_bases_horiz)),
1748                    )
1749                ]
1750                != 0,
1751                axis=(1, 2),
1752            ),
1753            np.any(
1754                bases_eval[
1755                    np.ix_(
1756                        list(range(patch_depths.size)),
1757                        list(range(self.num_bases_depth)),
1758                        ix_const_cols,
1759                    )
1760                ]
1761                != 0,
1762                axis=(1, 2),
1763            ),
1764        )
1765        # done
1766        return ix_const_mat

Calculate the domain where the given row and column indices are unaffected by the other indices.

class RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D.CustomBasisFunction: 
1576    class CustomBasisFunction:
1577        def __init__(self, full_knots_depth, full_knots_horiz, degree, ix_d, ix_h):
1578            self.bd = BSpline.basis_element(
1579                full_knots_depth[ix_d : ix_d + degree + 2], extrapolate=False
1580            )
1581            self.bh = BSpline.basis_element(
1582                full_knots_horiz[ix_h : ix_h + degree + 2], extrapolate=False
1583            )
1584
1585        def __call__(self, d, h):
1586            return np.nan_to_num(self.bd(d)) * np.nan_to_num(self.bh(h))
RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D.CustomBasisFunction(full_knots_depth, full_knots_horiz, degree, ix_d, ix_h) 
1577        def __init__(self, full_knots_depth, full_knots_horiz, degree, ix_d, ix_h):
1578            self.bd = BSpline.basis_element(
1579                full_knots_depth[ix_d : ix_d + degree + 2], extrapolate=False
1580            )
1581            self.bh = BSpline.basis_element(
1582                full_knots_horiz[ix_h : ix_h + degree + 2], extrapolate=False
1583            )
bd
bh
class Fault3D: 
1769class Fault3D:
1770    """
1771    Base class for the subduction fault mesh.
1772    """
1773
1774    # shorthands for specifying farfield motion type
1775    FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM = 1
1776    FARFIELD_MOTION_ROTATION = 2
1777    FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER = 3
1778    FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED = 4
1779
1780    def __init__(
1781        self,
1782        inner_mesh_files,
1783        asperity_mesh_files,
1784        lower_mesh_files,
1785        downdip_direction,
1786        mu,
1787        nu,
1788        v_s,
1789        farfield_motion,
1790        farfield_motion_type,
1791        max_simulated_distance,
1792        max_simulated_depth,
1793        orient_along=0,
1794        offset_lower=0,
1795        utmzone=None,
1796        lon0=None,
1797        lat0=None,
1798        K_inner_asperities=None,
1799        K_inner_inner=None,
1800        cross_sections=None,
1801    ):
1802        """
1803        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1804        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1805
1806        The inner mesh consists of the asperities as well as the surrounding
1807        creeping patches, formulated as triangular dislocation elements.
1808
1809        The outer mesh consists of the boundary patches that are necessary
1810        to recover longterm surface displacement due to continuous fault slip.
1811
1812        Parameters
1813        ----------
1814        inner_mesh_files : list
1815            Path to `.tet` mesh file defining the inner mesh on the upper plate
1816            interface.
1817        asperity_mesh_files : list
1818            List of paths to `.tet` mesh files defining the upper plate interface's
1819            asperities, assumed to be within the inner mesh.
1820        lower_mesh_files : list
1821            List of paths to `.tet` mesh files defining the lower plate interface.
1822        downdip_direction : str
1823            Direction into which the inner mesh should be extended using the
1824            normal vectors. All other directions will be extended on constant
1825            boundary depth. Two-character code of sign `+-` and axes `xy`.
1826        mu : float
1827            Shear modulus [Pa]
1828        nu : float
1829            Poisson's ratio [-]
1830        v_s : float
1831            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1832        farfield_motion : numpy.ndarray
1833            Either a 1D array containing the uniform plate motion [m/s] in ENU for all patches,
1834            or an ECEF rotation vector [/Ma], a Longitude/Latitude/Rate Euler Pole [],
1835            or a 2D array containing the precomputed ENU plate velocity [m/s] at each patch.
1836        farfield_motion_type : int
1837            Describes the type of `farfield_motion` between `1` (uniform), `2`
1838            (ECEF rotation), `3` (Euler Pole), or `4` (precomputed).
1839        max_simulated_distance : float
1840            Maximum horizontal distance [m] from asperities until which to simulate patches
1841        max_simulated_depth : float
1842            Maximum depth [m] (positive) until which to simulate patches
1843        orient_along : float
1844            Angle [ counter-clockwise from east] of the subduction fault strike.
1845        offset_lower : float
1846            Additional offset the lower part of the mesh [m] (positive means upwards shift)
1847        utmzone : int, optional
1848            If `farfield_motion_type` is an ECEF rotation or Euler Pole, it is necessary to
1849            know in which coordinate system the mesh files are.
1850        lon0 : float, optional
1851            If there is a custom longitude offset [] used in calculating the mesh file
1852            UTM coordinates, provide it here.
1853        lat0 : float, optional
1854            If there is a custom latitude offset [] used in calculating the mesh file
1855            UTM coordinates, provide it here.
1856        K_inner_asperities : numpy.ndarray, optional
1857            Precomputed stress kernel from the asperities to the inner mesh [Pa/m]
1858        K_inner_inner : numpy.ndarray, optional
1859            Precomputed stress kernel within the inner mesh [Pa/m]
1860        cross_sections : list, optional
1861            Precomputed valid cross sections
1862        """
1863
1864        # input check
1865        assert isinstance(inner_mesh_files, list)
1866        assert isinstance(asperity_mesh_files, list)
1867        assert isinstance(lower_mesh_files, list)
1868        assert isinstance(downdip_direction, str)
1869        assert 1 <= farfield_motion_type <= 4
1870        assert isinstance(farfield_motion_type, int)
1871        if farfield_motion_type == 4:
1872            assert (
1873                isinstance(farfield_motion, np.ndarray)
1874                and (farfield_motion.ndim == 2)
1875                and (farfield_motion.shape[1] == 3)
1876            )
1877        else:
1878            assert (
1879                isinstance(farfield_motion, np.ndarray)
1880                and (farfield_motion.ndim == 1)
1881                and (farfield_motion.size == 3)
1882            )
1883        if farfield_motion_type in (2, 3):
1884            assert isinstance(utmzone, int), (
1885                f"For 'farfield_motion_type={farfield_motion_type}', "
1886                "an integer 'utmzone' needs to be provided."
1887            )
1888        use_normals = [False, False, False, False]
1889        if downdip_direction[0] == "+":
1890            if downdip_direction[1] == "x":
1891                use_normals[0] = True
1892            elif downdip_direction[1] == "y":
1893                use_normals[1] = True
1894        elif downdip_direction[0] == "-":
1895            if downdip_direction[1] == "x":
1896                use_normals[2] = True
1897            elif downdip_direction[1] == "y":
1898                use_normals[3] = True
1899        if not any(use_normals):
1900            raise ValueError(f"Can't parse 'use_normals' from {downdip_direction}.")
1901
1902        # material properties
1903        self.mu = float(mu)
1904        """ Shear modulus [Pa] """
1905        self.nu = float(nu)
1906        """ Poisson's ratio [-] """
1907        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1908        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1909        self.E = 2 * self.mu * (1 + self.nu)
1910        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1911        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1912        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1913        self.farfield_motion_type = farfield_motion_type
1914        """ Type of farfield motion used to calculate plate velocity """
1915        self.utmzone = int(utmzone) if utmzone is not None else None
1916        """ UTM zone number of fault coordinates """
1917
1918        # simulation boundaries
1919        assert max_simulated_distance > 0
1920        self.max_simulated_distance = float(max_simulated_distance)
1921        """ Maximum horizontal distance [m] from asperities until which to simulate patches """
1922        assert max_simulated_depth > 0
1923        self.max_simulated_depth = float(max_simulated_depth)
1924        """ Maximum depth [m] (positive) until which to simulate patches """
1925        self.orient_along = float(orient_along)
1926        """ Main orientation of the subduction zone [] """
1927        self.offset_lower = float(offset_lower)
1928        """ Offset applied to the lower mesh files [m] """
1929
1930        # create asperities mesh
1931        vertices_asperities, triangles_asperities, match_sources = combine_tet(
1932            *asperity_mesh_files, return_sources=True
1933        )
1934        # correct custom UTM by applying average shift
1935        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
1936            offset_en = (
1937                correct_custom_utm(vertices_asperities[:, :2], self.utmzone, lon0, lat0)
1938                - vertices_asperities[:, :2]
1939            ).mean(axis=0)
1940            vertices_asperities[:, :2] += offset_en
1941        assert (
1942            vertices_asperities[:, 2].max() <= 0
1943        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the asperities mesh."
1944        vertices_asperities, triangles_asperities = force_normals(
1945            vertices_asperities, triangles_asperities, normals_up=False
1946        )
1947        self.asperities_vertices = vertices_asperities
1948        """ Vertex coordinates for the asperities mesh [m] """
1949        self.asperities_triangles = triangles_asperities
1950        """ Triangle definitions for the asperities mesh [-] """
1951        self.asperities_patches = self.asperities_vertices[self.asperities_triangles]
1952        """ Asperities patches """
1953        self.asperities_polygons = [
1954            shapely.Polygon(arr) for arr in self.asperities_patches
1955        ]
1956        """ List of all asperity triangles as Shapely Polygons """
1957        self.asperities_centroids = np.mean(self.asperities_patches, axis=1)
1958        """ Centroids of asperities patches [m] """
1959        self.asperities_num_vertices = self.asperities_vertices.shape[0]
1960        """ Number of asperities vertices [-] """
1961        self.asperities_num_patches = self.asperities_triangles.shape[0]
1962        """ Number of asperities patches/triangles [-] """
1963        self.asperity_indices = match_sources
1964        """ List of indices matching each triangle to an asperity """
1965        self.num_asperities = len(self.asperity_indices)
1966        """ Number of distinct asperities """
1967
1968        # create asperities rotation matrices
1969        self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
1970            self.asperities_patches
1971        )
1972        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the asperities patches """
1973
1974        # create inner mesh
1975        vertices_inner, triangles_inner = combine_tet(*inner_mesh_files)
1976        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
1977            vertices_inner[:, :2] += offset_en
1978        assert (
1979            vertices_inner[:, 2].max() <= 0
1980        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the inner mesh."
1981        vertices_inner, triangles_inner = force_normals(
1982            vertices_inner, triangles_inner, normals_up=False
1983        )
1984        # extend upper plate interface
1985        extend_directions = ~np.roll(use_normals, 2)
1986        R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
1987            vertices_inner[triangles_inner]
1988        )
1989        vertices_combined, triangles_combined = extend_mesh(
1990            vertices_inner,
1991            triangles_inner,
1992            use_normals=use_normals,
1993            directions=extend_directions,
1994            normals_in=R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs[:, 2, :],
1995        )
1996        vertices_inf = vertices_combined[vertices_inner.shape[0] :, :].copy()
1997        vertices_combined, triangles_combined = force_normals(
1998            vertices_combined, triangles_combined, normals_up=False
1999        )
2000        vertices_simulated, vertices_imposed, triangles_simulated, triangles_imposed = (
2001            split_mesh(
2002                vertices_combined,
2003                triangles_combined,
2004                self.asperities_patches,
2005                max_distance=self.max_simulated_distance,
2006                max_depth=self.max_simulated_depth,
2007            )
2008        )
2009        ix_v_inf = np.concatenate(
2010            [
2011                np.flatnonzero(np.all(vertices_imposed == v, axis=1))
2012                for v in vertices_inf.tolist()
2013            ]
2014        )
2015        assert ix_v_inf.size == vertices_inf.shape[0]
2016        self.ix_tri_inf = np.any(np.isin(triangles_imposed, ix_v_inf), axis=1)
2017        """ Indices of infinity triangles """
2018
2019        # save inner mesh
2020        self.inner_vertices = vertices_simulated
2021        """ Vertex coordinates for the inner mesh [m] """
2022        self.inner_triangles = triangles_simulated
2023        """ Triangle definitions for the inner mesh [-] """
2024        self.inner_patches = self.inner_vertices[self.inner_triangles]
2025        """ Inner patches """
2026        self.inner_centroids = np.mean(self.inner_patches, axis=1)
2027        """ Centroids of inner patches [m] """
2028        self.inner_num_vertices = self.inner_vertices.shape[0]
2029        """ Number of inner vertices [-] """
2030        self.inner_num_patches = self.inner_triangles.shape[0]
2031        """ Number of inner patches/triangles [-] """
2032
2033        # create inner rotation matrices
2034        self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.inner_patches)
2035        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the inner patches """
2036
2037        # create a joint inner and asperities mesh for 2D projection purposes
2038        slab_vertices = np.concatenate(
2039            [self.inner_vertices, self.asperities_vertices], axis=0
2040        )
