2041        slab_triangles = np.concatenate(
2042            [
2043                self.inner_triangles,
2044                self.asperities_triangles + self.inner_vertices.shape[0],
2045            ],
2046            axis=0,
2047        )
2048        slab_vertices, slab_triangles = remove_duplicate_vertices(
2049            slab_vertices, slab_triangles
2050        )
2051        self.slab_vertices = slab_vertices
2052        """ Vertex coordinates for the slab mesh (inner + asperities) [m] """
2053        self.slab_triangles = slab_triangles
2054        """ Triangle definitions for the slab mesh (inner + asperities) [-] """
2055
2056        # save outer mesh
2057        self.outer_vertices = vertices_imposed
2058        """ Vertex coordinates for the outer upper mesh [m] """
2059        self.outer_vertices_noninf = vertices_imposed
2060        """ Vertex coordinates for the outer upper mesh [m] """
2061        self.outer_triangles = triangles_imposed
2062        """ Triangle definitions for the outer upper mesh [-] """
2063        self.outer_triangles_noninf = triangles_imposed[~self.ix_tri_inf, :]
2064        """ Triangle definitions for the outer upper mesh [-], excluding extended patches """
2065        self.outer_patches = self.outer_vertices[self.outer_triangles]
2066        """ Outer upper patches """
2067        self.outer_centroids = np.mean(self.outer_patches, axis=1)
2068        """ Centroids of outer upper patches [m] """
2069        self.outer_num_vertices = self.outer_vertices.shape[0]
2070        """ Number of outer upper vertices [-] """
2071        self.outer_num_patches = self.outer_triangles.shape[0]
2072        """ Number of outer upper patches/triangles [-] """
2073
2074        # create outer upper rotation matrices
2075        self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.outer_patches)
2076        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the outer patches """
2077
2078        # create lower plate interface mesh
2079        vertices_lower, triangles_lower = combine_tet(*lower_mesh_files)
2080        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
2081            vertices_lower[:, :2] += offset_en
2082        vertices_lower[:, 2] += self.offset_lower
2083        assert (
2084            vertices_lower[:, 2].max() <= 0
2085        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the lower mesh."
2086        # extend in all directions
2087        R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
2088            vertices_lower[triangles_lower]
2089        )
2090        vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended = extend_mesh(
2091            vertices_lower,
2092            triangles_lower,
2093            use_normals=use_normals,
2094            normals_in=R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs[:, 2, :],
2095        )
2096        self.num_lower_extended = (
2097            triangles_lower_extended.shape[0] - triangles_lower.shape[0]
2098        )
2099        """ Number of triangles that were added to the lower plate interface """
2100        vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended = force_normals(
2101            vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended, normals_up=True
2102        )
2103        self.lower_vertices = vertices_lower_extended
2104        """ Vertex coordinates for the lower mesh [m] """
2105        self.lower_triangles = triangles_lower_extended
2106        """ Triangle definitions for the lower mesh [-] """
2107        self.lower_patches = self.lower_vertices[self.lower_triangles]
2108        """ Lower patches """
2109        self.lower_centroids = np.mean(self.lower_patches, axis=1)
2110        """ Centroids of lower patches [m] """
2111        self.lower_num_vertices = self.lower_vertices.shape[0]
2112        """ Number of lower vertices [-] """
2113        self.lower_num_patches = self.lower_triangles.shape[0]
2114        """ Number of lower patches/triangles [-] """
2115
2116        # create lower rotation matrices
2117        self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.lower_patches)
2118        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the lower patches """
2119
2120        # create a joint R tensor
2121        self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs = np.concatenate(
2122            [
2123                self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs,
2124                self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs,
2125                self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs,
2126                self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs,
2127            ],
2128            axis=0,
2129        )
2130        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for all patches """
2131
2132        # create a joint centroids array
2133        self.joint_centroids = np.concatenate(
2134            [
2135                self.inner_centroids,
2136                self.asperities_centroids,
2137                self.outer_centroids,
2138                self.lower_centroids,
2139            ],
2140            axis=0,
2141        )
2142        """ Centroids of all patches [m] """
2143
2144        # create a joint patches array
2145        self.joint_patches = np.concatenate(
2146            [
2147                self.inner_patches,
2148                self.asperities_patches,
2149                self.outer_patches,
2150                self.lower_patches,
2151            ],
2152            axis=0,
2153        )
2154        """ All patches [m] """
2155
2156        # create slice objects for all subsets in the joint arrays
2157        self.s_inner = np.s_[0 : self.inner_num_patches]
2158        """ Slice object to recover the inner patches from all patches """
2159        self.s_asperities = np.s_[
2160            self.inner_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2161            + self.asperities_num_patches
2162        ]
2163        """ Slice object to recover the asperities' patches from all patches """
2164        self.s_outer = np.s_[
2165            self.inner_num_patches
2166            + self.asperities_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2167            + self.asperities_num_patches
2168            + self.outer_num_patches
2169        ]
2170        """ Slice object to recover the outer patches from all patches """
2171        self.s_lower = np.s_[
2172            self.inner_num_patches
2173            + self.asperities_num_patches
2174            + self.outer_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2175            + self.asperities_num_patches
2176            + self.outer_num_patches
2177            + self.lower_num_patches
2178        ]
2179        """ Slice object to recover the lower patches from all patches """
2180        self.joint_num_patches = (
2181            self.inner_num_patches
2182            + self.asperities_num_patches
2183            + self.outer_num_patches
2184            + self.lower_num_patches
2185        )
2186        """ Total number of patches """
2187
2188        # calculate farfield motion unit vector
2189        if farfield_motion_type in (
2190            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM,
2191            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED,
2192        ):
2193            v_plate_vec = np.ascontiguousarray(
2194                np.broadcast_to(farfield_motion, (self.joint_num_patches, 3))
2195            )
2196        elif farfield_motion_type in (
2197            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_ROTATION,
2198            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER,
2199        ):
2200            # convert rotation format if necessary
2201            if farfield_motion_type == self.FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER:
2202                farfield_motion = np.rad2deg(
2203                    eulerpole2rotvec(np.deg2rad(farfield_motion))
2204                )
2205            # define coordinate systems
2206            crs_lla = ccrs.Geodetic()
2207            crs_xyz = ccrs.Geocentric()
2208            crs_utm = ccrs.UTM(zone=self.utmzone)
2209            # get locations of centroids in lon/lat and ECEF cartesian
2210            centroids_lla = crs_lla.transform_points(
2211                crs_utm, self.joint_centroids[:, 0], self.joint_centroids[:, 1]
2212            )
2213            centroids_xyz = crs_xyz.transform_points(
2214                crs_utm, self.joint_centroids[:, 0], self.joint_centroids[:, 1]
2215            )
2216            # calculate rotation from rotation vector
2217            farfield_motion_rad_s = np.deg2rad(farfield_motion) / 1e6 / SEC_PER_YEAR
2218            centroids_vel_xyz = np.cross(farfield_motion_rad_s, centroids_xyz)
2219            # project into local ENU
2220            v_plate_vec = np.stack(
2221                [
2222                    (R_ecef2enu(lo, la) @ centroids_vel_xyz[i, :])
2223                    for i, (lo, la) in enumerate(
2224                        zip(centroids_lla[:, 0], centroids_lla[:, 1])
2225                    )
2226                ]
2227            )
2228            # the infinitely extending patches are probably not covered by this
2229            # approximation and will yield NaNs, so we assign the same plate
2230            # velocity to them as the nearest non-infinite patch
2231            ix_inf = (
2232                np.flatnonzero(self.ix_tri_inf)
2233                + self.inner_num_patches
2234                + self.asperities_num_patches
2235            ).tolist() + (
2236                np.arange(self.lower_num_patches)[-self.num_lower_extended :]
2237                + self.inner_num_patches
2238                + self.asperities_num_patches
2239                + self.outer_num_patches
2240            ).tolist()
2241            ix_notinf = ~np.isin(np.arange(self.joint_num_patches), ix_inf)
2242            # loop over infinite patch indices
2243            for i in ix_inf:
2244                # find closest non-infinite patch
2245                j = np.argmin(
2246                    np.linalg.norm(
2247                        self.joint_centroids[ix_notinf, :]
2248                        - self.joint_centroids[i, :][None, :],
2249                        axis=1,
2250                    )
2251                )
2252                v_plate_vec[i, :] = v_plate_vec[ix_notinf, :][j, :]
2253
2254        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2255        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity at all patches in the dimensions of the rheology """
2256
2257        # project v_plate_vec onto each patch
2258        self.e_plate_tdcs = Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2259            self.v_plate_vec / np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate_vec, axis=1, keepdims=True),
2260            self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs,
2261        )
2262        """ Unit plate velocity direction in the TDCS [m] """
2263        self.e_plate_tdcs_proj = Fault3D.redistribute_normal(self.e_plate_tdcs)
2264        """ Projected unit plate velocity direction in TDCS [m] """
2265
2266        # create DDCS
2267        # angle between plate velocity and TDCS strike (already on same plane)
2268        alpha = np.arctan2(self.e_plate_tdcs_proj[:, 1], self.e_plate_tdcs_proj[:, 0])
2269        # inner
2270        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2271            [
2272                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2273                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2274                )
2275                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_inner])
2276            ]
2277        )
2278        self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2279            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2280        )
2281        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the inner patches """
2282        self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2283            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs
2284        )
2285        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the inner patches """
2286        # asperities
2287        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2288            [
2289                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2290                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2291                )
2292                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_asperities])
2293            ]
2294        )
2295        self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2296            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2297        )
2298        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the asperities patches """
2299        self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2300            "ijk,ilk->ijl",
2301            self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs,
2302            self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs,
2303        )
2304        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the asperities patches """
2305        # outer
2306        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2307            [
2308                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2309                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2310                )
2311                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_outer])
2312            ]
2313        )
2314        self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2315            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2316        )
2317        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the outer patches """
2318        self.R_outer_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2319            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs
2320        )
2321        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the outer patches """
2322        # lower
2323        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2324            [
2325                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2326                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2327                )
2328                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_lower])
2329            ]
2330        )
2331        self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2332            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2333        )
2334        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the lower patches """
2335        self.R_lower_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2336            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs
2337        )
2338        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the lower patches """
2339
2340        # create more joint R tensors
2341        self.R_joint_efcs_to_ddcs = np.concatenate(
2342            [
2343                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2344                self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs,
2345                self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs,
2346                self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs,
2347            ],
2348            axis=0,
2349        )
2350        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for all patches """
2351        self.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.concatenate(
2352            [
2353                self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2354                self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2355                self.R_outer_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2356                self.R_lower_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2357            ],
2358            axis=0,
2359        )
2360        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for all patches """
2361
2362        # project v_plate_vec onto each patch again, this time DDCS
2363        self.e_plate_ddcs_proj = Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2364            self.e_plate_tdcs_proj, self.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2]
2365        )
2366        """ Projected unit plate velocity direction in DDCS [m] """
2367        e_plate_tdcs_proj_3d = np.concatenate(
2368            [self.e_plate_tdcs_proj, np.zeros((self.e_plate_tdcs_proj.shape[0], 1))],
2369            axis=1,
2370        )
2371        e_plate_efcs_proj_3d = Fault3D.vectors_backward_rotation(
2372            e_plate_tdcs_proj_3d, self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs
2373        )
2374        assert np.allclose(
2375            np.concatenate(
2376                [
2377                    self.e_plate_ddcs_proj,
2378                    np.zeros((self.e_plate_ddcs_proj.shape[0], 1)),
2379                ],
2380                axis=1,
2381            ),
2382            Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2383                e_plate_efcs_proj_3d, self.R_joint_efcs_to_ddcs
2384            ),
2385        )
2386
2387        # compute the relevant stress kernels in DDCS, if not already provided
2388        if K_inner_asperities is None:
2389            print("Calculating asperity stress kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
2390            tic = perf_counter()
2391            K_inner_asperities = self.get_stress_kernel(
2392                self.asperities_patches,
2393                self.inner_centroids,
2394                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2395                self.mu,
2396                self.nu,
2397                rot_mats_tdcs=self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2398            )
2399            toc = perf_counter()
2400            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2401        else:
2402            assert isinstance(
2403                K_inner_asperities, np.ndarray
2404            ), f"Expected 'K_inner_asperities' NumPy array, got {type(K_inner_asperities)}."
2405            expected_shape = (self.inner_num_patches, 3, self.asperities_num_patches, 3)
2406            assert K_inner_asperities.shape == expected_shape, (
2407                f"Expected 'K_inner_asperities' shape of {expected_shape}, "
2408                f"got {K_inner_asperities.shape}."
2409            )
2410            print(f"Accepted input 'K_inner_asperities' of shape {expected_shape}.")
2411        self.K_inner_asperities = K_inner_asperities
2412        """ Stress kernel from the asperities to the inner mesh [Pa/m] """
2413        if K_inner_inner is None:
2414            print("Calculating internal stress kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
2415            tic = perf_counter()
2416            K_inner_inner = self.get_stress_kernel(
2417                self.inner_patches,
2418                self.inner_centroids,
2419                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2420                self.mu,
2421                self.nu,
2422                rot_mats_tdcs=self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2423            )
2424            toc = perf_counter()
2425            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2426        else:
2427            assert isinstance(
2428                K_inner_inner, np.ndarray
2429            ), f"Expected 'K_inner_inner' NumPy array, got {type(K_inner_inner)}."
2430            expected_shape = (self.inner_num_patches, 3, self.inner_num_patches, 3)
2431            assert K_inner_inner.shape == expected_shape, (
2432                f"Expected 'K_inner_inner' shape of {expected_shape}, "
2433                f"got {K_inner_inner.shape}."
2434            )
2435            print(f"Accepted input 'K_inner_inner' of shape {expected_shape}.")
2436        self.K_inner_inner = K_inner_inner
2437        """ Stress kernel within the inner mesh [Pa/m] """
2438
2439        # calculate horizontal cross sections
2440        if cross_sections is None:
2441            print("Calculating mesh cross sections... ", flush=True, end="")
2442            tic = perf_counter()
2443            # format mesh
2444            trimesh = meshcut.TriangleMesh(self.slab_vertices, self.slab_triangles)
2445            # get all cross sections
2446            all_cross_sections = [
2447                meshcut.cross_section_mesh(
2448                    trimesh,
2449                    meshcut.Plane(self.inner_centroids[i, :], [0, 0, 1]),
2450                    dist_tol=1,
2451                )
2452                for i in range(self.inner_num_patches)
2453            ]
2454            # eliminate those that have multiple segments
2455            cross_sections = [
2456                cs[0] if len(cs) == 1 else None for cs in all_cross_sections
2457            ]
2458            # eliminate those that are significantly shorter than the median, so probably wrong
2459            cs_lengths = np.array(
2460                [
2461                    shapely.LineString(cs).length if cs is not None else np.nan
2462                    for cs in cross_sections
2463                ]
2464            )
2465            cs_length_cutoff = np.nanmedian(cs_lengths) * 0.8
2466            for i in np.flatnonzero(cs_lengths < cs_length_cutoff):
2467                cross_sections[i] = None
2468            toc = perf_counter()
2469            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2470        else:
2471            assert isinstance(cross_sections, list) and all(
2472                [
2473                    (
2474                        isinstance(cs, np.ndarray)
2475                        and (cs.ndim == 2)
2476                        and (cs.shape[1] == 3)
2477                    )
2478                    or (cs is None)
2479                    for cs in cross_sections
2480                ]
2481            ), "Expected a list of Nones or well-shaped NumPy arrays as cross sections."
2482            print("Accepted input 'cross_sections'.")
2483        self.cross_sections = cross_sections
2484        """ Horizontal cross sections through the inner centroid along the slab """
2485
2486        # calculate the spline coefficients onto which to interpolate rheological values
2487        # convert the ENU coordinates of patch_centroids into a vertical (depth) and horizontal
2488        # (along-strike, constant depth) coordinate system, and normalize to (0, 1)
2489        # vertical (increasing towards greater depth)
2490        assert np.all(self.inner_centroids[:, 2] <= 0)
2491        patch_depths = (self.inner_centroids[:, 2] - self.slab_vertices[:, 2].max()) / (
2492            self.slab_vertices[:, 2].min() - self.slab_vertices[:, 2].max()
2493        )
2494        # horizontal
2495        patch_horiz = np.zeros_like(patch_depths)
2496        target_dir = np.array(
2497            [
2498                np.cos(np.deg2rad(self.orient_along)),
2499                np.sin(np.deg2rad(self.orient_along)),
2500            ]
2501        )
2502        successful_lines = [None for _ in range(patch_horiz.size)]
2503        # get all horizontal cut lines
2504        for i, cs in enumerate(self.cross_sections):
2505            # use the supplied cross-sections
2506            if cs is not None:
2507                # we can use Shapely for the distance along the line since the z-component does
2508                # not vary because of how we slice
2509                ls = shapely.LineString(cs)
2510                assert ls.is_simple and ls.is_valid, "LineString not valid or simple"
2511                # make sure the line points in the right direction
2512                ls_dir = np.array(
2513                    [
2514                        ls.coords[-1][1] - ls.coords[0][1],
2515                        ls.coords[-1][0] - ls.coords[0][0],
2516                    ]
2517                )
2518                dir_diff = np.arccos(
2519                    np.dot(target_dir, ls_dir) / np.linalg.norm(ls_dir)
2520                )
2521                if dir_diff > np.pi / 2:
2522                    ls = ls.reverse()
2523                # save for later use
2524                successful_lines[i] = ls
2525        # calculate all horizontal distances
2526        for i, test_ls in enumerate(successful_lines):
2527            # find closest existing line if the current one didn't work
2528            ls = test_ls
2529            if ls is None:
2530                for test_ix in np.argsort(np.abs(patch_depths[i] - patch_depths)):
2531                    if successful_lines[test_ix] is not None:
2532                        ls = successful_lines[test_ix]
2533                        break
2534            assert ls is not None
2535            # now calculate the normalized distance along the cross section until the centroid
2536            patch_horiz[i] = ls.line_locate_point(
2537                shapely.Point(self.inner_centroids[i, :]), normalized=True
2538            )
2539        patch_horiz[patch_horiz == 1] -= 1e-10
2540        # save
2541        self.inner_patch_2d_coords = np.stack([patch_depths, patch_horiz], axis=1)
2542        """
2543        2D normalized coordinates of the inner patches
2544        along horizontal & depth directions [-]
2545        """
2546
2547        # prepare quantities relating to slip tapering
2548        self.dists_inner_asperities = np.array(
2549            [
2550                [shapely.distance(p, shapely.Point(c)) for c in self.inner_centroids]
2551                for p in self.asperities_polygons
2552            ]
2553        )
2554        """
2555        Distances [m] between asperity triangles and inner centroids,
2556        shape (num_asperities, num_inner)
2557        """
2558        # for each asperity, get the indices of the triangle closest to each inner mesh centroid
2559        self.i_closest_asp_tri = np.array(
2560            [
2561                aix[np.argmin(self.dists_inner_asperities[aix, :], axis=0)]
2562                for aix in self.asperity_indices
2563            ]
2564        )
2565        """
2566        Indices of closest asperity triangle for each asperity and each inner patch,
2567        shape (num_asperities, num_inner)
2568        """
2569
2570    @classmethod
2571    def from_cfg_and_files(
2572        cls,
2573        fault_dict,
2574        K_inner_asperities_file=None,
2575        K_inner_inner_file=None,
2576        cross_sections_file=None,
2577        write_new_files=True,
2578        verbose=False,
2579    ):
2580        """
2581        Create a `Fault3D` object from a configuration dictionary and precomputed arrays
2582        stored to files using `write_big_files`.
2583
2584        Parameters
2585        ----------
2586        fault_dict : dict
2587            Dictionary of keyword arguments passed on to the initialization; from
2588            `SubductionSimulation3D.read_config_file`
2589        K_inner_asperities_file : str, optional
2590            File name for `K_inner_asperities`
2591        K_inner_inner_file : str, optional
2592            File name for `K_inner_inner`
2593        cross_sections_file : str, optional
2594            File name for `cross_sections`
2595        write_new_files : bool, optional
2596            Whether to save to files the kernels and cross sections if they were missing
2597        verbose : bool, optional
2598            Print what's happening
2599
2600        Returns
2601        -------
2602        fault : Fault3D
2603            The new `Fault3D` object
2604        """
2605        # check for K_inner_asperities
2606        if K_inner_asperities_file is not None:
2607            try:
2608                K_inner_asperities = np.load(K_inner_asperities_file)
2609            except FileNotFoundError:
2610                K_inner_asperities = None
2611                if verbose:
2612                    print(
2613                        f"Couldn't find '{K_inner_asperities_file}', "
2614                        "need to recompute K_inner_asperities"
2615                    )
2616            else:
2617                if verbose:
2618                    print(f"Loaded K_inner_asperities from '{K_inner_asperities_file}'")
2619            if "K_inner_asperities" in fault_dict:
2620                del fault_dict["K_inner_asperities"]
2621        else:
2622            K_inner_asperities = fault_dict.pop("K_inner_asperities", None)
2623        # check for K_inner_inner
2624        if K_inner_inner_file is not None:
2625            try:
2626                K_inner_inner = np.load(K_inner_inner_file)
2627            except FileNotFoundError:
2628                K_inner_inner = None
2629                if verbose:
2630                    print(
2631                        f"Couldn't find '{K_inner_inner_file}', "
2632                        "need to recompute K_inner_inner"
2633                    )
2634            else:
2635                if verbose:
2636                    print(f"Loaded K_inner_inner from '{K_inner_inner_file}'")
2637            if "K_inner_inner" in fault_dict:
2638                del fault_dict["K_inner_inner"]
2639        else:
2640            K_inner_inner = fault_dict.pop("K_inner_inner", None)
2641        # check for cross_sections
2642        if cross_sections_file is not None:
2643            try:
2644                with open(cross_sections_file, "rb") as f:
2645                    cross_sections = pickle.load(f)
2646            except FileNotFoundError:
2647                cross_sections = None
2648                if verbose:
2649                    print(
2650                        f"Couldn't find '{cross_sections_file}', "
2651                        "need to recompute cross_sections"
2652                    )
2653            else:
2654                if verbose:
2655                    print(f"Loaded cross_sections from '{cross_sections_file}'")
2656        else:
2657            cross_sections = None
2658        # create new object
2659        fault = cls(
2660            **fault_dict,
2661            K_inner_asperities=K_inner_asperities,
2662            K_inner_inner=K_inner_inner,
2663            cross_sections=cross_sections,
2664        )
2665        # save new files if desired
2666        if write_new_files:
2667            fault.write_big_files(
2668                K_inner_asperities_file=(
2669                    K_inner_asperities_file
2670                    if (K_inner_asperities_file is not None)
2671                    and (K_inner_asperities is None)
2672                    else None
2673                ),
2674                K_inner_inner_file=(
2675                    K_inner_inner_file
2676                    if (K_inner_inner_file is not None) and (K_inner_inner is None)
2677                    else None
2678                ),
2679                cross_sections_file=(
2680                    cross_sections_file
2681                    if (cross_sections_file is not None) and (cross_sections is None)
2682                    else None
2683                ),
2684                verbose=verbose,
2685            )
2686        # return new object
2687        return fault
2688
2689    def write_big_files(
2690        self,
2691        K_inner_asperities_file=None,
2692        K_inner_inner_file=None,
2693        cross_sections_file=None,
2694        verbose=False,
2695    ):
2696        """
2697        Write the arrays that are computationally expensive to files.
2698
2699        Parameters
2700        ----------
2701        K_inner_asperities_file : str, optional
2702            File name for `K_inner_asperities`
2703        K_inner_inner_file : str, optional
2704            File name for `K_inner_inner`
2705        cross_sections_file : str, optional
2706            File name for `cross_sections`
2707        """
2708        if K_inner_asperities_file is not None:
2709            np.save(K_inner_asperities_file, self.K_inner_asperities)
2710            if verbose:
2711                print(f"Saved K_inner_asperities to '{K_inner_asperities_file}'")
2712        if K_inner_inner_file is not None:
2713            np.save(K_inner_inner_file, self.K_inner_inner)
2714            if verbose:
2715                print(f"Saved K_inner_inner to '{K_inner_inner_file}'")
2716        if cross_sections_file is not None:
2717            with open(cross_sections_file, "wb") as f:
2718                pickle.dump(self.cross_sections, f, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)
2719                if verbose:
2720                    print(f"Saved cross_sections to '{cross_sections_file}'")
2721
2722    @staticmethod
2723    def vectors_forward_rotation(vectors, R_from_to):
2724        """
2725        Rotate vectors from EFCS to another coordinate system.
2726
2727        Parameters
2728        ----------
2729        vectors : numpy.ndarray
2730            Vectors arranged in the shape :math:`(n, 3)`
2731        R_from_to : numpy.ndarray
2732            Rotation matrices to use of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`
2733
2734        Returns
2735        -------
2736        vectors_rot : numpy.ndarray
2737            Rotated vectors in the same shape.
2738        """
2739        return np.einsum("ijk,ik->ij", R_from_to, vectors)
2740
2741    @staticmethod
2742    def vectors_backward_rotation(vectors, R_from_to):
2743        """
2744        Rotate vectors from another coordinate system to EFCS.
2745
2746        Parameters
2747        ----------
2748        vectors : numpy.ndarray
2749            Vectors arranged in the shape :math:`(n, 3)`
2750        R_from_to : numpy.ndarray
2751            Rotation matrices to use of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`
2752
2753        Returns
2754        -------
2755        vectors_rot : numpy.ndarray
2756            Rotated vectors in the same shape.
2757        """
2758        return np.einsum("ikj,ik->ij", R_from_to, vectors)
2759
2760    @staticmethod
2761    def get_stress_kernel(
2762        patches, centroids, rot_mats_efcs, mu, nu, rot_mats_tdcs=None
2763    ):
2764        """
2765        Calculate the stress kernel between every source and target patch
2766        and project onto the target coordinate system.
2767
2768        Parameters
2769        ----------
2770        patches : numpy.ndarray
2771            Source patches matrix of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`.
2772        centroids : numpy.ndarray
2773            Target centroids of shape :math:`(m, 3)`.
2774        rot_mats_efcs : numpy.ndarray
2775            Rotation matrices from EFCS to the target coordinate system
2776            of shape :math:`(m, 3, 3)`
2777        mu : float
2778            Shear modulus [Pa]
2779        nu : float
2780            Poisson's ratio [-]
2781        rot_mats_tdcs : numpy.ndarray, optional
2782            Rotation matrices from TDCS to the target coordinate system
2783            of shape :math:`(m, 3, 3)` (if the target is not TDCS)
2784
2785        Returns
2786        -------
2787        K : numpy.ndarray
2788            Stress kernel (tensor) of shape :math:`(m, 3, n, 3)`.
2789
2790        Notes
2791        -----
2792
2793        To convert source slip in DDCS into target stress in DDCS all at once,
2794        use a tensor product: `numpy.tensordot(K, slip, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)])`.
2795        """
2796
2797        # get dimensions and centroids
2798        num_source = patches.shape[0]
2799        num_target = centroids.shape[0]
2800
2801        # get normal directions
2802        e1 = rot_mats_efcs[:, 0, :]
2803        e2 = rot_mats_efcs[:, 1, :]
2804        e3 = rot_mats_efcs[:, 2, :]
2805
2806        # get stress tensor in EFCS for TDCS input
2807        strain_efcs = strain_matrix(obs_pts=centroids, tris=patches, nu=nu)
2808        stress_efcs = (
2809            strain_to_stress(
2810                strain=strain_efcs.transpose(0, 2, 3, 1).reshape(-1, 6), mu=mu, nu=nu
2811            )
2812            .reshape(num_target, num_source, 3, 6)
2813            .transpose(0, 3, 1, 2)
2814        )
2815
2816        # change input coordinate system from TDCS to target one
2817        if rot_mats_tdcs is not None:
2818            stress_efcs = np.einsum(
2819                "ijkl,kml->ijkm", stress_efcs, rot_mats_tdcs, optimize="optimal"
2820            )
2821
2822        # project to target coordinate system
2823        stress_efcs_3x3 = [
2824            np.stack(
2825                [
2826                    stress_efcs[:, 0, :, i].ravel(),
2827                    stress_efcs[:, 3, :, i].ravel(),
2828                    stress_efcs[:, 4, :, i].ravel(),
2829                    stress_efcs[:, 3, :, i].ravel(),
2830                    stress_efcs[:, 1, :, i].ravel(),
2831                    stress_efcs[:, 5, :, i].ravel(),
2832                    stress_efcs[:, 4, :, i].ravel(),
2833                    stress_efcs[:, 5, :, i].ravel(),
2834                    stress_efcs[:, 2, :, i].ravel(),
2835                ]
2836            )
2837            .reshape(3, 3, num_target, num_source)
2838            .transpose(2, 3, 0, 1)
2839            for i in range(3)
2840        ]
2841        path = np.einsum_path(
2842            "ik,ijkl,il->ij", e1, stress_efcs_3x3[0], e3, optimize="optimal"
2843        )[0]
2844        K = np.array(
2845            [
2846                [
2847                    np.einsum(
2848                        "ik,ijkl,il->ij", v, stress_efcs_3x3[i], e3, optimize=path
2849                    )
2850                    for i in range(3)
2851                ]
2852                for v in [e1, e2, e3]
2853            ]
2854        ).transpose(2, 0, 3, 1)
2855
2856        # done
2857        return K
2858
2859    @staticmethod
2860    def get_disp_kernel(obs_loc, patches, nu, rot_mats_tdcs=None):
2861        """
2862        Calculate the displacement kernel from a source mesh onto the observers.
2863        Defaults to TDCS input, can be changed by passing a rotation matrix.
2864
2865        Parameters
2866        ----------
2867        obs_loc : numpy.ndarray
2868            Three-column EFCS locations of surface observers of shape :math:`(m, 3)`.
2869        patches : numpy.ndarray
2870            Source patches matrix of shape :math:`(n, 3, 3)`.
2871        nu : float
2872            Poisson's ratio [-]
2873        rot_mats_tdcs : numpy.ndarray, optional
2874            Rotation matrices from TDCS to the target coordinate system
2875            of shape :math:`(m, 3, 3)` (if the target is not TDCS)
2876
2877        Returns
2878        -------
2879        G : numpy.ndarray
2880            Displacement kernel (tensor) of shape :math:`(m, 3, n, 3)`
2881            where :math:`m` is the number of observers and :math:`n` is the
2882            number of source patches.
2883
2884        Notes
2885        -----
2886
2887        To convert slip in TDCS into displacement in EFCS at all observers at once,
2888        use a tensor product: `numpy.tensordot(G, slip, axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)])`.
2889        """
2890
2891        # get displacement tensor from TDCS to EFCS
2892        G = disp_matrix(obs_pts=obs_loc, tris=patches, nu=nu)
2893
2894        # change input coordinate system from TDCS to target one
2895        if rot_mats_tdcs is not None:
2896            G = np.einsum("ijkl,kml->ijkm", G, rot_mats_tdcs, optimize="optimal")
2897
2898        # done
2899        return G
2900
2901    @staticmethod
2902    def redistribute_normal(vectors):
2903        """
2904        Redistribute the normal (3rd) component onto the other directions, eliminating it
2905        but keeping the magnitude the same.
2906
2907        Parameters
2908        ----------
2909        vectors : numpy.ndarray
2910            Vectors arranged in the shape :math:`(n, 3)`
2911
2912        Returns
2913        -------
2914        vectors_rescaled : numpy.ndarray
2915            Rotated vectors in the shape :math:`(n, 2)`
2916        """
2917        ratio = np.sqrt(1 + (vectors[:, 2] / vectors[:, 1]) ** 2)
2918        vectors_rescaled = np.stack([vectors[:, 0], vectors[:, 1] * ratio], axis=1)
2919        assert np.allclose(
2920            np.linalg.norm(vectors, axis=1), np.linalg.norm(vectors_rescaled, axis=1)
2921        )
2922        return vectors_rescaled

Base class for the subduction fault mesh.

Fault3D( inner_mesh_files, asperity_mesh_files, lower_mesh_files, downdip_direction, mu, nu, v_s, farfield_motion, farfield_motion_type, max_simulated_distance, max_simulated_depth, orient_along=0, offset_lower=0, utmzone=None, lon0=None, lat0=None, K_inner_asperities=None, K_inner_inner=None, cross_sections=None) 
1780    def __init__(
1781        self,
1782        inner_mesh_files,
1783        asperity_mesh_files,
1784        lower_mesh_files,
1785        downdip_direction,
1786        mu,
1787        nu,
1788        v_s,
1789        farfield_motion,
1790        farfield_motion_type,
1791        max_simulated_distance,
1792        max_simulated_depth,
1793        orient_along=0,
1794        offset_lower=0,
1795        utmzone=None,
1796        lon0=None,
1797        lat0=None,
1798        K_inner_asperities=None,
1799        K_inner_inner=None,
1800        cross_sections=None,
1801    ):
1802        """
1803        Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the
1804        Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.
1805
1806        The inner mesh consists of the asperities as well as the surrounding
1807        creeping patches, formulated as triangular dislocation elements.
1808
1809        The outer mesh consists of the boundary patches that are necessary
1810        to recover longterm surface displacement due to continuous fault slip.
1811
1812        Parameters
1813        ----------
1814        inner_mesh_files : list
1815            Path to `.tet` mesh file defining the inner mesh on the upper plate
1816            interface.
1817        asperity_mesh_files : list
1818            List of paths to `.tet` mesh files defining the upper plate interface's
1819            asperities, assumed to be within the inner mesh.
1820        lower_mesh_files : list
1821            List of paths to `.tet` mesh files defining the lower plate interface.
1822        downdip_direction : str
1823            Direction into which the inner mesh should be extended using the
1824            normal vectors. All other directions will be extended on constant
1825            boundary depth. Two-character code of sign `+-` and axes `xy`.
1826        mu : float
1827            Shear modulus [Pa]
1828        nu : float
1829            Poisson's ratio [-]
1830        v_s : float
1831            Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
1832        farfield_motion : numpy.ndarray
1833            Either a 1D array containing the uniform plate motion [m/s] in ENU for all patches,
1834            or an ECEF rotation vector [/Ma], a Longitude/Latitude/Rate Euler Pole [],
1835            or a 2D array containing the precomputed ENU plate velocity [m/s] at each patch.
1836        farfield_motion_type : int
1837            Describes the type of `farfield_motion` between `1` (uniform), `2`
1838            (ECEF rotation), `3` (Euler Pole), or `4` (precomputed).
1839        max_simulated_distance : float
1840            Maximum horizontal distance [m] from asperities until which to simulate patches
1841        max_simulated_depth : float
1842            Maximum depth [m] (positive) until which to simulate patches
1843        orient_along : float
1844            Angle [ counter-clockwise from east] of the subduction fault strike.
1845        offset_lower : float
1846            Additional offset the lower part of the mesh [m] (positive means upwards shift)
1847        utmzone : int, optional
1848            If `farfield_motion_type` is an ECEF rotation or Euler Pole, it is necessary to
1849            know in which coordinate system the mesh files are.
1850        lon0 : float, optional
1851            If there is a custom longitude offset [] used in calculating the mesh file
1852            UTM coordinates, provide it here.
1853        lat0 : float, optional
1854            If there is a custom latitude offset [] used in calculating the mesh file
1855            UTM coordinates, provide it here.
1856        K_inner_asperities : numpy.ndarray, optional
1857            Precomputed stress kernel from the asperities to the inner mesh [Pa/m]
1858        K_inner_inner : numpy.ndarray, optional
1859            Precomputed stress kernel within the inner mesh [Pa/m]
1860        cross_sections : list, optional
1861            Precomputed valid cross sections
1862        """
1863
1864        # input check
1865        assert isinstance(inner_mesh_files, list)
1866        assert isinstance(asperity_mesh_files, list)
1867        assert isinstance(lower_mesh_files, list)
1868        assert isinstance(downdip_direction, str)
1869        assert 1 <= farfield_motion_type <= 4
1870        assert isinstance(farfield_motion_type, int)
1871        if farfield_motion_type == 4:
1872            assert (
1873                isinstance(farfield_motion, np.ndarray)
1874                and (farfield_motion.ndim == 2)
1875                and (farfield_motion.shape[1] == 3)
1876            )
1877        else:
1878            assert (
1879                isinstance(farfield_motion, np.ndarray)
1880                and (farfield_motion.ndim == 1)
1881                and (farfield_motion.size == 3)
1882            )
1883        if farfield_motion_type in (2, 3):
1884            assert isinstance(utmzone, int), (
1885                f"For 'farfield_motion_type={farfield_motion_type}', "
1886                "an integer 'utmzone' needs to be provided."
1887            )
1888        use_normals = [False, False, False, False]
1889        if downdip_direction[0] == "+":
1890            if downdip_direction[1] == "x":
1891                use_normals[0] = True
1892            elif downdip_direction[1] == "y":
1893                use_normals[1] = True
1894        elif downdip_direction[0] == "-":
1895            if downdip_direction[1] == "x":
1896                use_normals[2] = True
1897            elif downdip_direction[1] == "y":
1898                use_normals[3] = True
1899        if not any(use_normals):
1900            raise ValueError(f"Can't parse 'use_normals' from {downdip_direction}.")
1901
1902        # material properties
1903        self.mu = float(mu)
1904        """ Shear modulus [Pa] """
1905        self.nu = float(nu)
1906        """ Poisson's ratio [-] """
1907        self.v_s = float(v_s)
1908        """ Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone """
1909        self.E = 2 * self.mu * (1 + self.nu)
1910        """ Young's modulus [Pa] of the fault zone """
1911        self.mu_over_2vs = self.E / (2 * (1 + self.nu) * 2 * self.v_s)
1912        """ Radiation damping term [Pa * s/m] """
1913        self.farfield_motion_type = farfield_motion_type
1914        """ Type of farfield motion used to calculate plate velocity """
1915        self.utmzone = int(utmzone) if utmzone is not None else None
1916        """ UTM zone number of fault coordinates """
1917
1918        # simulation boundaries
1919        assert max_simulated_distance > 0
1920        self.max_simulated_distance = float(max_simulated_distance)
1921        """ Maximum horizontal distance [m] from asperities until which to simulate patches """
1922        assert max_simulated_depth > 0
1923        self.max_simulated_depth = float(max_simulated_depth)
1924        """ Maximum depth [m] (positive) until which to simulate patches """
1925        self.orient_along = float(orient_along)
1926        """ Main orientation of the subduction zone [] """
1927        self.offset_lower = float(offset_lower)
1928        """ Offset applied to the lower mesh files [m] """
1929
1930        # create asperities mesh
1931        vertices_asperities, triangles_asperities, match_sources = combine_tet(
1932            *asperity_mesh_files, return_sources=True
1933        )
1934        # correct custom UTM by applying average shift
1935        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
1936            offset_en = (
1937                correct_custom_utm(vertices_asperities[:, :2], self.utmzone, lon0, lat0)
1938                - vertices_asperities[:, :2]
1939            ).mean(axis=0)
1940            vertices_asperities[:, :2] += offset_en
1941        assert (
1942            vertices_asperities[:, 2].max() <= 0
1943        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the asperities mesh."
1944        vertices_asperities, triangles_asperities = force_normals(
1945            vertices_asperities, triangles_asperities, normals_up=False
1946        )
1947        self.asperities_vertices = vertices_asperities
1948        """ Vertex coordinates for the asperities mesh [m] """
1949        self.asperities_triangles = triangles_asperities
1950        """ Triangle definitions for the asperities mesh [-] """
1951        self.asperities_patches = self.asperities_vertices[self.asperities_triangles]
1952        """ Asperities patches """
1953        self.asperities_polygons = [
1954            shapely.Polygon(arr) for arr in self.asperities_patches
1955        ]
1956        """ List of all asperity triangles as Shapely Polygons """
1957        self.asperities_centroids = np.mean(self.asperities_patches, axis=1)
1958        """ Centroids of asperities patches [m] """
1959        self.asperities_num_vertices = self.asperities_vertices.shape[0]
1960        """ Number of asperities vertices [-] """
1961        self.asperities_num_patches = self.asperities_triangles.shape[0]
1962        """ Number of asperities patches/triangles [-] """
1963        self.asperity_indices = match_sources
1964        """ List of indices matching each triangle to an asperity """
1965        self.num_asperities = len(self.asperity_indices)
1966        """ Number of distinct asperities """
1967
1968        # create asperities rotation matrices
1969        self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
1970            self.asperities_patches
1971        )
1972        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the asperities patches """
1973
1974        # create inner mesh
1975        vertices_inner, triangles_inner = combine_tet(*inner_mesh_files)
1976        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
1977            vertices_inner[:, :2] += offset_en
1978        assert (
1979            vertices_inner[:, 2].max() <= 0
1980        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the inner mesh."
1981        vertices_inner, triangles_inner = force_normals(
1982            vertices_inner, triangles_inner, normals_up=False
1983        )
1984        # extend upper plate interface
1985        extend_directions = ~np.roll(use_normals, 2)
1986        R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
1987            vertices_inner[triangles_inner]
1988        )
1989        vertices_combined, triangles_combined = extend_mesh(
1990            vertices_inner,
1991            triangles_inner,
1992            use_normals=use_normals,
1993            directions=extend_directions,
1994            normals_in=R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs[:, 2, :],
1995        )
1996        vertices_inf = vertices_combined[vertices_inner.shape[0] :, :].copy()
1997        vertices_combined, triangles_combined = force_normals(
1998            vertices_combined, triangles_combined, normals_up=False
1999        )
2000        vertices_simulated, vertices_imposed, triangles_simulated, triangles_imposed = (
2001            split_mesh(
2002                vertices_combined,
2003                triangles_combined,
2004                self.asperities_patches,
2005                max_distance=self.max_simulated_distance,
2006                max_depth=self.max_simulated_depth,
2007            )
2008        )
2009        ix_v_inf = np.concatenate(
2010            [
2011                np.flatnonzero(np.all(vertices_imposed == v, axis=1))
2012                for v in vertices_inf.tolist()
2013            ]
2014        )
2015        assert ix_v_inf.size == vertices_inf.shape[0]
2016        self.ix_tri_inf = np.any(np.isin(triangles_imposed, ix_v_inf), axis=1)
2017        """ Indices of infinity triangles """
2018
2019        # save inner mesh
2020        self.inner_vertices = vertices_simulated
2021        """ Vertex coordinates for the inner mesh [m] """
2022        self.inner_triangles = triangles_simulated
2023        """ Triangle definitions for the inner mesh [-] """
2024        self.inner_patches = self.inner_vertices[self.inner_triangles]
2025        """ Inner patches """
2026        self.inner_centroids = np.mean(self.inner_patches, axis=1)
2027        """ Centroids of inner patches [m] """
2028        self.inner_num_vertices = self.inner_vertices.shape[0]
2029        """ Number of inner vertices [-] """
2030        self.inner_num_patches = self.inner_triangles.shape[0]
2031        """ Number of inner patches/triangles [-] """
2032
2033        # create inner rotation matrices
2034        self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.inner_patches)
2035        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the inner patches """
2036
2037        # create a joint inner and asperities mesh for 2D projection purposes
2038        slab_vertices = np.concatenate(
2039            [self.inner_vertices, self.asperities_vertices], axis=0
2040        )
2041        slab_triangles = np.concatenate(
2042            [
2043                self.inner_triangles,
2044                self.asperities_triangles + self.inner_vertices.shape[0],
2045            ],
2046            axis=0,
2047        )
2048        slab_vertices, slab_triangles = remove_duplicate_vertices(
2049            slab_vertices, slab_triangles
2050        )
2051        self.slab_vertices = slab_vertices
2052        """ Vertex coordinates for the slab mesh (inner + asperities) [m] """
2053        self.slab_triangles = slab_triangles
2054        """ Triangle definitions for the slab mesh (inner + asperities) [-] """
2055
2056        # save outer mesh
2057        self.outer_vertices = vertices_imposed
2058        """ Vertex coordinates for the outer upper mesh [m] """
2059        self.outer_vertices_noninf = vertices_imposed
2060        """ Vertex coordinates for the outer upper mesh [m] """
2061        self.outer_triangles = triangles_imposed
2062        """ Triangle definitions for the outer upper mesh [-] """
2063        self.outer_triangles_noninf = triangles_imposed[~self.ix_tri_inf, :]
2064        """ Triangle definitions for the outer upper mesh [-], excluding extended patches """
2065        self.outer_patches = self.outer_vertices[self.outer_triangles]
2066        """ Outer upper patches """
2067        self.outer_centroids = np.mean(self.outer_patches, axis=1)
2068        """ Centroids of outer upper patches [m] """
2069        self.outer_num_vertices = self.outer_vertices.shape[0]
2070        """ Number of outer upper vertices [-] """
2071        self.outer_num_patches = self.outer_triangles.shape[0]
2072        """ Number of outer upper patches/triangles [-] """
2073
2074        # create outer upper rotation matrices
2075        self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.outer_patches)
2076        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the outer patches """
2077
2078        # create lower plate interface mesh
2079        vertices_lower, triangles_lower = combine_tet(*lower_mesh_files)
2080        if (self.utmzone is not None) and ((lon0 is not None) or (lat0 is not None)):
2081            vertices_lower[:, :2] += offset_en
2082        vertices_lower[:, 2] += self.offset_lower
2083        assert (
2084            vertices_lower[:, 2].max() <= 0
2085        ), "Found up-coordinates larger than 0 in the lower mesh."
2086        # extend in all directions
2087        R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(
2088            vertices_lower[triangles_lower]
2089        )
2090        vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended = extend_mesh(
2091            vertices_lower,
2092            triangles_lower,
2093            use_normals=use_normals,
2094            normals_in=R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs[:, 2, :],
2095        )
2096        self.num_lower_extended = (
2097            triangles_lower_extended.shape[0] - triangles_lower.shape[0]
2098        )
2099        """ Number of triangles that were added to the lower plate interface """
2100        vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended = force_normals(
2101            vertices_lower_extended, triangles_lower_extended, normals_up=True
2102        )
2103        self.lower_vertices = vertices_lower_extended
2104        """ Vertex coordinates for the lower mesh [m] """
2105        self.lower_triangles = triangles_lower_extended
2106        """ Triangle definitions for the lower mesh [-] """
2107        self.lower_patches = self.lower_vertices[self.lower_triangles]
2108        """ Lower patches """
2109        self.lower_centroids = np.mean(self.lower_patches, axis=1)
2110        """ Centroids of lower patches [m] """
2111        self.lower_num_vertices = self.lower_vertices.shape[0]
2112        """ Number of lower vertices [-] """
2113        self.lower_num_patches = self.lower_triangles.shape[0]
2114        """ Number of lower patches/triangles [-] """
2115
2116        # create lower rotation matrices
2117        self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs = compute_efcs_to_tdcs_rotations(self.lower_patches)
2118        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for the lower patches """
2119
2120        # create a joint R tensor
2121        self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs = np.concatenate(
2122            [
2123                self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs,
2124                self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs,
2125                self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs,
2126                self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs,
2127            ],
2128            axis=0,
2129        )
2130        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to TDCS for all patches """
2131
2132        # create a joint centroids array
2133        self.joint_centroids = np.concatenate(
2134            [
2135                self.inner_centroids,
2136                self.asperities_centroids,
2137                self.outer_centroids,
2138                self.lower_centroids,
2139            ],
2140            axis=0,
2141        )
2142        """ Centroids of all patches [m] """
2143
2144        # create a joint patches array
2145        self.joint_patches = np.concatenate(
2146            [
2147                self.inner_patches,
2148                self.asperities_patches,
2149                self.outer_patches,
2150                self.lower_patches,
2151            ],
2152            axis=0,
2153        )
2154        """ All patches [m] """
2155
2156        # create slice objects for all subsets in the joint arrays
2157        self.s_inner = np.s_[0 : self.inner_num_patches]
2158        """ Slice object to recover the inner patches from all patches """
2159        self.s_asperities = np.s_[
2160            self.inner_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2161            + self.asperities_num_patches
2162        ]
2163        """ Slice object to recover the asperities' patches from all patches """
2164        self.s_outer = np.s_[
2165            self.inner_num_patches
2166            + self.asperities_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2167            + self.asperities_num_patches
2168            + self.outer_num_patches
2169        ]
2170        """ Slice object to recover the outer patches from all patches """
2171        self.s_lower = np.s_[
2172            self.inner_num_patches
2173            + self.asperities_num_patches
2174            + self.outer_num_patches : self.inner_num_patches
2175            + self.asperities_num_patches
2176            + self.outer_num_patches
2177            + self.lower_num_patches
2178        ]
2179        """ Slice object to recover the lower patches from all patches """
2180        self.joint_num_patches = (
2181            self.inner_num_patches
2182            + self.asperities_num_patches
2183            + self.outer_num_patches
2184            + self.lower_num_patches
2185        )
2186        """ Total number of patches """
2187
2188        # calculate farfield motion unit vector
2189        if farfield_motion_type in (
2190            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM,
2191            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED,
2192        ):
2193            v_plate_vec = np.ascontiguousarray(
2194                np.broadcast_to(farfield_motion, (self.joint_num_patches, 3))
2195            )
2196        elif farfield_motion_type in (
2197            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_ROTATION,
2198            self.FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER,
2199        ):
2200            # convert rotation format if necessary
2201            if farfield_motion_type == self.FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER:
2202                farfield_motion = np.rad2deg(
2203                    eulerpole2rotvec(np.deg2rad(farfield_motion))
2204                )
2205            # define coordinate systems
2206            crs_lla = ccrs.Geodetic()
2207            crs_xyz = ccrs.Geocentric()
2208            crs_utm = ccrs.UTM(zone=self.utmzone)
2209            # get locations of centroids in lon/lat and ECEF cartesian
2210            centroids_lla = crs_lla.transform_points(
2211                crs_utm, self.joint_centroids[:, 0], self.joint_centroids[:, 1]
2212            )
2213            centroids_xyz = crs_xyz.transform_points(
2214                crs_utm, self.joint_centroids[:, 0], self.joint_centroids[:, 1]
2215            )
2216            # calculate rotation from rotation vector
2217            farfield_motion_rad_s = np.deg2rad(farfield_motion) / 1e6 / SEC_PER_YEAR
2218            centroids_vel_xyz = np.cross(farfield_motion_rad_s, centroids_xyz)
2219            # project into local ENU
2220            v_plate_vec = np.stack(
2221                [
2222                    (R_ecef2enu(lo, la) @ centroids_vel_xyz[i, :])
2223                    for i, (lo, la) in enumerate(
2224                        zip(centroids_lla[:, 0], centroids_lla[:, 1])
2225                    )
2226                ]
2227            )
2228            # the infinitely extending patches are probably not covered by this
2229            # approximation and will yield NaNs, so we assign the same plate
2230            # velocity to them as the nearest non-infinite patch
2231            ix_inf = (
2232                np.flatnonzero(self.ix_tri_inf)
2233                + self.inner_num_patches
2234                + self.asperities_num_patches
2235            ).tolist() + (
2236                np.arange(self.lower_num_patches)[-self.num_lower_extended :]
2237                + self.inner_num_patches
2238                + self.asperities_num_patches
2239                + self.outer_num_patches
2240            ).tolist()
2241            ix_notinf = ~np.isin(np.arange(self.joint_num_patches), ix_inf)
2242            # loop over infinite patch indices
2243            for i in ix_inf:
2244                # find closest non-infinite patch
2245                j = np.argmin(
2246                    np.linalg.norm(
2247                        self.joint_centroids[ix_notinf, :]
2248                        - self.joint_centroids[i, :][None, :],
2249                        axis=1,
2250                    )
2251                )
2252                v_plate_vec[i, :] = v_plate_vec[ix_notinf, :][j, :]
2253
2254        self.v_plate_vec = v_plate_vec
2255        """ Nominal far-field plate velocity at all patches in the dimensions of the rheology """
2256
2257        # project v_plate_vec onto each patch
2258        self.e_plate_tdcs = Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2259            self.v_plate_vec / np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate_vec, axis=1, keepdims=True),
2260            self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs,
2261        )
2262        """ Unit plate velocity direction in the TDCS [m] """
2263        self.e_plate_tdcs_proj = Fault3D.redistribute_normal(self.e_plate_tdcs)
2264        """ Projected unit plate velocity direction in TDCS [m] """
2265
2266        # create DDCS
2267        # angle between plate velocity and TDCS strike (already on same plane)
2268        alpha = np.arctan2(self.e_plate_tdcs_proj[:, 1], self.e_plate_tdcs_proj[:, 0])
2269        # inner
2270        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2271            [
2272                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2273                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2274                )
2275                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_inner])
2276            ]
2277        )
2278        self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2279            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2280        )
2281        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the inner patches """
2282        self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2283            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_inner_efcs_to_tdcs
2284        )
2285        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the inner patches """
2286        # asperities
2287        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2288            [
2289                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2290                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2291                )
2292                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_asperities])
2293            ]
2294        )
2295        self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2296            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2297        )
2298        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the asperities patches """
2299        self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2300            "ijk,ilk->ijl",
2301            self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs,
2302            self.R_asperities_efcs_to_tdcs,
2303        )
2304        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the asperities patches """
2305        # outer
2306        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2307            [
2308                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2309                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2310                )
2311                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_outer])
2312            ]
2313        )
2314        self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2315            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2316        )
2317        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the outer patches """
2318        self.R_outer_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2319            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_outer_efcs_to_tdcs
2320        )
2321        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the outer patches """
2322        # lower
2323        temp_transform_R = np.array(
2324            [
2325                rotation_matrix_around_vector(
2326                    al - np.pi / 4, self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs[i, 2, :]
2327                )
2328                for i, al in enumerate(alpha[self.s_lower])
2329            ]
2330        )
2331        self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2332            "ijk,ikl->ijl", self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs, temp_transform_R
2333        )
2334        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for the lower patches """
2335        self.R_lower_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.einsum(
2336            "ijk,ilk->ijl", self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs, self.R_lower_efcs_to_tdcs
2337        )
2338        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for the lower patches """
2339
2340        # create more joint R tensors
2341        self.R_joint_efcs_to_ddcs = np.concatenate(
2342            [
2343                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2344                self.R_asperities_efcs_to_ddcs,
2345                self.R_outer_efcs_to_ddcs,
2346                self.R_lower_efcs_to_ddcs,
2347            ],
2348            axis=0,
2349        )
2350        """ Rotation matrices from EFCS to DDCS for all patches """
2351        self.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs = np.concatenate(
2352            [
2353                self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2354                self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2355                self.R_outer_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2356                self.R_lower_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2357            ],
2358            axis=0,
2359        )
2360        """ Rotation matrices from TDCS to DDCS for all patches """
2361
2362        # project v_plate_vec onto each patch again, this time DDCS
2363        self.e_plate_ddcs_proj = Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2364            self.e_plate_tdcs_proj, self.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2]
2365        )
2366        """ Projected unit plate velocity direction in DDCS [m] """
2367        e_plate_tdcs_proj_3d = np.concatenate(
2368            [self.e_plate_tdcs_proj, np.zeros((self.e_plate_tdcs_proj.shape[0], 1))],
2369            axis=1,
2370        )
2371        e_plate_efcs_proj_3d = Fault3D.vectors_backward_rotation(
2372            e_plate_tdcs_proj_3d, self.R_joint_efcs_to_tdcs
2373        )
2374        assert np.allclose(
2375            np.concatenate(
2376                [
2377                    self.e_plate_ddcs_proj,
2378                    np.zeros((self.e_plate_ddcs_proj.shape[0], 1)),
2379                ],
2380                axis=1,
2381            ),
2382            Fault3D.vectors_forward_rotation(
2383                e_plate_efcs_proj_3d, self.R_joint_efcs_to_ddcs
2384            ),
2385        )
2386
2387        # compute the relevant stress kernels in DDCS, if not already provided
2388        if K_inner_asperities is None:
2389            print("Calculating asperity stress kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
2390            tic = perf_counter()
2391            K_inner_asperities = self.get_stress_kernel(
2392                self.asperities_patches,
2393                self.inner_centroids,
2394                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2395                self.mu,
2396                self.nu,
2397                rot_mats_tdcs=self.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2398            )
2399            toc = perf_counter()
2400            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2401        else:
2402            assert isinstance(
2403                K_inner_asperities, np.ndarray
2404            ), f"Expected 'K_inner_asperities' NumPy array, got {type(K_inner_asperities)}."
2405            expected_shape = (self.inner_num_patches, 3, self.asperities_num_patches, 3)
2406            assert K_inner_asperities.shape == expected_shape, (
2407                f"Expected 'K_inner_asperities' shape of {expected_shape}, "
2408                f"got {K_inner_asperities.shape}."
2409            )
2410            print(f"Accepted input 'K_inner_asperities' of shape {expected_shape}.")
2411        self.K_inner_asperities = K_inner_asperities
2412        """ Stress kernel from the asperities to the inner mesh [Pa/m] """
2413        if K_inner_inner is None:
2414            print("Calculating internal stress kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
2415            tic = perf_counter()
2416            K_inner_inner = self.get_stress_kernel(
2417                self.inner_patches,
2418                self.inner_centroids,
2419                self.R_inner_efcs_to_ddcs,
2420                self.mu,
2421                self.nu,
2422                rot_mats_tdcs=self.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs,
2423            )
2424            toc = perf_counter()
2425            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2426        else:
2427            assert isinstance(
2428                K_inner_inner, np.ndarray
2429            ), f"Expected 'K_inner_inner' NumPy array, got {type(K_inner_inner)}."
2430            expected_shape = (self.inner_num_patches, 3, self.inner_num_patches, 3)
2431            assert K_inner_inner.shape == expected_shape, (
2432                f"Expected 'K_inner_inner' shape of {expected_shape}, "
2433                f"got {K_inner_inner.shape}."
2434            )
2435            print(f"Accepted input 'K_inner_inner' of shape {expected_shape}.")
2436        self.K_inner_inner = K_inner_inner
2437        """ Stress kernel within the inner mesh [Pa/m] """
2438
2439        # calculate horizontal cross sections
2440        if cross_sections is None:
2441            print("Calculating mesh cross sections... ", flush=True, end="")
2442            tic = perf_counter()
2443            # format mesh
2444            trimesh = meshcut.TriangleMesh(self.slab_vertices, self.slab_triangles)
2445            # get all cross sections
2446            all_cross_sections = [
2447                meshcut.cross_section_mesh(
2448                    trimesh,
2449                    meshcut.Plane(self.inner_centroids[i, :], [0, 0, 1]),
2450                    dist_tol=1,
2451                )
2452                for i in range(self.inner_num_patches)
2453            ]
2454            # eliminate those that have multiple segments
2455            cross_sections = [
2456                cs[0] if len(cs) == 1 else None for cs in all_cross_sections
2457            ]
2458            # eliminate those that are significantly shorter than the median, so probably wrong
2459            cs_lengths = np.array(
2460                [
2461                    shapely.LineString(cs).length if cs is not None else np.nan
2462                    for cs in cross_sections
2463                ]
2464            )
2465            cs_length_cutoff = np.nanmedian(cs_lengths) * 0.8
2466            for i in np.flatnonzero(cs_lengths < cs_length_cutoff):
2467                cross_sections[i] = None
2468            toc = perf_counter()
2469            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
2470        else:
2471            assert isinstance(cross_sections, list) and all(
2472                [
2473                    (
2474                        isinstance(cs, np.ndarray)
2475                        and (cs.ndim == 2)
2476                        and (cs.shape[1] == 3)
2477                    )
2478                    or (cs is None)
2479                    for cs in cross_sections
2480                ]
2481            ), "Expected a list of Nones or well-shaped NumPy arrays as cross sections."
2482            print("Accepted input 'cross_sections'.")
2483        self.cross_sections = cross_sections
2484        """ Horizontal cross sections through the inner centroid along the slab """
2485
2486        # calculate the spline coefficients onto which to interpolate rheological values
2487        # convert the ENU coordinates of patch_centroids into a vertical (depth) and horizontal
2488        # (along-strike, constant depth) coordinate system, and normalize to (0, 1)
2489        # vertical (increasing towards greater depth)
2490        assert np.all(self.inner_centroids[:, 2] <= 0)
2491        patch_depths = (self.inner_centroids[:, 2] - self.slab_vertices[:, 2].max()) / (
2492            self.slab_vertices[:, 2].min() - self.slab_vertices[:, 2].max()
2493        )
2494        # horizontal
2495        patch_horiz = np.zeros_like(patch_depths)
2496        target_dir = np.array(
2497            [
2498                np.cos(np.deg2rad(self.orient_along)),
2499                np.sin(np.deg2rad(self.orient_along)),
2500            ]
2501        )
2502        successful_lines = [None for _ in range(patch_horiz.size)]
2503        # get all horizontal cut lines
2504        for i, cs in enumerate(self.cross_sections):
2505            # use the supplied cross-sections
2506            if cs is not None:
2507                # we can use Shapely for the distance along the line since the z-component does
2508                # not vary because of how we slice
2509                ls = shapely.LineString(cs)
2510                assert ls.is_simple and ls.is_valid, "LineString not valid or simple"
2511                # make sure the line points in the right direction
2512                ls_dir = np.array(
2513                    [
2514                        ls.coords[-1][1] - ls.coords[0][1],
2515                        ls.coords[-1][0] - ls.coords[0][0],
2516                    ]
2517                )
2518                dir_diff = np.arccos(
2519                    np.dot(target_dir, ls_dir) / np.linalg.norm(ls_dir)
2520                )
2521                if dir_diff > np.pi / 2:
2522                    ls = ls.reverse()
2523                # save for later use
2524                successful_lines[i] = ls
2525        # calculate all horizontal distances
2526        for i, test_ls in enumerate(successful_lines):
2527            # find closest existing line if the current one didn't work
2528            ls = test_ls
2529            if ls is None:
2530                for test_ix in np.argsort(np.abs(patch_depths[i] - patch_depths)):
2531                    if successful_lines[test_ix] is not None:
2532                        ls = successful_lines[test_ix]
2533                        break
2534            assert ls is not None
2535            # now calculate the normalized distance along the cross section until the centroid
2536            patch_horiz[i] = ls.line_locate_point(
2537                shapely.Point(self.inner_centroids[i, :]), normalized=True
2538            )
2539        patch_horiz[patch_horiz == 1] -= 1e-10
2540        # save
2541        self.inner_patch_2d_coords = np.stack([patch_depths, patch_horiz], axis=1)
2542        """
2543        2D normalized coordinates of the inner patches
2544        along horizontal & depth directions [-]
2545        """
2546
2547        # prepare quantities relating to slip tapering
2548        self.dists_inner_asperities = np.array(
2549            [
2550                [shapely.distance(p, shapely.Point(c)) for c in self.inner_centroids]
2551                for p in self.asperities_polygons
2552            ]
2553        )
2554        """
2555        Distances [m] between asperity triangles and inner centroids,
2556        shape (num_asperities, num_inner)
2557        """
2558        # for each asperity, get the indices of the triangle closest to each inner mesh centroid
2559        self.i_closest_asp_tri = np.array(
2560            [
2561                aix[np.argmin(self.dists_inner_asperities[aix, :], axis=0)]
2562                for aix in self.asperity_indices
2563            ]
2564        )
2565        """
2566        Indices of closest asperity triangle for each asperity and each inner patch,
2567        shape (num_asperities, num_inner)
2568        """

Define the fault mesh of the subduction zone fault system, based on the Elastic Subducting Plate Model (ESPM) of [kanda2010]_.

The inner mesh consists of the asperities as well as the surrounding creeping patches, formulated as triangular dislocation elements.

The outer mesh consists of the boundary patches that are necessary to recover longterm surface displacement due to continuous fault slip.

Parameters
  • inner_mesh_files (list): Path to .tet mesh file defining the inner mesh on the upper plate interface.
  • asperity_mesh_files (list): List of paths to .tet mesh files defining the upper plate interface's asperities, assumed to be within the inner mesh.
  • lower_mesh_files (list): List of paths to .tet mesh files defining the lower plate interface.
  • downdip_direction (str): Direction into which the inner mesh should be extended using the normal vectors. All other directions will be extended on constant boundary depth. Two-character code of sign +- and axes xy.
  • mu (float): Shear modulus [Pa]
  • nu (float): Poisson's ratio [-]
  • v_s (float): Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone.
  • farfield_motion (numpy.ndarray): Either a 1D array containing the uniform plate motion [m/s] in ENU for all patches, or an ECEF rotation vector [/Ma], a Longitude/Latitude/Rate Euler Pole [], or a 2D array containing the precomputed ENU plate velocity [m/s] at each patch.
  • farfield_motion_type (int): Describes the type of farfield_motion between 1 (uniform), 2 (ECEF rotation), 3 (Euler Pole), or 4 (precomputed).
  • max_simulated_distance (float): Maximum horizontal distance [m] from asperities until which to simulate patches
  • max_simulated_depth (float): Maximum depth [m] (positive) until which to simulate patches
  • orient_along (float): Angle [ counter-clockwise from east] of the subduction fault strike.
  • offset_lower (float): Additional offset the lower part of the mesh [m] (positive means upwards shift)
  • utmzone (int, optional): If farfield_motion_type is an ECEF rotation or Euler Pole, it is necessary to know in which coordinate system the mesh files are.
  • lon0 (float, optional): If there is a custom longitude offset [] used in calculating the mesh file UTM coordinates, provide it here.
  • lat0 (float, optional): If there is a custom latitude offset [] used in calculating the mesh file UTM coordinates, provide it here.
  • K_inner_asperities (numpy.ndarray, optional): Precomputed stress kernel from the asperities to the inner mesh [Pa/m]
  • K_inner_inner (numpy.ndarray, optional): Precomputed stress kernel within the inner mesh [Pa/m]
  • cross_sections (list, optional): Precomputed valid cross sections
FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM = 1
FARFIELD_MOTION_ROTATION = 2
FARFIELD_MOTION_EULER = 3
FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED = 4
mu

Shear modulus [Pa]

nu

Poisson's ratio [-]

v_s

Shear wave velocity [m/s] in the fault zone

E
