4098        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
4099        obs_mask = np.isfinite(obs_zeroed)
4100        if not np.all(obs_mask):
4101            # need to loop over every station to find first valid observation after event
4102            periods_from = [0] + self.i_slips_obs
4103            periods_to = self.i_slips_obs + [obs_zeroed.shape[2]]
4104            for i_stat in range(obs_zeroed.shape[0]):
4105                for i_comp in range(obs_zeroed.shape[1]):
4106                    # iterate over all periods between bounds or earthquakes
4107                    for i_from, i_to in zip(periods_from, periods_to):
4108                        offset = None
4109                        for j in range(i_from, i_to):
4110                            # skip if data is masked
4111                            if obs_mask[i_stat, i_comp, j]:
4112                                if offset is None:
4113                                    # save new offset for this period
4114                                    offset = obs_zeroed[i_stat, i_comp, j]
4115                                # apply current offset
4116                                obs_zeroed[i_stat, i_comp, j] -= offset
4117        else:
4118            # no NaNs
4119            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, :, 0][:, :, None]
4120            if self.i_slips_obs is not None:
4121                for i in range(self.n_slips_obs):
4122                    obs_zeroed[:, :, self.i_slips_obs[i] :] -= obs_zeroed[
4123                        :, :, self.i_slips_obs[i]
4124                    ][:, :, None]
4125        return obs_zeroed
4126
4127    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
4128        """
4129        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
4130
4131        Parameters
4132        ----------
4133        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
4134            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
4135        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
4136            Noisy surface observations.
4137
4138        Returns
4139        -------
4140        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4141        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4142        """
4143        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4144
4145        # some helper variables
4146        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf[:, 0])
4147        i_off = 1.5 * np.std(obs_zeroed, axis=(0, 2))
4148        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
4149        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
4150            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
4151        )
4152        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
4153        if n_slips_obs > 0:
4154            i_slips_obs = [
4155                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
4156                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
4157            ]
4158            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
4159        else:
4160            t_last_slips = []
4161        # start plot
4162        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=3, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
4163        for tslip in t_last_slips:
4164            for a in ax:
4165                a.axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
4166        for j, io in enumerate(i_off):
4167            for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
4168                if obs_noisy is not None:
4169                    ax[j].plot(
4170                        self.t_obs,
4171                        obs_noisy[ix, j, :] + i * io,
4172                        ".",
4173                        c="k",
4174                        rasterized=True,
4175                    )
4176                ax[j].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, j, :] + i * io, c=f"C{i}")
4177            ax[j].set_ylabel(f"$x_{j + 1}$ [m]")
4178        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
4179        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
4180        return fig, ax
4181
4182    def plot_eq_stress(self, tdcs=True):
4183        """
4184        Plot the stress changes induced by the different earthquakes.
4185
4186        Parameters
4187        ----------
4188        tdcs : bool, optional
4189            If ``True`` (default), plot in TDCS, otherwise in DDCS.
4190
4191        Returns
4192        -------
4193        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4194        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4195        """
4196        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4197        import matplotlib.gridspec as gridspec
4198        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm, Normalize
4199        from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
4200        from cmcrameri import cm
4201
4202        # get unique earthquakes
4203        (
4204            _,
4205            unique_indices,
4206        ) = np.unique(self.eq_df.values, True, axis=0)
4207        n_unique = unique_indices.size
4208        # rotate if necessary
4209        if tdcs:
4210            labels = ["Magnitude", "Strike", "Dip"]
4211            delta_tau_bounded = np.einsum(
4212                "ikj,lik->lij",
4213                self.fault.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2],
4214                self.delta_tau_bounded,
4215            )
4216            eq_proj = np.einsum(
4217                "ikj,lik->lij",
4218                self.fault.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2],
4219                self.eq_ddcs_proj,
4220            )
4221        else:
4222            labels = ["Magnitude", "$R-45$", "$R+45$"]
4223            delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_bounded
4224            eq_proj = self.eq_ddcs_proj
4225        # get slip data range and norm
4226        s_max = np.ceil(np.max(self.eq_df.max()))
4227        s_norm = Normalize(vmin=-s_max, vmax=s_max)
4228        eq_proj_mag = np.linalg.norm(eq_proj, axis=2)
4229        # start figures
4230        figs = [plt.figure() for _ in range(n_unique)]
4231        axes = []
4232        for i, fig in enumerate(figs):
4233            gs = gridspec.GridSpec(2, 20, figure=fig)
4234            ax_mag = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :10], projection="3d")
4235            ax_cbar_tau = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 12])
4236            ax_cbar_slip = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 17])
4237            ax_dip = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, :10], projection="3d")
4238            ax_strike = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 10:], projection="3d")
4239            axes3d = [ax_mag, ax_dip, ax_strike]
4240            axes.append(axes3d)
4241            colls_inner = [None for _ in range(3)]
4242            colls_asp = [None for _ in range(3)]
4243            for j, ax in enumerate(axes3d):
4244                # plot inner mesh
4245                colls_inner[j] = ax.plot_trisurf(
4246                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4247                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4248                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4249                    triangles=self.fault.inner_triangles,
4250                    antialiased=True,
4251                    linewidths=0,
4252                )
4253                # plot asperities
4254                colls_asp[j] = ax.plot_trisurf(
4255                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4256                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4257                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4258                    triangles=self.fault.asperities_triangles,
4259                    antialiased=True,
4260                    linewidths=0,
4261                )
4262                # make prettier
4263                ax.view_init(elev=20, azim=-135)
4264                ax.set_title(labels[j])
4265                ax.set_xlabel("E [km]")
4266                ax.set_ylabel("N [km]")
4267                ax.set_zlabel("U [km]")
4268                ax.set_box_aspect(
4269                    [
4270                        ub - lb
4271                        for lb, ub in (getattr(ax, f"get_{a}lim")() for a in "xyz")
4272                    ]
4273                )
4274            # create data norms for delta_tau
4275            dtau = delta_tau_bounded[unique_indices[i], :, :]
4276            dtau_mag = np.linalg.norm(dtau, axis=1)
4277            dtau_mag_oom = 10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(dtau_mag)))
4278            dtau_norm = SymLogNorm(
4279                vmin=-dtau_mag_oom, vmax=dtau_mag_oom, linthresh=dtau_mag_oom / 1e3
4280            )
4281            # color inner mesh according to stress change in the different components, and
4282            # color asperities according to slip
4283            # top left: magnitude
4284            colls_inner[0].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau_mag])
4285            colls_asp[0].set_facecolor(
4286                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj_mag[unique_indices[i], :]]
4287            )
4288            # bottom left: strike
4289            colls_inner[1].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau[:, 0]])
4290            colls_asp[1].set_facecolor(
4291                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj[unique_indices[i], :, 0]]
4292            )
4293            # bottom right: dip
4294            colls_inner[2].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau[:, 1]])
4295            colls_asp[2].set_facecolor(
4296                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj[unique_indices[i], :, 1]]
4297            )
4298            # add colorbars
4299            fig.colorbar(
4300                ScalarMappable(norm=dtau_norm, cmap=cm.vik),
4301                cax=ax_cbar_tau,
4302                label=r"$\Delta \tau$ [Pa]",
4303            )
4304            fig.colorbar(
4305                ScalarMappable(norm=s_norm, cmap=cm.bam),
4306                cax=ax_cbar_slip,
4307                label=r"$\Delta s$ [m]",
4308            )
4309        # finish
4310        return figs, axes
4311
4312    def plot_field(self, quantity, log=True, label=None):
4313        """
4314        Plot a quantity on top of the fault mesh.
4315
4316        Parameters
4317        ----------
4318        quantity : numpy.ndarray
4319            Field quantity of the same shape as the inner mesh.
4320        log : bool, optional
4321            If ``True`` (default), use a logarithmic colorscale.
4322        label : str, optional
4323            Label of the colorbar.
4324
4325        Returns
4326        -------
4327        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4328        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4329        """
4330        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4331        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm, LogNorm, Normalize
4332        from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
4333        from cmcrameri import cm
4334
4335        # check data input size
4336        assert isinstance(quantity, np.ndarray)
4337        assert quantity.size == self.fault.inner_num_patches, (
4338            f"Expected input quantity to be of size {self.fault.inner_num_patches}, "
4339            f"got {quantity.shape}"
4340        )
4341        # get data range and norm
4342        if log:
4343            q_oom = 10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(np.abs(quantity))))
4344            if np.any(quantity < 0):
4345                q_norm = SymLogNorm(vmin=-q_oom, vmax=q_oom, linthresh=q_oom / 1e5)
4346                q_cmap = cm.vik
4347            else:
4348                q_norm = LogNorm(
4349                    vmin=10 ** np.floor(np.log10(np.min(quantity))), vmax=q_oom
4350                )
4351                q_cmap = cm.batlow
4352        else:
4353            q_absmax = np.max(np.abs(quantity))
4354            if np.any(quantity < 0):
4355                q_norm = Normalize(vmin=-q_absmax, vmax=q_absmax)
4356                q_cmap = cm.vik
4357            else:
4358                q_norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=q_absmax)
4359                q_cmap = cm.batlow
4360        # start figure
4361        fig = plt.figure()
4362        ax = fig.add_subplot(projection="3d")
4363        # plot inner mesh
4364        coll = ax.plot_trisurf(
4365            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4366            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4367            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4368            triangles=self.fault.inner_triangles,
4369            antialiased=True,
4370            linewidths=0,
4371        )
4372        # make prettier
4373        ax.view_init(elev=20, azim=-135)
4374        ax.set_xlabel("E [km]")
4375        ax.set_ylabel("N [km]")
4376        ax.set_zlabel("U [km]")
4377        ax.set_box_aspect(
4378            [ub - lb for lb, ub in (getattr(ax, f"get_{a}lim")() for a in "xyz")]
4379        )
4380        # set mesh colors
4381        coll.set_facecolor([q_cmap(q_norm(q)) for q in quantity])
4382        # add colorbar
4383        fig.colorbar(ScalarMappable(norm=q_norm, cmap=q_cmap), ax=ax, label=label)
4384        # finish
4385        return fig, ax

3D subduction simulation container class.

SubductionSimulation3D( n_cycles_max, n_samples_per_eq, slip_taper_distance, rheo, fault, D_0, D_0_logsigma, T_rec, T_rec_logsigma, T_anchor, T_last, enforce_v_plate, t_obs, pts_surf, atol=1e-08, rtol=1e-06, spinup_atol=1e-06, spinup_rtol=0.001, v_max=None, calculate_tapered_slip=True, final_nonuniform_slip=None, G_surf=None, v_init=None, eq_df=None, alpha_h_vec=None, eq_slip=None, slip_taper_vec=None, slip_taper_vec_nonuni=None, delta_tau_unbounded=None, delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni=None, delta_tau_taper=None, delta_tau_taper_nonuni=None, locked_slip=None, delta_tau_bounded_compressed=None, delta_tau_bounded_indices=None) 
2930    def __init__(
2931        self,
2932        n_cycles_max,
2933        n_samples_per_eq,
2934        slip_taper_distance,
2935        rheo,
2936        fault,
2937        D_0,
2938        D_0_logsigma,
2939        T_rec,
2940        T_rec_logsigma,
2941        T_anchor,
2942        T_last,
2943        enforce_v_plate,
2944        t_obs,
2945        pts_surf,
2946        atol=1e-8,
2947        rtol=1e-6,
2948        spinup_atol=1e-6,
2949        spinup_rtol=1e-3,
2950        v_max=None,
2951        calculate_tapered_slip=True,
2952        final_nonuniform_slip=None,
2953        G_surf=None,
2954        v_init=None,
2955        eq_df=None,
2956        alpha_h_vec=None,
2957        eq_slip=None,
2958        slip_taper_vec=None,
2959        slip_taper_vec_nonuni=None,
2960        delta_tau_unbounded=None,
2961        delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni=None,
2962        delta_tau_taper=None,
2963        delta_tau_taper_nonuni=None,
2964        locked_slip=None,
2965        delta_tau_bounded_compressed=None,
2966        delta_tau_bounded_indices=None,
2967    ):
2968        r"""
2969        Create a 3D subduction simulation.
2970
2971        Parameters
2972        ----------
2973        n_cycles_max : int
2974            Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
2975        n_samples_per_eq : int
2976            Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
2977        slip_taper_distance : float
2978            Length scale over with to taper out the coseismic slip [m]
2979        rheo : Rheology
2980            Simulated upper plate interface's rheology.
2981        fault : Fault3D
2982            Fault object
2983        D_0 : numpy.ndarray
2984            Nominal coseismic displacement magnitude [m] of the locked asperities
2985            in the opposite direction of the plate velocity, dimensions (n_eq, n_asp)
2986        D_0_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2987            Standard deviation of the displacement magnitude in logarithmic space,
2988            same shape as D_0
2989        T_rec : numpy.ndarray
2990            Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake, length n_eq
2991        T_rec_logsigma : numpy.ndarray
2992            Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
2993        T_anchor : str
2994            Anchor date where observations end
2995        T_last : list
2996            Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
2997        enforce_v_plate : bool
2998            Flag whether to allow the plate valocity in each patch to vary or not
2999            due to the random realizations of `D_0` and `T_rec`
3000        t_obs : numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex
3001            Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start,
3002            or as Timestamps
3003        pts_surf : numpy.ndarray
3004            Observation coordinates [m] in EFCS, dimensions (n_stations, 2 or 3)
3005        atol : float
3006            Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
3007        rtol : float
3008            Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
3009        spinup_atol : float
3010            Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
3011        spinup_rtol : float
3012            Relative tolerance of spinup controller
3013        v_max : float, optional
3014            Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches during integration
3015        calculate_tapered_slip : bool, optional
3016            If ``True`` (default: ``False``), also calculate the assumed tapered
3017            slip implied by the coseismic stress changes
3018        final_nonuniform_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
3019            A NumPy array that for all the observed earthquakes contains the amount of slip
3020            in all asperity patches [m] to be used after spinup.
3021        G_surf : numpy.ndarray, optional
3022            Skip the calculation of ``G_surf`` by passing it directly.
3023        v_init : numpy.ndarray, optional
3024            Skip the calculation of ``v_init`` by passing it directly.
3025        eq_df : pandas.DataFrame, optional
3026            Skip the calculation of ``eq_df`` by passing it directly.
3027        alpha_h_vec : numpy.ndarray, optional
3028            Skip the calculation of ``alpha_h_vec`` by passing it directly.
3029        eq_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
3030            Skip the calculation of ``eq_slip`` by passing it directly.
3031        slip_taper_vec : numpy.ndarray, optional
3032            Skip the calculation of ``slip_taper_vec`` by passing it directly.
3033        slip_taper_vec_nonuni : numpy.ndarray, optional
3034            Skip the calculation of ``slip_taper_vec_nonuni`` by passing it directly.
3035        delta_tau_unbounded : numpy.ndarray, optional
3036            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_unbounded`` by passing it directly.
3037        delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni : numpy.ndarray, optional
3038            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni`` by passing it directly.
3039        delta_tau_taper : numpy.ndarray, optional
3040            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_taper`` by passing it directly.
3041        delta_tau_taper_nonuni : numpy.ndarray, optional
3042            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_taper_nonuni`` by passing it directly.
3043        locked_slip : numpy.ndarray, optional
3044            Skip the calculation of ``locked_slip`` by passing it directly.
3045        delta_tau_bounded_compressed : numpy.ndarray, optional
3046            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_bounded_compressed`` by passing it directly.
3047        delta_tau_bounded_indices : numpy.ndarray, optional
3048            Skip the calculation of ``delta_tau_bounded_indices`` by passing it directly.
3049        """
3050
3051        # save general sequence & fault parameters
3052        self.n_cycles_max = int(n_cycles_max)
3053        """ Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-] """
3054        self.n_samples_per_eq = int(n_samples_per_eq)
3055        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-] """
3056        self.slip_taper_distance = float(slip_taper_distance)
3057        """ Length scale over with to taper out the coseismic slip [m] """
3058        self.atol = atol
3059        """ Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator """
3060        self.rtol = rtol
3061        """ Relative tolerance of ODE integrator """
3062        self.spinup_atol = spinup_atol
3063        """ Absolute tolerance of spinup controller """
3064        self.spinup_rtol = spinup_rtol
3065        """ Relative tolerance of spinup controller """
3066        self.v_max = None if v_max is None else float(v_max)
3067        """ Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches during integration """
3068
3069        # define rheology & fault
3070        assert isinstance(rheo, Rheology)
3071        assert isinstance(fault, Fault3D)
3072        self.rheo = rheo
3073        """ Simulated upper plate interface's Rheology object """
3074        self.fault = fault
3075        """ Fault object """
3076
3077        # cast earthquake displacements as NumPy array
3078        self.D_0 = np.atleast_2d(D_0)
3079        """ Nominal coseismic displacement magnitudes [m] for each asperity (columns)
3080        and each earthquake (rows) """
3081        self.D_0_logsigma = np.atleast_2d(D_0_logsigma)
3082        """ Standard deviation of the displacement magnitudes in logarithmic space [-] """
3083        assert np.all(self.D_0 >= 0) and np.all(self.D_0_logsigma >= 0)
3084        assert self.D_0.shape == self.D_0_logsigma.shape
3085        assert self.D_0.shape[1] == self.fault.num_asperities
3086        # load recurrence times
3087        self.T_rec = np.atleast_1d(T_rec)
3088        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake """
3089        self.T_rec_logsigma = np.atleast_1d(T_rec_logsigma)
3090        """ Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space """
3091        self.T_anchor = str(T_anchor)
3092        """ Anchor date where observations end """
3093        assert isinstance(T_last, list) and all([isinstance(tl, str) for tl in T_last])
3094        assert self.T_rec.size == self.T_rec_logsigma.size == self.D_0.shape[0]
3095        self.T_last = T_last
3096        """ Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake """
3097        # calculate how many earthquakes happen per cycle in each asperity
3098        self.T_fullcycle = np.lcm.reduce(self.T_rec)
3099        """ Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle """
3100        self.n_eq = self.D_0.shape[0]
3101        """ Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence """
3102        self.n_eq_per_cycle = (self.T_fullcycle / self.T_rec).astype(int)
3103        """ Number of earthquakes per full cycle """
3104        self.n_slips = self.n_eq_per_cycle.sum()
3105        """ Number of total earthquake events """
3106        total_cycle_clip_inferred_per_asperity = (
3107            self.D_0 * self.n_eq_per_cycle[:, None]
3108        ).sum(axis=0)
3109        v_plate_inferred = (
3110            total_cycle_clip_inferred_per_asperity / self.T_fullcycle / SEC_PER_YEAR
3111        )
3112        assert np.all(v_plate_inferred[0] == v_plate_inferred)
3113        self.v_plate_inferred = v_plate_inferred[0]
3114        """ Inferred plate velocity [m/s] based on the EQ setup """
3115
3116        # check that in each asperity, the nominal plate rate is recovered
3117        # after a full earthquake cycle
3118        # this will fail once we have rotation-based plate velocity
3119        if self.fault.farfield_motion_type == Fault3D.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM:
3120            v_plate_vec_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.fault.v_plate_vec, axis=1)
3121            assert np.allclose(v_plate_vec_mag[0], v_plate_vec_mag)
3122            v_plate_mag = v_plate_vec_mag[0]
3123            total_cycle_slip_necessary = v_plate_mag * self.T_fullcycle * SEC_PER_YEAR
3124            assert np.allclose(
3125                total_cycle_clip_inferred_per_asperity, total_cycle_slip_necessary
3126            )
3127
3128        # create realization of the slip amount and earthquake timings
3129        # first, create realizations of occurence times
3130        # note that this will result in a varying plate velocity rate
3131        rng = np.random.default_rng()
3132        self.T_rec_per_eq = [
3133            rng.lognormal(np.log(t), s, n)
3134            for t, s, n in zip(self.T_rec, self.T_rec_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_cycle)
3135        ]
3136        """ Recurrence time [a] realization """
3137        D_0_per_eq = [np.zeros((n, self.D_0.shape[1])) for n in self.n_eq_per_cycle]
3138        for i, (d, s, n) in enumerate(
3139            zip(self.D_0, self.D_0_logsigma, self.n_eq_per_cycle)
3140        ):
3141            d_nonzero = d > 0
3142            D_0_per_eq[i][:, d_nonzero] = rng.lognormal(
3143                np.log(d[d_nonzero]), s[d_nonzero], (n, (d_nonzero).sum())
3144            )
3145        self.D_0_per_eq = D_0_per_eq
3146        """ Coseismic slip magnitude [m] realization """
3147
3148        # second, we need to shift the random realization for each earthquake
3149        # individually such that they all yield the same v_plate_mag (enforced or not)
3150        # adjust that all asperities slip the same amount over an entire cycle
3151        D_0_per_eq_concat = np.concatenate(self.D_0_per_eq, axis=0)
3152        D_0_per_asp = D_0_per_eq_concat.sum(axis=0, keepdims=True)
3153        D_0_per_asp_mean = D_0_per_asp.mean()
3154        D_0_per_eq_concat_adj = D_0_per_eq_concat * D_0_per_asp_mean / D_0_per_asp
3155        D_0_per_eq_adj = np.split(
3156            D_0_per_eq_concat_adj, np.cumsum(self.n_eq_per_cycle)[:-1], axis=0
3157        )
3158        # adjust all individual recurrence times such that they have the same overall
3159        T_fullcycle_concat = np.array([t.sum() for t in self.T_rec_per_eq])
3160        T_fullcycle_mean = T_fullcycle_concat.mean()
3161        T_rec_per_eq_adj = [t * T_fullcycle_mean / t.sum() for t in self.T_rec_per_eq]
3162        # now each asperity has the same effective plate velocity, which can be different
3163        # from the nominal one - if we want to enforce the nominal plate velocity,
3164        # we can rescale the recurrence times again
3165        self.enforce_v_plate = bool(enforce_v_plate)
3166        """ Flag whether to allow v_plate_mag to vary or not """
3167        # get implied, effective plate velocity
3168        v_plate_eff_mag = (
3169            np.concatenate(D_0_per_eq_adj, axis=0).sum(axis=0)
3170            / np.array([t.sum() for t in T_rec_per_eq_adj])[:, None]
3171            / SEC_PER_YEAR
3172        ).ravel()
3173        assert np.allclose(v_plate_eff_mag[0], v_plate_eff_mag)
3174        # only need to keep single value
3175        v_plate_eff_mag = v_plate_eff_mag[0]
3176        if self.enforce_v_plate:
3177            v_plate_factor = self.v_plate_inferred / v_plate_eff_mag
3178            for i in range(self.n_eq):
3179                T_rec_per_eq_adj[i] /= v_plate_factor
3180            v_plate_eff_mag = self.v_plate_inferred
3181        self.v_plate_eff_mag = v_plate_eff_mag
3182        """ Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s] """
3183        self.T_eff = T_rec_per_eq_adj[0].sum()
3184        """ Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence """
3185        # calculate plate velocity vector on all patches,
3186        # with the lower interface going the opposite direction
3187        v_scale_ratio = self.v_plate_eff_mag / self.v_plate_inferred
3188        self.v_plate_vec_eff = self.fault.v_plate_vec * v_scale_ratio
3189        """ Effective plate velocity in 3D in all patches """
3190        self.v_plate_vec_eff_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate_vec_eff, axis=1)
3191        """ Effective plate velocity magnitude in all patches """
3192        # project the plate velocity onto the DDCS
3193        self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff = (
3194            self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj * self.v_plate_vec_eff_mag[:, None]
3195        )
3196        """ Projected, effective plate velocity in DDCS """
3197
3198        # third, we need to create a list of earthquake dates and associated slips
3199        if eq_df is None:
3200            year_offsets = [
3201                (pd.Period(self.T_anchor, "D") - pd.Period(self.T_last[i], "D")).n
3202                / 365.25
3203                for i in range(self.n_eq)
3204            ]
3205            eq_df_index = np.concatenate(
3206                [
3207                    self.T_eff
3208                    - (
3209                        np.cumsum(T_rec_per_eq_adj[i])
3210                        - T_rec_per_eq_adj[i]
3211                        + year_offsets[i]
3212                    )
3213                    for i in range(self.n_eq)
3214                ]
3215            )
3216            # round the dates to the closest day and combine earthquakes
3217            eq_df_index_rounded = np.around(eq_df_index * 365.25) / 365.25
3218            # build a DataFrame with exact and rounded times
3219            eq_df = pd.DataFrame(data=np.concatenate(D_0_per_eq_adj, axis=0))
3220            eq_df["time"] = eq_df_index
3221            eq_df["rounded"] = eq_df_index_rounded
3222            # now aggregate by rounded time, keeping the minimum exact time, and summing slip
3223            agg_dict = {"time": "min"}
3224            agg_dict.update({c: "sum" for c in range(self.D_0.shape[1])})
3225            eq_df = eq_df.groupby("rounded").agg(agg_dict)
3226            # convert time column to index and sort
3227            eq_df.set_index("time", inplace=True)
3228            eq_df.sort_index(inplace=True)
3229            assert np.allclose(eq_df.sum(axis=0), eq_df.sum(axis=0)[0])
3230        self.eq_df = eq_df
3231        """
3232        DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m]
3233        for each asperity based on inferred plate velocity
3234        """
3235
3236        # fourth, we need to create a list of dates to use internally when evaluating
3237        # the earthquake cycle - this is independent of the observation dates
3238        i_frac_cumsum = np.concatenate(
3239            [[self.eq_df.index[-1] - self.T_eff], self.eq_df.index.values]
3240        )
3241        T_frac = np.diff(i_frac_cumsum)
3242        logspace = np.logspace(
3243            0, np.log10(1 + T_frac), self.n_samples_per_eq, endpoint=False
3244        )
3245        p1 = np.arange(self.n_cycles_max).reshape(-1, 1, 1) * self.T_eff
3246        p2 = i_frac_cumsum[:-1].reshape(1, -1, 1)
3247        p3 = logspace.T[None, :, :]
3248        t_eval = (p1 - 1 + p2 + p3).ravel()
3249        num_neg = (t_eval < 0).sum()
3250        t_eval = np.roll(t_eval, -num_neg)
3251        t_eval[-num_neg:] += self.n_cycles_max * self.T_eff
3252        self.t_eval = np.sort(
3253            np.concatenate([t_eval, np.arange(self.n_cycles_max + 1) * self.T_eff])
3254        )
3255        """ Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
3256        self.n_eval = self.t_eval.size
3257        """ Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-] """
3258
3259        # fifth, for the integration, we need the indices of the timesteps that mark either
3260        # an earthquake or the start of a new cycle
3261        self.n_slips = self.eq_df.shape[0]
3262        """ Number of slips in a sequence [-] """
3263        self.ix_break = [
3264            i * (self.n_slips * self.n_samples_per_eq + 1)
3265            for i in range(self.n_cycles_max + 1)
3266        ]
3267        """ Indices of breaks between cycles """
3268        p1 = np.asarray(self.ix_break)[: self.n_cycles_max, None]
3269        p2 = np.arange(1, 1 + self.n_slips)[None, :]
3270        self.ix_eq = (p1 + p2 * self.n_samples_per_eq - num_neg + 1).ravel().tolist()
3271        """ Indices of earthquakes """
3272
3273        # sixth and last, for the final loop, we need a joint timesteps array between internal
3274        # and external (observation) timestamps, such that we can debug, check early stopping,
3275        # and restrict the output to the requested timeseries
3276        if isinstance(t_obs, pd.DatetimeIndex):
3277            t_obs_dates = t_obs.values
3278            t_obs = (
3279                self.T_eff
3280                + (t_obs - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor)).total_seconds().values
3281                / SEC_PER_YEAR
3282            )
3283        elif isinstance(t_obs, np.ndarray):
3284            if np.issubdtype(t_obs.dtype, np.datetime64):
3285                t_obs_dates = t_obs
3286                t_obs = (
3287                    self.T_eff
3288                    + (pd.DatetimeIndex(t_obs) - pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor))
3289                    .total_seconds()
3290                    .values
3291                    / SEC_PER_YEAR
3292                )
3293            elif np.all(t_obs <= 0):
3294                # this format is relative to T_anchor and more stable when T_eff varies
3295                t_obs_dates = pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor) + t_obs * pd.Timedelta(
3296                    365.25, "D"
3297                )
3298                t_obs = self.T_eff + t_obs
3299            assert np.all(t_obs >= 0) and np.all(t_obs < self.T_eff), (
3300                f"Range of 't_obs' ({t_obs.min()}-{t_obs.max():} years) outside of "
3301                f"the earthquake cycle period ({self.T_eff:} years)."
3302            )
3303        else:
3304            raise ValueError("Unknown 't_obs' data type.")
3305        self.t_obs = t_obs
3306        """ Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start] """
3307        self.t_obs_dates = t_obs_dates
3308        """ Observation timesteps [datetime format] """
3309        # combine all possible timesteps
3310        t_obs_shifted = self.t_obs + (self.n_cycles_max - 1) * self.T_eff
3311        t_eval_joint = np.concatenate((self.t_eval, t_obs_shifted))
3312        # round to nearest second for numerical stability later
3313        t_eval_joint = np.round(t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR
3314        self.t_eval_joint = np.unique(t_eval_joint)
3315        """
3316        Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps
3317        [decimal years since cycle start]
3318        """
3319        self.t_eval_obs = pd.Timestamp(self.T_anchor) + (
3320            self.t_eval[
3321                np.logical_and(
3322                    self.t_eval - self.T_eff * (self.n_cycles_max - 1)
3323                    >= self.t_obs.min(),
3324                    self.t_eval - self.T_eff * (self.n_cycles_max - 1)
3325                    <= self.t_obs.max(),
3326                )
3327            ]
3328            - self.T_eff * self.n_cycles_max
3329        ) * pd.Timedelta(365.25, "D")
3330        """
3331        Timestamps of the internal evaluation timesteps that fall within
3332        the external observation time window
3333        """
3334        # get indices of each individual subset in the new timesteps array
3335        ix_break_joint = np.isin(
3336            self.t_eval_joint,
3337            np.round(self.t_eval[self.ix_break] * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR,
3338        )
3339        self.ix_break_joint = np.flatnonzero(ix_break_joint)
3340        """ Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps """
3341        ix_eq_joint = np.isin(
3342            self.t_eval_joint,
3343            np.round(self.t_eval[self.ix_eq] * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR,
3344        )
3345        self.ix_eq_joint = np.flatnonzero(ix_eq_joint)
3346        """ Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps """
3347        ix_obs_joint = np.isin(
3348            self.t_eval_joint, np.round(t_obs_shifted * SEC_PER_YEAR) / SEC_PER_YEAR
3349        )
3350        self.ix_obs_joint = np.flatnonzero(ix_obs_joint)
3351        """ Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps """
3352        assert not np.any(np.logical_and(ix_break_joint, ix_eq_joint))
3353        assert ix_break_joint.sum() == len(self.ix_break)
3354        assert ix_eq_joint.sum() == len(self.ix_eq)
3355        assert ix_obs_joint.sum() == self.t_obs.size
3356
3357        # get vectors of upper plate alpha_h
3358        if alpha_h_vec is None:
3359            alpha_h_vec, dominant_bases = self.rheo.get_param_vectors(
3360                self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 0],
3361                self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 1],
3362                self.fault.inner_centroids,
3363                self.fault.outer_vertices,
3364            )
3365            alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec[:, None]
3366        else:
3367            dominant_bases = None
3368        self.alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec
3369        r""" Depth-variable :math:`\alpha_h` [Pa] of upper plate interface """
3370        self.dominant_bases = dominant_bases
3371        """ Index of which basis function is strongest at each patch [-] """
3372
3373        # get indices of first timestep after earthquake (for resets to zero)
3374        self.slips_obs = np.logical_and(
3375            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
3376        )
3377        """ Mask of which earthquakes in a cycle are observed """
3378        self.n_slips_obs = self.slips_obs.sum()
3379        """ Number of observed earthquakes [-] """
3380        if self.n_slips_obs > 0:
3381            i_slips_obs = [
3382                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
3383                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[self.slips_obs]
3384            ]
3385        else:
3386            i_slips_obs = None
3387        self.i_slips_obs = i_slips_obs
3388        """ Indices in t_obs for first observation after earthquakes [-] """
3389
3390        # project eq_df onto each patch using the directions of v_plate to get slip
3391        if eq_slip is None:
3392            total_slip_eff_asp = self.eq_df.sum(axis=0).values
3393            assert np.allclose(total_slip_eff_asp[0] - total_slip_eff_asp, 0)
3394            total_slip_from_v_plate = (
3395                self.v_plate_vec_eff_mag * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.T_eff
3396            )
3397            total_slip_from_v_plate_asp = total_slip_from_v_plate[
3398                self.fault.s_asperities
3399            ]
3400            if self.fault.farfield_motion_type == Fault3D.FARFIELD_MOTION_UNIFORM:
3401                assert np.allclose(
3402                    total_slip_from_v_plate[0] - total_slip_from_v_plate, 0
3403                )
3404            eq_df_frac = self.eq_df / self.T_eff / self.v_plate_inferred / SEC_PER_YEAR
3405            asp_eq_slip = [
3406                eq_df_frac.values[:, jasp][:, None]
3407                * total_slip_from_v_plate_asp[
3408                    self.fault.asperity_indices[jasp][None, :]
3409                ]
3410                for jasp in range(self.fault.num_asperities)
3411            ]
3412            eq_slip = np.concatenate(asp_eq_slip, axis=1)
3413        self.eq_slip = eq_slip
3414        """ Coseismic slip magnitude for each earthquake in each asperity [m] """
3415        self.eq_ddcs_proj = (
3416            self.eq_slip[:, :, None]
3417            * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, self.fault.s_asperities, :]
3418        )
3419        """ Coseismic slip for each earthquake in each asperity in DDCS [m] """
3420
3421        # calculate slip tapering
3422        if (slip_taper_vec is None) or (
3423            (final_nonuniform_slip is not None) and (slip_taper_vec_nonuni is None)
3424        ):
3425            # evaluate tapering function
3426            dist_vals_scaled = 1 - erf(
3427                self.fault.dists_inner_asperities / self.slip_taper_distance
3428            )
3429            # subset for the closest patches
3430            dist_vals_scaled_closest = np.take_along_axis(
3431                dist_vals_scaled, self.fault.i_closest_asp_tri, axis=0
3432            )
3433
3434        # apply to uniform events
3435        if slip_taper_vec is None:
3436            # get the slip magnitude in the relevant asperity triangles
3437            rel_asp_slip = self.eq_slip[
3438                :, self.fault.i_closest_asp_tri.ravel()
3439            ].reshape(
3440                self.n_slips, self.fault.num_asperities, self.fault.inner_num_patches
3441            )
3442            # get the slip taper for each EQ, asperity, and patch
3443            slip_taper_asp = rel_asp_slip * dist_vals_scaled_closest[None, :, :]
3444            # get the maximum
3445            slip_taper_mag = np.max(slip_taper_asp, axis=1)
3446            slip_taper_vec = (
3447                slip_taper_mag[:, :, None]
3448                * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, fault.s_inner, :]
3449            )
3450        self.slip_taper_vec = slip_taper_vec
3451        """ Tapered slip vector in the inner mesh for each earthquake in DDCS [m] """
3452
3453        # get unbounded delta_tau
3454        if delta_tau_unbounded is None:
3455            delta_tau_unbounded = np.tensordot(
3456                self.fault.K_inner_asperities[:, :2, :, :2],
3457                self.eq_ddcs_proj,
3458                axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3459            ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3460        self.delta_tau_unbounded = delta_tau_unbounded
3461        """ Array of unbounded coseismic stress changes [Pa] """
3462        if delta_tau_taper is None:
3463            delta_tau_taper = np.tensordot(
3464                self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
3465                self.slip_taper_vec,
3466                axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3467            ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3468        self.delta_tau_taper = delta_tau_taper
3469        """ Array of taper-induced coseismic stress changes [Pa] """
3470        self.delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_unbounded + self.delta_tau_taper
3471        """ Bounded (tapered) coseismic stress change [Pa] """
3472
3473        # generate a copy of delta_tau_bounded with non-uniform slip, if provided
3474        if final_nonuniform_slip is not None:
3475            # check shape
3476            assert isinstance(
3477                final_nonuniform_slip, np.ndarray
3478            ), "'final_nonuniform_slip' needs to be a NumPy array"
3479            assert (
3480                final_nonuniform_slip.shape[1] == self.fault.asperities_num_patches
3481            ), (
3482                "'final_nonuniform_slip' needs to be have a exactly "
3483                f"{self.fault.asperities_num_patches} columns, got "
3484                f"{final_nonuniform_slip.shape[1]}."
3485            )
3486            n_nonuni_slips = final_nonuniform_slip.shape[0]
3487            self.eq_ddcs_proj_nonuni = (
3488                final_nonuniform_slip[:, :, None]
3489                * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, self.fault.s_asperities, :]
3490            )
3491            """ Non-uniform slip for each observed earthquake and asperity in DDCS [m] """
3492            # calculate taper
3493            if slip_taper_vec_nonuni is None:
3494                rel_asp_slip_nonuni = final_nonuniform_slip[
3495                    :, self.fault.i_closest_asp_tri.ravel()
3496                ].reshape(
3497                    n_nonuni_slips,
3498                    self.fault.num_asperities,
3499                    self.fault.inner_num_patches,
3500                )
3501                slip_taper_asp_nonuni = (
3502                    rel_asp_slip_nonuni * dist_vals_scaled_closest[None, :, :]
3503                )
3504                slip_taper_mag_nonuni = np.max(slip_taper_asp_nonuni, axis=1)
3505                slip_taper_vec_nonuni = (
3506                    slip_taper_mag_nonuni[..., None]
3507                    * self.fault.e_plate_ddcs_proj[None, self.fault.s_inner, :]
3508                )
3509            self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni = slip_taper_vec_nonuni
3510            """ Non-uniform tapered slip for each observed earthquake and asperity in DDCS [m] """
3511            # calculate stress changes
3512            if delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni is None:
3513                delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni = np.tensordot(
3514                    self.fault.K_inner_asperities[:, :2, :, :2],
3515                    self.eq_ddcs_proj_nonuni,
3516                    axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3517                ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3518            self.delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni = delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni
3519            """ Array of unbounded non-uniform stress changes [Pa] """
3520            if delta_tau_taper_nonuni is None:
3521                delta_tau_taper_nonuni = np.tensordot(
3522                    self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
3523                    self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni,
3524                    axes=[(3, 2), (2, 1)],
3525                ).transpose(2, 0, 1)
3526            self.delta_tau_taper_nonuni = delta_tau_taper_nonuni
3527            """ Array of taper-induced non-uniform coseismic stress changes [Pa] """
3528            delta_tau_bounded_nonuni = (
3529                self.delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni + self.delta_tau_taper_nonuni
3530            )
3531        else:
3532            delta_tau_bounded_nonuni = None
3533        self.delta_tau_bounded_nonuni = delta_tau_bounded_nonuni
3534        """ Bounded non-uniform stress change [Pa] """
3535
3536        # get the additional slip during the observed period
3537        if calculate_tapered_slip:
3538            slip_taper = self.slip_taper_vec.copy()
3539            if final_nonuniform_slip is not None:
3540                slip_taper[-n_nonuni_slips:, :, :] = self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni
3541            slip_taper_strike = (
3542                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=slip_taper[:, :, 0])
3543                .cumsum(axis=0)
3544                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3545                .values.T
3546            )
3547            slip_taper_dip = (
3548                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=slip_taper[:, :, 1])
3549                .cumsum(axis=0)
3550                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3551                .values.T
3552            )
3553            self.slip_taper = np.stack([slip_taper_strike, slip_taper_dip], axis=1)
3554            """ Timeseries of tapered slip [m] on the upper creeping fault patches """
3555
3556        # create the Green's matrices
3557        pts_surf = np.atleast_2d(pts_surf)
3558        assert (pts_surf.ndim == 2) and (pts_surf.shape[1] in [2, 3])
3559        if pts_surf.shape[1] == 2:
3560            pts_surf = np.concatenate(
3561                [pts_surf, np.zeros((pts_surf.shape[0], 1))], axis=1
3562            )
3563        self.pts_surf = np.ascontiguousarray(pts_surf)
3564        """ Coordinates of surface observation points [m] """
3565        self.n_observers = self.pts_surf.shape[0]
3566        """ Number of observers """
3567        if G_surf is None:
3568            print("Calculating displacement kernel... ", flush=True, end="")
3569            tic = perf_counter()
3570            G_surf = Fault3D.get_disp_kernel(
3571                self.pts_surf,
3572                self.fault.joint_patches,
3573                self.fault.nu,
3574                rot_mats_tdcs=self.fault.R_joint_tdcs_to_ddcs,
3575            )[:, :, :, :2]
3576            toc = perf_counter()
3577            print(f"done ({toc - tic:.2f} s)", flush=True)
3578        else:
3579            assert isinstance(
3580                G_surf, np.ndarray
3581            ), f"Expected 'G_surf' NumPy array, got {type(G_surf)}."
3582            expected_shape = (self.n_observers, 3, self.fault.joint_num_patches, 2)
3583            assert (
3584                G_surf.shape == expected_shape
3585            ), f"Expected 'G_surf' shape of {expected_shape}, got {G_surf.shape}."
3586            print(f"Accepted input 'G_surf' of shape {expected_shape}.")
3587        self.G_surf = G_surf
3588        """ Green's matrix [-] relating slip on all patches to surface motion """
3589
3590        # get slip timeseries for the non-simulated patches
3591        if final_nonuniform_slip is None:
3592            eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs = self.eq_ddcs_proj
3593        else:
3594            eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs = self.eq_ddcs_proj.copy()
3595            eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs[-n_nonuni_slips:, :, :] = self.eq_ddcs_proj_nonuni
3596        if locked_slip is None:
3597            locked_slip_strike = (
3598                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs[:, :, 0])
3599                .cumsum(axis=0)
3600                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3601                .values.T
3602            )
3603            locked_slip_dip = (
3604                pd.DataFrame(index=self.eq_df.index, data=eq_ddcs_proj_for_obs[:, :, 1])
3605                .cumsum(axis=0)
3606                .reindex(index=self.t_obs, method="ffill", fill_value=0)
3607                .values.T
3608            )
3609            locked_slip = np.stack([locked_slip_strike, locked_slip_dip], axis=1)
3610        self.locked_slip = locked_slip
3611        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan """
3612        self.outer_creep_slip = (
3613            self.t_obs[None, None, :]
3614            * SEC_PER_YEAR
3615            * self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_outer, :, None]
3616        )
3617        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the outer creep patches for observation timestamps """
3618        self.lower_creep_slip = (
3619            self.t_obs[None, None, :]
3620            * SEC_PER_YEAR
3621            * self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_lower, :, None]
3622        )
3623        """ Timeseries of slip [m] on the lower creep patches for observation timestamps """
3624
3625        # pre-calculate the constant stressing rate from the asperities
3626        self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate = np.tensordot(
3627            self.fault.K_inner_asperities[:, :2, :, :2],
3628            self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_asperities, :],
3629            axes=[(3, 2), (1, 0)],
3630        )
3631        """ Stressing rate from the locked asperities onto the simulated patches [Pa/s] """
3632
3633        # calculate initial velocity from steady-state stress balance
3634        if v_init is None:
3635            v_plate = self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_inner, :].ravel()
3636            K_ext_v_plate = self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate.ravel()
3637            K_int = self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2].reshape(
3638                v_plate.size, v_plate.size
3639            )
3640            v_init = np.linalg.lstsq(
3641                K_int, K_int @ v_plate + K_ext_v_plate, rcond=None
3642            )[0].reshape(self.fault.inner_num_patches, 2)
3643        else:
3644            expected_shape = (self.fault.inner_num_patches, 2)
3645            assert v_init.shape == expected_shape, (
3646                "Couldn't load initial velocities due to shape mismatch:\n"
3647                f"Loaded = {v_init.shape}, expected = {expected_shape}."
3648            )
3649        self.v_init = v_init
3650        """ Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s] """
3651
3652        # get compressed version of delta_tau_bounded that only has unique events
3653        if (delta_tau_bounded_compressed is None) or (
3654            delta_tau_bounded_indices is None
3655        ):
3656            delta_tau_bounded_compressed, delta_tau_bounded_indices = np.unique(
3657                self.delta_tau_bounded, axis=0, return_inverse=True
3658            )
3659        self.delta_tau_bounded_compressed = delta_tau_bounded_compressed
3660        """ Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] for unique events """
3661        self.delta_tau_bounded_indices = delta_tau_bounded_indices
3662        """ Indices to convert the compressed coseismic stress changes into the full ones [-] """

Create a 3D subduction simulation.

Parameters
  • n_cycles_max (int): Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]
  • n_samples_per_eq (int): Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]
  • slip_taper_distance (float): Length scale over with to taper out the coseismic slip [m]
  • rheo (Rheology): Simulated upper plate interface's rheology.
  • fault (Fault3D): Fault object
  • D_0 (numpy.ndarray): Nominal coseismic displacement magnitude [m] of the locked asperities in the opposite direction of the plate velocity, dimensions (n_eq, n_asp)
  • D_0_logsigma (numpy.ndarray): Standard deviation of the displacement magnitude in logarithmic space, same shape as D_0
  • T_rec (numpy.ndarray): Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake, length n_eq
  • T_rec_logsigma (numpy.ndarray): Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space
  • T_anchor (str): Anchor date where observations end
  • T_last (list): Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake (list of strings)
  • enforce_v_plate (bool): Flag whether to allow the plate valocity in each patch to vary or not due to the random realizations of D_0 and T_rec
  • t_obs (numpy.ndarray, pandas.DatetimeIndex): Observation timesteps, either as decimal years relative to the cycle start, or as Timestamps
  • pts_surf (numpy.ndarray): Observation coordinates [m] in EFCS, dimensions (n_stations, 2 or 3)
  • atol (float): Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator
  • rtol (float): Relative tolerance of ODE integrator
  • spinup_atol (float): Absolute tolerance of spinup controller
  • spinup_rtol (float): Relative tolerance of spinup controller
  • v_max (float, optional): Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches during integration
  • calculate_tapered_slip (bool, optional): If True (default: False), also calculate the assumed tapered slip implied by the coseismic stress changes
  • final_nonuniform_slip (numpy.ndarray, optional): A NumPy array that for all the observed earthquakes contains the amount of slip in all asperity patches [m] to be used after spinup.
  • G_surf (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of G_surf by passing it directly.
  • v_init (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of v_init by passing it directly.
  • eq_df (pandas.DataFrame, optional): Skip the calculation of eq_df by passing it directly.
  • alpha_h_vec (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of alpha_h_vec by passing it directly.
  • eq_slip (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of eq_slip by passing it directly.
  • slip_taper_vec (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of slip_taper_vec by passing it directly.
  • slip_taper_vec_nonuni (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of slip_taper_vec_nonuni by passing it directly.
  • delta_tau_unbounded (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of delta_tau_unbounded by passing it directly.
  • delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of delta_tau_unbounded_nonuni by passing it directly.
  • delta_tau_taper (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of delta_tau_taper by passing it directly.
  • delta_tau_taper_nonuni (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of delta_tau_taper_nonuni by passing it directly.
  • locked_slip (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of locked_slip by passing it directly.
  • delta_tau_bounded_compressed (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of delta_tau_bounded_compressed by passing it directly.
  • delta_tau_bounded_indices (numpy.ndarray, optional): Skip the calculation of delta_tau_bounded_indices by passing it directly.
n_cycles_max

Maximum number of cycles to simulate [-]

n_samples_per_eq

Number of internal evaluation timesteps between earthquakes [-]

slip_taper_distance

Length scale over with to taper out the coseismic slip [m]

atol

Absolute tolerance of ODE integrator

rtol

Relative tolerance of ODE integrator

spinup_atol

Absolute tolerance of spinup controller

spinup_rtol

Relative tolerance of spinup controller

v_max

Maximum slip velocity [m/s] on creeping patches during integration

rheo

Simulated upper plate interface's Rheology object

fault

Fault object

D_0

Nominal coseismic displacement magnitudes [m] for each asperity (columns) and each earthquake (rows)

D_0_logsigma

Standard deviation of the displacement magnitudes in logarithmic space [-]

T_rec

Nominal recurrence time [a] for each earthquake

T_rec_logsigma

Standard deviation of the recurrence time in logarithmic space

T_anchor

Anchor date where observations end

T_last

Dates of the last occurence for each earthquake

T_fullcycle

Nominal recurrence time [a] for an entire joint earthquake cycle

n_eq

Number of distinct earthquakes in sequence

n_eq_per_cycle

Number of earthquakes per full cycle

n_slips

Number of slips in a sequence [-]

v_plate_inferred

Inferred plate velocity [m/s] based on the EQ setup

T_rec_per_eq

Recurrence time [a] realization

D_0_per_eq

Coseismic slip magnitude [m] realization

enforce_v_plate

Flag whether to allow v_plate_mag to vary or not

v_plate_eff_mag

Effective far-field plate velocity [m/s]

T_eff

Effective length [a] of entire earthquake sequence

v_plate_vec_eff

Effective plate velocity in 3D in all patches

v_plate_vec_eff_mag

Effective plate velocity magnitude in all patches

v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff

Projected, effective plate velocity in DDCS

eq_df

DataFrame with the dates [decimal year from cycle start] and slips [m] for each asperity based on inferred plate velocity

t_eval

Internal evaluation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start]

n_eval

Number of internal evaluation timesteps [-]

ix_break

Indices of breaks between cycles

ix_eq

Indices of earthquakes

t_obs

Observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start]

t_obs_dates

Observation timesteps [datetime format]

t_eval_joint

Joint internal evaluation and external observation timesteps [decimal years since cycle start]

t_eval_obs

Timestamps of the internal evaluation timesteps that fall within the external observation time window

ix_break_joint

Indices of breaks between cycles in joint timesteps

ix_eq_joint

Indices of earthquakes in joint timesteps

ix_obs_joint

Indices of observation timestamps in joint timesteps

alpha_h_vec

Depth-variable \( \alpha_h \) [Pa] of upper plate interface

dominant_bases

Index of which basis function is strongest at each patch [-]

slips_obs

Mask of which earthquakes in a cycle are observed

n_slips_obs

Number of observed earthquakes [-]

i_slips_obs

Indices in t_obs for first observation after earthquakes [-]

eq_slip

Coseismic slip magnitude for each earthquake in each asperity [m]

eq_ddcs_proj

Coseismic slip for each earthquake in each asperity in DDCS [m]

slip_taper_vec

Tapered slip vector in the inner mesh for each earthquake in DDCS [m]

delta_tau_unbounded

Array of unbounded coseismic stress changes [Pa]

delta_tau_taper

Array of taper-induced coseismic stress changes [Pa]

delta_tau_bounded

Bounded (tapered) coseismic stress change [Pa]

delta_tau_bounded_nonuni

Bounded non-uniform stress change [Pa]

pts_surf

Coordinates of surface observation points [m]

n_observers

Number of observers

G_surf

Green's matrix [-] relating slip on all patches to surface motion

locked_slip

Timeseries of slip [m] on the locked patches for observation timespan

outer_creep_slip

Timeseries of slip [m] on the outer creep patches for observation timestamps

lower_creep_slip

Timeseries of slip [m] on the lower creep patches for observation timestamps

K_inner_asperities_v_plate

Stressing rate from the locked asperities onto the simulated patches [Pa/s]

v_init

Initial velocity in all creeping patches [m/s]

delta_tau_bounded_compressed

Bounded coseismic stress change [Pa] for unique events

delta_tau_bounded_indices

Indices to convert the compressed coseismic stress changes into the full ones [-]

def update_rheo(self, rheo): 
3664    def update_rheo(self, rheo):
3665        """
3666        Update the current simulation object to match a new rheology, keeping everything else
3667        the same.
3668
3669        Parameters
3670        ----------
3671        rheo : Rheology
3672            New rheology object.
3673        """
3674        # save rheology object
3675        assert isinstance(rheo, Rheology)
3676        self.rheo = rheo
3677        # update alpha_h_vec
3678        alpha_h_vec, dominant_bases = self.rheo.get_param_vectors(
3679            self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 0],
3680            self.fault.inner_patch_2d_coords[:, 1],
3681            self.fault.inner_centroids,
3682            self.fault.outer_vertices,
3683        )
3684        alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec[:, None]
3685        self.alpha_h_vec = alpha_h_vec
3686        self.dominant_bases = dominant_bases
3687        # done

Update the current simulation object to match a new rheology, keeping everything else the same.

Parameters
  • rheo (Rheology): New rheology object.
def get_vels(self, state): 
3689    def get_vels(self, state):
3690        """
3691        Calculate the observed surface velocities from different contributions.
3692
3693        Parameters
3694        ----------
3695        state : numpy.ndarray
3696            State variable of fault interface.
3697
3698        Returns
3699        -------
3700        surf_vels_sim : numpy.ndarray
3701            Surface velocities [m/s] due to the simulated part of the fault interface.
3702        surf_vels_outer : numpy.ndarray
3703            Surface velocities [m/s] due to the outer part of the fault interface.
3704        surf_vels_lower : numpy.ndarray
3705            Surface velocities [m/s] due to the lower side of the fault interface.
3706        """
3707        surf_vels_sim = get_surface_displacements(
3708            state[self.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, :],
3709            self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_inner, :],
3710        )
3711        outer_creep_vel = self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_outer, :, None]
3712        surf_vels_outer = get_surface_displacements(
3713            outer_creep_vel, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_outer, :]
3714        )
3715        lower_creep_vel = self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_lower, :, None]
3716        surf_vels_lower = get_surface_displacements(
3717            lower_creep_vel, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_lower, :]
3718        )
3719        return surf_vels_sim, surf_vels_outer, surf_vels_lower

Calculate the observed surface velocities from different contributions.

Parameters
  • state (numpy.ndarray): State variable of fault interface.
Returns
  • surf_vels_sim (numpy.ndarray): Surface velocities [m/s] due to the simulated part of the fault interface.
  • surf_vels_outer (numpy.ndarray): Surface velocities [m/s] due to the outer part of the fault interface.
  • surf_vels_lower (numpy.ndarray): Surface velocities [m/s] due to the lower side of the fault interface.
def get_euler_pole_kernel(self): 
3721    def get_euler_pole_kernel(self):
3722        """
3723        Calculate the displacement kernel that applies an Euler pole rotation
3724        to the observers.
3725
3726        Returns
3727        -------
3728        G_ep : numpy.ndarray
3729            Euler pole displacement kernel of shape :math:`(m, 2, 3)`,
3730            where :math:`m` is the number of observers.
3731        """
3732        assert self.fault.utmzone is not None
3733        # calculate observer locations in ECEF and LLA coordinates
3734        crs_lla = ccrs.Geodetic()
3735        crs_utm = ccrs.UTM(zone=self.fault.utmzone)
3736        crs_xyz = ccrs.Geocentric()
3737        loc_obs_lla = crs_lla.transform_points(
3738            crs_utm, self.pts_surf[:, 0], self.pts_surf[:, 1]
3739        )
3740        loc_obs_xyz = crs_xyz.transform_points(
3741            crs_utm, self.pts_surf[:, 0], self.pts_surf[:, 1]
3742        )
3743        # create kernel
3744        R_cross_obs = [crossmat(x1, x2, x3) for x1, x2, x3 in loc_obs_xyz]
3745        R_ecef2enu_obs = [R_ecef2enu(lo, la) for lo, la in loc_obs_lla[:, :2]]
3746        G_ep = np.stack(
3747            [
3748                (R_ecef2enu_obs[i] @ R_cross_obs[i])[:2, :]
3749                for i in range(self.pts_surf.shape[0])
3750            ]
3751        )
3752        # done
3753        return G_ep

Calculate the displacement kernel that applies an Euler pole rotation to the observers.

Returns
  • G_ep (numpy.ndarray): Euler pole displacement kernel of shape \( (m, 2, 3) \), where \( m \) is the number of observers.
@staticmethod
def read_config_file(config_file): 
3755    @staticmethod
3756    def read_config_file(config_file):
3757        """
3758        Read a configuration file and return it as parsed dictionaries.
3759
3760        Parameters
3761        ----------
3762        config_file : str
3763            Path to INI configuration file.
3764
3765        Returns
3766        -------
3767        rheo_dict : dict
3768            Parsed configuration file for the rheology object.
3769        fault_dict : dict
3770            Parsed configuration file for the fault object.
3771        sim_dict : dict
3772            Parsed configuration file for the simulation object.
3773        """
3774
3775        # load configuration file
3776        cfg = configparser.ConfigParser()
3777        cfg.optionxform = str
3778        with open(config_file, mode="rt") as f:
3779            cfg.read_file(f)
3780        cfg_sim, cfg_fault, cfg_rheo = cfg["simulation"], cfg["fault"], cfg["rheology"]
3781
3782        # create rheology dictionary
3783        rheo_dict = {
3784            "v_0": cfg_rheo.getfloat("v_0"),
3785            "alpha_h_mat": np.atleast_2d(json.loads(cfg_rheo["alpha_h_mat"])),
3786            "degree": cfg_rheo.getint("degree"),
3787            "boundary_width": cfg_rheo.getfloat("boundary_width"),
3788            "alpha_h_boundary": cfg_rheo.getfloat("alpha_h_boundary"),
3789        }
3790
3791        # prepare fault dictionary
3792        farfield_motion_type = cfg_fault.getint("farfield_motion_type")
3793        if farfield_motion_type == Fault3D.FARFIELD_MOTION_PROVIDED:
3794            farfield_motion = np.load(cfg_fault["farfield_motion"])
3795        else:
3796            farfield_motion = np.atleast_1d(json.loads(cfg_fault["farfield_motion"]))
3797        # load custom stress kernels
3798        K_inner_asperities_file = cfg_fault.get("K_inner_asperities_file")
3799        K_inner_asperities = (
3800            None
3801            if K_inner_asperities_file is None
3802            else np.load(K_inner_asperities_file)
3803        )
3804        K_inner_inner_file = cfg_fault.get("K_inner_inner_file")
3805        K_inner_inner = (
3806            None if K_inner_inner_file is None else np.load(K_inner_inner_file)
3807        )
3808
3809        # create fault dictionary
3810        fault_dict = {
3811            "inner_mesh_files": json.loads(cfg_fault["inner_mesh_files"]),
3812            "asperity_mesh_files": json.loads(cfg_fault["asperity_mesh_files"]),
3813            "lower_mesh_files": json.loads(cfg_fault["lower_mesh_files"]),
3814            "downdip_direction": cfg_fault.get("downdip_direction"),
3815            "mu": cfg_fault.getfloat("mu"),
3816            "nu": cfg_fault.getfloat("nu"),
3817            "v_s": cfg_fault.getfloat("v_s"),
3818            "farfield_motion": farfield_motion,
3819            "farfield_motion_type": farfield_motion_type,
3820            "max_simulated_distance": cfg_fault.getfloat("max_simulated_distance"),
3821            "max_simulated_depth": cfg_fault.getfloat("max_simulated_depth"),
3822            "orient_along": cfg_fault.getfloat("orient_along"),
3823            "utmzone": cfg_fault.getint("utmzone"),
3824            "lon0": cfg_fault.getfloat("lon0"),
3825            "lat0": cfg_fault.getfloat("lat0"),
3826            "offset_lower": cfg_fault.getfloat("offset_lower", 0),
3827            "K_inner_asperities": K_inner_asperities,
3828            "K_inner_inner": K_inner_inner,
3829        }
3830
3831        # prepare simulation dictionary
3832        # load earthquake setup file
3833        eq_setup = pd.read_csv(cfg_sim.get("eq_file"), index_col=0)
3834        assert (eq_setup.shape[1] - 3) % 2 == 0
3835        num_asperities = (eq_setup.shape[1] - 3) // 2
3836        T_last = eq_setup["T_last"].tolist()
3837        T_rec = eq_setup["T_rec"].values
3838        T_rec_logsigma = eq_setup["T_rec_logsigma"].values
3839        D_0 = eq_setup[[f"D_0_{i}" for i in range(num_asperities)]].values
3840        D_0_logsigma = eq_setup[
3841            [f"D_0_logsigma_{i}" for i in range(num_asperities)]
3842        ].values
3843        # load observation timestamps
3844        t_obs = np.load(cfg_sim.get("t_obs_file"))
3845        # load observer locations
3846        obs_loc = pd.read_csv(cfg_sim.get("obs_loc_file"), index_col=0)
3847        pts_surf = obs_loc.values
3848        # load final nonuniform slip file
3849        final_nonuniform_slip_file = cfg_sim.get("final_nonuniform_slip_file")
3850        final_nonuniform_slip = (
3851            None
3852            if final_nonuniform_slip_file is None
3853            else np.load(final_nonuniform_slip_file)
3854        )
3855        # load initial velocity file
3856        v_init_file = cfg_sim.get("v_init_file")
3857        v_init = None if v_init_file is None else np.load(v_init_file)
3858        # load custom displacement kernel
3859        G_surf_file = cfg_sim.get("G_surf_file")
3860        G_surf = None if G_surf_file is None else np.load(G_surf_file)
3861
3862        # create simulation dictionary
3863        sim_dict = {
3864            "n_cycles_max": cfg_sim.getint("n_cycles_max"),
3865            "n_samples_per_eq": cfg_sim.getint("n_samples_per_eq"),
3866            "slip_taper_distance": cfg_sim.getfloat("slip_taper_distance"),
3867            "D_0": D_0,
3868            "D_0_logsigma": D_0_logsigma,
3869            "T_rec": T_rec,
3870            "T_rec_logsigma": T_rec_logsigma,
3871            "T_anchor": cfg_sim.get("T_anchor"),
3872            "T_last": T_last,
3873            "enforce_v_plate": cfg_sim.getboolean("enforce_v_plate"),
3874            "t_obs": t_obs,
3875            "pts_surf": pts_surf,
3876            "atol": cfg_sim.getfloat("atol"),
3877            "rtol": cfg_sim.getfloat("rtol"),
3878            "spinup_atol": cfg_sim.getfloat("spinup_atol"),
3879            "spinup_rtol": cfg_sim.getfloat("spinup_rtol"),
3880            "v_max": cfg_sim.getfloat("v_max"),
3881            "final_nonuniform_slip": final_nonuniform_slip,
3882            "G_surf": G_surf,
3883            "v_init": v_init,
3884        }
3885
3886        # done
3887        return rheo_dict, fault_dict, sim_dict

Read a configuration file and return it as parsed dictionaries.

Parameters
  • config_file (str): Path to INI configuration file.
Returns
  • rheo_dict (dict): Parsed configuration file for the rheology object.
  • fault_dict (dict): Parsed configuration file for the fault object.
  • sim_dict (dict): Parsed configuration file for the simulation object.
@classmethod
def from_cfg_objs_and_files( cls, sim_dict, rheo, fault, G_surf_file=None, write_new_files=True, verbose=False): 
3889    @classmethod
3890    def from_cfg_objs_and_files(
3891        cls,
3892        sim_dict,
3893        rheo,
3894        fault,
3895        G_surf_file=None,
3896        write_new_files=True,
3897        verbose=False,
3898    ):
3899        """
3900        Create a `SubductionSimulation3D` object from a configuration dictionary,
3901        precomputed objects and files.
3902
3903        Parameters
3904        ----------
3905        sim_dict : dict
3906            Dictionary of keyword arguments passed on to the initialization; from
3907            `SubductionSimulation3D.read_config_file`
3908        rheo : Rheology
3909            Simulated upper plate interface's rheology.
3910        fault : Fault3D
3911            Fault object
3912        G_surf_file : str, optional
3913            File name for `G_surf`
3914        write_new_files : bool, optional
3915            Whether to save to files the kernels and cross sections if they were missing
3916        verbose : bool, optional
3917            Print what's happening
3918
3919        Returns
3920        -------
3921        sim : Fault3D
3922            The new `Fault3D` object
3923        """
3924        # check for G_surf
3925        if G_surf_file is not None:
3926            try:
3927                G_surf = np.load(G_surf_file)
3928            except FileNotFoundError:
3929                G_surf = None
3930                if verbose:
3931                    print(f"Couldn't find '{G_surf_file}', " "need to recompute G_surf")
3932            else:
3933                if verbose:
3934                    print(f"Loaded G_surf from '{G_surf_file}'")
3935            if "G_surf" in sim_dict:
3936                del sim_dict["G_surf"]
3937        else:
3938            G_surf = sim_dict.pop("G_surf", None)
3939        # create new object
3940        sim = cls(**sim_dict, rheo=rheo, fault=fault, G_surf=G_surf)
3941        # save new files if desired
3942        if write_new_files:
3943            if (G_surf_file is not None) and (G_surf is None):
3944                np.save(G_surf_file, sim.G_surf)
3945                if verbose:
3946                    print(f"Saved G_surf to '{G_surf_file}'")
3947        # return new object
3948        return sim

Create a SubductionSimulation3D object from a configuration dictionary, precomputed objects and files.

Parameters
  • sim_dict (dict): Dictionary of keyword arguments passed on to the initialization; from SubductionSimulation3D.read_config_file
  • rheo (Rheology): Simulated upper plate interface's rheology.
  • fault (Fault3D): Fault object
  • G_surf_file (str, optional): File name for G_surf
  • write_new_files (bool, optional): Whether to save to files the kernels and cross sections if they were missing
  • verbose (bool, optional): Print what's happening
Returns
  • sim (Fault3D): The new Fault3D object
def write_run_files(self, folder): 
3950    def write_run_files(self, folder):
3951        """
3952        Write all the data required to run the simulation into files and save type and
3953        shape information as a JSON. Output files will be overwritten.
3954
3955        Parameters
3956        ----------
3957        folder : str
3958            Folder to use for the output files. Gets created if it doesn't exist.
3959        """
3960        # imports
3961        import json
3962        from pathlib import Path
3963
3964        # check for folder, raises error if it's a file
3965        folder = Path(folder)
3966        folder.mkdir(exist_ok=True)
3967        # set up data
3968        data = {
3969            "t_eval_joint_sec": self.t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR,
3970            "ix_break_joint": self.ix_break_joint.astype("int32"),
3971            "ix_eq_joint": self.ix_eq_joint.astype("int32"),
3972            "K_inner_inner_onfault": self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
3973            "K_inner_asperities_v_plate": self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate,
3974            "v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff_inner": self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[
3975                self.fault.s_inner, :
3976            ],
3977            "v_init": self.v_init,
3978            "delta_tau_bounded_compressed": self.delta_tau_bounded_compressed,
3979            "delta_tau_bounded_indices": self.delta_tau_bounded_indices.astype("int32"),
3980            "v_0": np.atleast_1d(self.rheo.v_0),
3981            "alpha_h_vec": np.squeeze(self.alpha_h_vec),
3982            "mu_over_2vs": np.atleast_1d(self.fault.mu_over_2vs),
3983        }
3984        # set up info dictionary
3985        info = {}
3986        # write data
3987        for key, value in data.items():
3988            # write data
3989            with open(folder / f"{key}.bin", mode="wb") as fdata:
3990                np.ascontiguousarray(value).tofile(fdata)
3991            # attach info
3992            info[key] = {"dtype": str(value.dtype), "shape": value.shape}
3993        # write info
3994        with open(folder / "runfiles.json", mode="wt") as finfo:
3995            json.dump(info, finfo, indent=2)

Write all the data required to run the simulation into files and save type and shape information as a JSON. Output files will be overwritten.

Parameters
  • folder (str): Folder to use for the output files. Gets created if it doesn't exist.
def run(self, reference_velocity_index=None, verbose=False, rho=None): 
3997    def run(self, reference_velocity_index=None, verbose=False, rho=None):
3998        """
3999        Run a full simulation.
4000        """
4001        # run forward integration
4002        if isinstance(self.rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic) or isinstance(
4003            self.rheo, RateStateSteadyLogarithmic2D
4004        ):
4005            if rho is None:  # use default method
4006                sim_state = flat_run_rdlog(
4007                    self.t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR,
4008                    self.ix_break_joint,
4009                    self.ix_eq_joint,
4010                    self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
4011                    self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate,
4012                    self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_inner, :],
4013                    self.v_init,
4014                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
4015                    self.delta_tau_bounded_nonuni,
4016                    self.rheo.v_0,
4017                    self.alpha_h_vec,
4018                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
4019                    self.v_max,
4020                    self.atol,
4021                    self.rtol,
4022                    self.spinup_atol,
4023                    self.spinup_rtol,
4024                    verbose,
4025                )
4026            else:  # use regularized version
4027                sim_state = flat_run_rdreg(
4028                    self.t_eval_joint * SEC_PER_YEAR,
4029                    self.ix_break_joint,
4030                    self.ix_eq_joint,
4031                    self.fault.K_inner_inner[:, :2, :, :2],
4032                    self.K_inner_asperities_v_plate,
4033                    self.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[self.fault.s_inner, :],
4034                    self.v_init,
4035                    self.delta_tau_bounded,
4036                    self.delta_tau_bounded_nonuni,
4037                    self.slip_taper_vec,
4038                    self.slip_taper_vec_nonuni,
4039                    rho,
4040                    self.alpha_h_vec,
4041                    self.fault.mu_over_2vs,
4042                    self.v_max,
4043                    self.atol,
4044                    self.rtol,
4045                    self.spinup_atol,
4046                    self.spinup_rtol,
4047                    verbose,
4048                )
4049        else:
4050            raise NotImplementedError
4051        # extract the observations that were actually requested
4052        obs_state = sim_state[:, :, self.ix_obs_joint]
4053        # convert to surface displacements
4054        surf_disps_sim = get_surface_displacements(
4055            obs_state[: self.fault.inner_num_patches, :, :],
4056            self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_inner, :],
4057        )
4058        surf_disps_locked = get_surface_displacements(
4059            self.locked_slip, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_asperities, :]
4060        )
4061        surf_disps_outer = get_surface_displacements(
4062            self.outer_creep_slip, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_outer, :]
4063        )
4064        surf_disps_lower = get_surface_displacements(
4065            self.lower_creep_slip, self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_lower, :]
4066        )
4067        # remove effect of reference velocity on surf_disps_sim if desired
4068        if reference_velocity_index is not None:
4069            ref_patch_vel = obs_state[
4070                self.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, reference_velocity_index
4071            ]
4072            ref_surf_vel = get_surface_displacements(
4073                ref_patch_vel[:, :, None], self.G_surf[:, :, self.fault.s_inner, :]
4074            )
4075            ref_surf_vel_ts = ref_surf_vel * (
4076                (self.t_obs - self.t_obs[0]) * SEC_PER_YEAR
4077            )
4078            surf_disps_sim -= ref_surf_vel_ts
4079        return (
4080            sim_state,
4081            obs_state,
4082            surf_disps_sim,
4083            surf_disps_locked,
4084            surf_disps_outer,
4085            surf_disps_lower,
4086        )

Run a full simulation.

def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
