4088    def zero_obs_at_eq(self, surf_disps):
4089        r"""
4090        Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens
4091        and at the beginning (taking into account NaN values).
4092
4093        Parameters
4094        ----------
4095        surf_disps : numpy.ndarray
4096            Surface displacements of shape :math:`(n_\text{stations}, 3, n_\text{observations})`
4097        """
4098        obs_zeroed = surf_disps.copy()
4099        obs_mask = np.isfinite(obs_zeroed)
4100        if not np.all(obs_mask):
4101            # need to loop over every station to find first valid observation after event
4102            periods_from = [0] + self.i_slips_obs
4103            periods_to = self.i_slips_obs + [obs_zeroed.shape[2]]
4104            for i_stat in range(obs_zeroed.shape[0]):
4105                for i_comp in range(obs_zeroed.shape[1]):
4106                    # iterate over all periods between bounds or earthquakes
4107                    for i_from, i_to in zip(periods_from, periods_to):
4108                        offset = None
4109                        for j in range(i_from, i_to):
4110                            # skip if data is masked
4111                            if obs_mask[i_stat, i_comp, j]:
4112                                if offset is None:
4113                                    # save new offset for this period
4114                                    offset = obs_zeroed[i_stat, i_comp, j]
4115                                # apply current offset
4116                                obs_zeroed[i_stat, i_comp, j] -= offset
4117        else:
4118            # no NaNs
4119            obs_zeroed -= obs_zeroed[:, :, 0][:, :, None]
4120            if self.i_slips_obs is not None:
4121                for i in range(self.n_slips_obs):
4122                    obs_zeroed[:, :, self.i_slips_obs[i] :] -= obs_zeroed[
4123                        :, :, self.i_slips_obs[i]
4124                    ][:, :, None]
4125        return obs_zeroed

Reset to zero the surface displacement timeseries every time an earthquake happens and at the beginning (taking into account NaN values).

Parameters
  • surf_disps (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacements of shape \( (n_\text{stations}, 3, n_\text{observations}) \)
def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None): 
4127    def plot_surface_displacements(self, obs_zeroed, obs_noisy=None):
4128        """
4129        Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.
4130
4131        Parameters
4132        ----------
4133        obs_zeroed : numpy.ndarray
4134            Surface displacements as output by :meth:`~zero_obs_at_eq`.
4135        obs_noisy : numpy.ndarray, optional
4136            Noisy surface observations.
4137
4138        Returns
4139        -------
4140        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4141        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4142        """
4143        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4144
4145        # some helper variables
4146        isort = np.argsort(self.pts_surf[:, 0])
4147        i_off = 1.5 * np.std(obs_zeroed, axis=(0, 2))
4148        # get float dates of observed earthquakes
4149        slips_obs = np.logical_and(
4150            self.t_obs.min() <= self.eq_df.index, self.t_obs.max() > self.eq_df.index
4151        )
4152        n_slips_obs = slips_obs.sum()
4153        if n_slips_obs > 0:
4154            i_slips_obs = [
4155                np.argmax(self.t_obs >= t_eq)
4156                for t_eq in self.eq_df.index.values[slips_obs]
4157            ]
4158            t_last_slips = [self.t_obs[islip] for islip in i_slips_obs]
4159        else:
4160            t_last_slips = []
4161        # start plot
4162        fig, ax = plt.subplots(nrows=3, sharex=True, layout="constrained")
4163        for tslip in t_last_slips:
4164            for a in ax:
4165                a.axvline(tslip, c="0.7", zorder=-1)
4166        for j, io in enumerate(i_off):
4167            for i, ix in enumerate(isort):
4168                if obs_noisy is not None:
4169                    ax[j].plot(
4170                        self.t_obs,
4171                        obs_noisy[ix, j, :] + i * io,
4172                        ".",
4173                        c="k",
4174                        rasterized=True,
4175                    )
4176                ax[j].plot(self.t_obs, obs_zeroed[ix, j, :] + i * io, c=f"C{i}")
4177            ax[j].set_ylabel(f"$x_{j + 1}$ [m]")
4178        ax[1].set_xlabel("Time")
4179        fig.suptitle("Surface Displacement")
4180        return fig, ax

Plot the observers' surface displacement timeseries.

Parameters
  • obs_zeroed (numpy.ndarray): Surface displacements as output by ~zero_obs_at_eq().
  • obs_noisy (numpy.ndarray, optional): Noisy surface observations.
Returns
  • matplotlib.figure.Figure
  • matplotlib.axes.Axes
def plot_eq_stress(self, tdcs=True): 
4182    def plot_eq_stress(self, tdcs=True):
4183        """
4184        Plot the stress changes induced by the different earthquakes.
4185
4186        Parameters
4187        ----------
4188        tdcs : bool, optional
4189            If ``True`` (default), plot in TDCS, otherwise in DDCS.
4190
4191        Returns
4192        -------
4193        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4194        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4195        """
4196        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4197        import matplotlib.gridspec as gridspec
4198        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm, Normalize
4199        from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
4200        from cmcrameri import cm
4201
4202        # get unique earthquakes
4203        (
4204            _,
4205            unique_indices,
4206        ) = np.unique(self.eq_df.values, True, axis=0)
4207        n_unique = unique_indices.size
4208        # rotate if necessary
4209        if tdcs:
4210            labels = ["Magnitude", "Strike", "Dip"]
4211            delta_tau_bounded = np.einsum(
4212                "ikj,lik->lij",
4213                self.fault.R_inner_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2],
4214                self.delta_tau_bounded,
4215            )
4216            eq_proj = np.einsum(
4217                "ikj,lik->lij",
4218                self.fault.R_asperities_tdcs_to_ddcs[:, :2, :2],
4219                self.eq_ddcs_proj,
4220            )
4221        else:
4222            labels = ["Magnitude", "$R-45$", "$R+45$"]
4223            delta_tau_bounded = self.delta_tau_bounded
4224            eq_proj = self.eq_ddcs_proj
4225        # get slip data range and norm
4226        s_max = np.ceil(np.max(self.eq_df.max()))
4227        s_norm = Normalize(vmin=-s_max, vmax=s_max)
4228        eq_proj_mag = np.linalg.norm(eq_proj, axis=2)
4229        # start figures
4230        figs = [plt.figure() for _ in range(n_unique)]
4231        axes = []
4232        for i, fig in enumerate(figs):
4233            gs = gridspec.GridSpec(2, 20, figure=fig)
4234            ax_mag = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, :10], projection="3d")
4235            ax_cbar_tau = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 12])
4236            ax_cbar_slip = fig.add_subplot(gs[0, 17])
4237            ax_dip = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, :10], projection="3d")
4238            ax_strike = fig.add_subplot(gs[1, 10:], projection="3d")
4239            axes3d = [ax_mag, ax_dip, ax_strike]
4240            axes.append(axes3d)
4241            colls_inner = [None for _ in range(3)]
4242            colls_asp = [None for _ in range(3)]
4243            for j, ax in enumerate(axes3d):
4244                # plot inner mesh
4245                colls_inner[j] = ax.plot_trisurf(
4246                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4247                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4248                    self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4249                    triangles=self.fault.inner_triangles,
4250                    antialiased=True,
4251                    linewidths=0,
4252                )
4253                # plot asperities
4254                colls_asp[j] = ax.plot_trisurf(
4255                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4256                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4257                    self.fault.asperities_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4258                    triangles=self.fault.asperities_triangles,
4259                    antialiased=True,
4260                    linewidths=0,
4261                )
4262                # make prettier
4263                ax.view_init(elev=20, azim=-135)
4264                ax.set_title(labels[j])
4265                ax.set_xlabel("E [km]")
4266                ax.set_ylabel("N [km]")
4267                ax.set_zlabel("U [km]")
4268                ax.set_box_aspect(
4269                    [
4270                        ub - lb
4271                        for lb, ub in (getattr(ax, f"get_{a}lim")() for a in "xyz")
4272                    ]
4273                )
4274            # create data norms for delta_tau
4275            dtau = delta_tau_bounded[unique_indices[i], :, :]
4276            dtau_mag = np.linalg.norm(dtau, axis=1)
4277            dtau_mag_oom = 10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(dtau_mag)))
4278            dtau_norm = SymLogNorm(
4279                vmin=-dtau_mag_oom, vmax=dtau_mag_oom, linthresh=dtau_mag_oom / 1e3
4280            )
4281            # color inner mesh according to stress change in the different components, and
4282            # color asperities according to slip
4283            # top left: magnitude
4284            colls_inner[0].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau_mag])
4285            colls_asp[0].set_facecolor(
4286                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj_mag[unique_indices[i], :]]
4287            )
4288            # bottom left: strike
4289            colls_inner[1].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau[:, 0]])
4290            colls_asp[1].set_facecolor(
4291                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj[unique_indices[i], :, 0]]
4292            )
4293            # bottom right: dip
4294            colls_inner[2].set_facecolor([cm.vik(dtau_norm(q)) for q in dtau[:, 1]])
4295            colls_asp[2].set_facecolor(
4296                [cm.bam(s_norm(q)) for q in eq_proj[unique_indices[i], :, 1]]
4297            )
4298            # add colorbars
4299            fig.colorbar(
4300                ScalarMappable(norm=dtau_norm, cmap=cm.vik),
4301                cax=ax_cbar_tau,
4302                label=r"$\Delta \tau$ [Pa]",
4303            )
4304            fig.colorbar(
4305                ScalarMappable(norm=s_norm, cmap=cm.bam),
4306                cax=ax_cbar_slip,
4307                label=r"$\Delta s$ [m]",
4308            )
4309        # finish
4310        return figs, axes

Plot the stress changes induced by the different earthquakes.

Parameters
  • tdcs (bool, optional): If True (default), plot in TDCS, otherwise in DDCS.
Returns
  • matplotlib.figure.Figure
  • matplotlib.axes.Axes
def plot_field(self, quantity, log=True, label=None): 
4312    def plot_field(self, quantity, log=True, label=None):
4313        """
4314        Plot a quantity on top of the fault mesh.
4315
4316        Parameters
4317        ----------
4318        quantity : numpy.ndarray
4319            Field quantity of the same shape as the inner mesh.
4320        log : bool, optional
4321            If ``True`` (default), use a logarithmic colorscale.
4322        label : str, optional
4323            Label of the colorbar.
4324
4325        Returns
4326        -------
4327        matplotlib.figure.Figure
4328        matplotlib.axes.Axes
4329        """
4330        import matplotlib.pyplot as plt
4331        from matplotlib.colors import SymLogNorm, LogNorm, Normalize
4332        from matplotlib.cm import ScalarMappable
4333        from cmcrameri import cm
4334
4335        # check data input size
4336        assert isinstance(quantity, np.ndarray)
4337        assert quantity.size == self.fault.inner_num_patches, (
4338            f"Expected input quantity to be of size {self.fault.inner_num_patches}, "
4339            f"got {quantity.shape}"
4340        )
4341        # get data range and norm
4342        if log:
4343            q_oom = 10 ** np.ceil(np.log10(np.max(np.abs(quantity))))
4344            if np.any(quantity < 0):
4345                q_norm = SymLogNorm(vmin=-q_oom, vmax=q_oom, linthresh=q_oom / 1e5)
4346                q_cmap = cm.vik
4347            else:
4348                q_norm = LogNorm(
4349                    vmin=10 ** np.floor(np.log10(np.min(quantity))), vmax=q_oom
4350                )
4351                q_cmap = cm.batlow
4352        else:
4353            q_absmax = np.max(np.abs(quantity))
4354            if np.any(quantity < 0):
4355                q_norm = Normalize(vmin=-q_absmax, vmax=q_absmax)
4356                q_cmap = cm.vik
4357            else:
4358                q_norm = Normalize(vmin=0, vmax=q_absmax)
4359                q_cmap = cm.batlow
4360        # start figure
4361        fig = plt.figure()
4362        ax = fig.add_subplot(projection="3d")
4363        # plot inner mesh
4364        coll = ax.plot_trisurf(
4365            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 0] / 1e3,
4366            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 1] / 1e3,
4367            self.fault.inner_vertices[:, 2] / 1e3,
4368            triangles=self.fault.inner_triangles,
4369            antialiased=True,
4370            linewidths=0,
4371        )
4372        # make prettier
4373        ax.view_init(elev=20, azim=-135)
4374        ax.set_xlabel("E [km]")
4375        ax.set_ylabel("N [km]")
4376        ax.set_zlabel("U [km]")
4377        ax.set_box_aspect(
4378            [ub - lb for lb, ub in (getattr(ax, f"get_{a}lim")() for a in "xyz")]
4379        )
4380        # set mesh colors
4381        coll.set_facecolor([q_cmap(q_norm(q)) for q in quantity])
4382        # add colorbar
4383        fig.colorbar(ScalarMappable(norm=q_norm, cmap=q_cmap), ax=ax, label=label)
4384        # finish
4385        return fig, ax

Plot a quantity on top of the fault mesh.

Parameters
  • quantity (numpy.ndarray): Field quantity of the same shape as the inner mesh.
  • log (bool, optional): If True (default), use a logarithmic colorscale.
  • label (str, optional): Label of the colorbar.
Returns
  • matplotlib.figure.Figure
  • matplotlib.axes.Axes
@dataclass
class SEASResult: 
4388@dataclass
4389class SEASResult:
4390    """Class that contains self-consistent fault, surface, and rheological data"""
4391
4392    slip: np.ndarray | None = None
4393    sliprate: np.ndarray | None = None
4394    disp: np.ndarray | None = None
4395    vel: np.ndarray | None = None
4396    v_plate: np.ndarray | None = None
4397    alpha_h: np.ndarray | None = None
4398    t_eff: float | None = None
4399    n_samples: int | None = field(init=False)
4400    n_patches: int | None = field(init=False)
4401    n_stations: int | None = field(init=False)
4402    n_observations: int | None = field(init=False)
4403    _slipdeficit: np.ndarray | None = field(default=None, init=False)
4404    _coupling: np.ndarray | None = field(default=None, init=False)
4405    _global_mask: np.ndarray | None = field(default=None, init=False)
4406
4407    def __post_init__(self):
4408        """Perform checks and initialize sizes"""
4409        n_dims = [
4410            arr.ndim
4411            for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate, self.disp, self.vel]
4412            if arr is not None
4413        ]
4414        if len(n_dims) > 0:
4415            assert len(set(n_dims)) == 1
4416            n_dims = n_dims[0]
4417            if n_dims == 3:
4418                dim_off = 0
4419                self.n_samples = 1
4420            elif n_dims == 4:
4421                dim_off = 1
4422                n_samples = [
4423                    arr.shape[0]
4424                    for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate, self.disp, self.vel]
4425                    if arr is not None
4426                ]
4427                assert len(set(n_samples)) == 1
4428                self.n_samples = n_samples[0]
4429            else:
4430                raise ValueError
4431            n_observations = [
4432                arr.shape[dim_off + 2]
4433                for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate, self.disp, self.vel]
4434                if arr is not None
4435            ]
4436            assert len(set(n_observations)) == 1
4437            self.n_observations = n_observations[0]
4438            n_stations = [
4439                arr.shape[dim_off + 0]
4440                for arr in [self.disp, self.vel]
4441                if arr is not None
4442            ]
4443            assert len(set(n_stations)) == 1
4444            self.n_stations = n_stations[0]
4445            n_patches = [
4446                arr.shape[dim_off + 0]
4447                for arr in [self.slip, self.sliprate]
4448                if arr is not None
4449            ]
4450            assert len(set(n_patches)) == 1
4451            self.n_patches = n_patches[0]
4452        else:
4453            n_dims = None  # no time-variable arrays
4454            self.n_samples = None
4455            self.n_observations = None
4456            self.n_stations = None
4457            self.n_patches = None
4458        if self.v_plate is not None:
4459            assert self.v_plate.shape[1] == 2
4460            if self.n_patches is None:
4461                self.n_patches = self.v_plate.shape[0]
4462            else:
4463                assert self.n_patches == self.v_plate.shape[0]
4464        if self.alpha_h is not None:
4465            if self.alpha_h.ndim == 1:
4466                dim_off = 0
4467                if self.n_samples is None:
4468                    self.n_samples = 1
4469                else:
4470                    assert self.n_samples == 1
4471            elif self.alpha_h.ndim == 2:
4472                dim_off = 1
4473                if self.n_samples is None:
4474                    self.n_samples = self.alpha_h.shape[0]
4475                else:
4476                    assert self.n_samples == self.alpha_h.shape[0]
4477            else:
4478                raise ValueError
4479            if self.n_patches is None:
4480                self.n_patches = self.alpha_h.shape[dim_off + 0]
4481            else:
4482                assert self.n_patches == self.alpha_h.shape[dim_off + 0]
4483
4484    def __repr__(self):
4485        """String representation of object"""
4486        dims_str = ", ".join(
4487            [
4488                f"{n}={getattr(self, n)}"
4489                for n in [
4490                    "n_samples",
4491                    "n_observations",
4492                    "n_stations",
4493                    "n_patches",
4494                    "t_eff",
4495                ]
4496            ]
4497        )
4498        repr_str = f"SEASResult({dims_str}):\n"
4499        repr_str += "\n".join(
4500            [
4501                f"  {n}: {'missing' if getattr(self, n) is None
4502                       else str(getattr(self, n).shape)}"
4503                for n in ["slip", "sliprate", "disp", "vel", "v_plate", "alpha_h"]
4504            ]
4505        )
4506        return repr_str
4507
4508    def get_slipdeficit(self):
4509        """
4510        Calculate the slip deficit on the fault.
4511
4512        Returns
4513        -------
4514        numpy.ndarray
4515            Normalized slip dificit with shape `(n_samples, n_patches, n_observations).
4516        """
4517        if (self.slip is None) or (self.v_plate is None) or (self.t_eff is None):
4518            raise ValueError(
4519                "Need 'slip', 'v_plate', and 't_eff' to be set "
4520                "to calculate slip deficit."
4521            )
4522        else:
4523            v_plate_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate, axis=1)
4524            slip_vp = np.linalg.norm(self.slip, axis=-2) * np.cos(
4525                np.pi / 4 - np.arctan2(self.slip[..., 1, :], self.slip[..., 0, :])
4526            )
4527            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4528                return 1 - slip_vp / (v_plate_mag[:, None] * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.t_eff)
4529            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4530                return 1 - slip_vp / (
4531                    v_plate_mag[None, :, None] * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.t_eff
4532                )
4533
4534    @property
4535    def slipdeficit(self):
4536        # need to calculate if it's the first time
4537        if self._slipdeficit is None:
4538            self._slipdeficit = self.get_slipdeficit()
4539        # return calculated value
4540        return self._slipdeficit
4541
4542    def get_coupling(self):
4543        """
4544        Calculate the kinematic coupling on the fault.
4545
4546        Returns
4547        -------
4548        numpy.ndarray
4549            Normalized kinematic coupling, same shape as `slip`.
4550        """
4551        if (self.sliprate is None) or (self.v_plate is None):
4552            raise ValueError(
4553                "Need 'sliprate' and 'v_plate' to be set "
4554                "to calculate kinematic coupling."
4555            )
4556        else:
4557            v_plate_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate, axis=1)
4558            sliprate_vp = np.linalg.norm(self.sliprate, axis=-2) * np.cos(
4559                np.pi / 4
4560                - np.arctan2(self.sliprate[..., 1, :], self.sliprate[..., 0, :])
4561            )
4562            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4563                return 1 - sliprate_vp / v_plate_mag[:, None]
4564            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4565                return 1 - sliprate_vp / v_plate_mag[None, :, None]
4566
4567    @property
4568    def coupling(self):
4569        # need to calculate if it's the first time
4570        if self._coupling is None:
4571            self._coupling = self.get_coupling()
4572        # return calculated value
4573        return self._coupling
4574
4575    def get_global_mask(self):
4576        """
4577        Calculate indices where all displacements are missing.
4578
4579        Returns
4580        -------
4581        numpy.ndarray
4582            List of indices [-].
4583        """
4584        if self.disp is None:
4585            raise ValueError("Need 'disp' to be set to calculate mask.")
4586        else:
4587            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4588                return np.flatnonzero(np.all(np.isnan(self.disp), axis=(0, 1)))
4589            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4590                return np.flatnonzero(np.all(np.isnan(self.disp[0, ...]), axis=(0, 1)))
4591
4592    @property
4593    def global_mask(self):
4594        # need to calculate if it's the first time
4595        if self._global_mask is None:
4596            self._global_mask = self.get_global_mask()
4597        # return calculated value
4598        return self._global_mask
4599
4600    @classmethod
4601    def from_sim_run_output(
4602        cls, sim, sim_state, surf_disps_sim, surf_disps_outer, surf_disps_lower
4603    ):
4604        """
4605        Create a SEASResult object from the the output of `SubductionSimulation3D.run`.
4606
4607        Parameters
4608        ----------
4609        sim : SubductionSimulation3D
4610            Simulation object
4611        obs_state : numpy.ndarray
4612            `obs_state` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4613        surf_disps_sim : numpy.ndarray
4614            `surf_disps_sim` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4615        surf_disps_outer : numpy.ndarray
4616            `surf_disps_outer` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4617        surf_disps_lower : numpy.ndarray
4618            `surf_disps_lower` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4619
4620        Returns
4621        -------
4622        SEASResult
4623        """
4624        slip = (
4625            sim_state[: sim.fault.inner_num_patches, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]
4626            - sim_state[: sim.fault.inner_num_patches, :, sim.ix_break_joint[-2]][
4627                :, :, None
4628            ]
4629            + sim.slip_taper
4630        )
4631        sliprate = sim_state[sim.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]
4632        disp = sim.zero_obs_at_eq(surf_disps_sim + surf_disps_outer + surf_disps_lower)
4633        vel = sum(sim.get_vels(sim_state[:, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]))
4634        v_plate = sim.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[sim.fault.s_inner, :]
4635        alpha_h = sim.alpha_h_vec
4636        return cls(slip, sliprate, disp, vel, v_plate, alpha_h)
4637
4638    @staticmethod
4639    def load(path):
4640        """Load a pickled instance of this object"""
4641        with open(path, mode="rb") as f:
4642            return pickle.load(f)
4643
4644    def save(self, path):
4645        """Save instance to a pickled file"""
4646        with open(path, "wb") as f:
4647            pickle.dump(self, f, pickle.HIGHEST_PROTOCOL)

Class that contains self-consistent fault, surface, and rheological data

SEASResult( slip: numpy.ndarray | None = None, sliprate: numpy.ndarray | None = None, disp: numpy.ndarray | None = None, vel: numpy.ndarray | None = None, v_plate: numpy.ndarray | None = None, alpha_h: numpy.ndarray | None = None, t_eff: float | None = None)
slip: numpy.ndarray | None = None
sliprate: numpy.ndarray | None = None
disp: numpy.ndarray | None = None
vel: numpy.ndarray | None = None
v_plate: numpy.ndarray | None = None
alpha_h: numpy.ndarray | None = None
t_eff: float | None = None
n_samples: int | None
n_patches: int | None
n_stations: int | None
n_observations: int | None
def get_slipdeficit(self): 
4508    def get_slipdeficit(self):
4509        """
4510        Calculate the slip deficit on the fault.
4511
4512        Returns
4513        -------
4514        numpy.ndarray
4515            Normalized slip dificit with shape `(n_samples, n_patches, n_observations).
4516        """
4517        if (self.slip is None) or (self.v_plate is None) or (self.t_eff is None):
4518            raise ValueError(
4519                "Need 'slip', 'v_plate', and 't_eff' to be set "
4520                "to calculate slip deficit."
4521            )
4522        else:
4523            v_plate_mag = np.linalg.norm(self.v_plate, axis=1)
4524            slip_vp = np.linalg.norm(self.slip, axis=-2) * np.cos(
4525                np.pi / 4 - np.arctan2(self.slip[..., 1, :], self.slip[..., 0, :])
4526            )
4527            if self.disp.ndim == 3:
4528                return 1 - slip_vp / (v_plate_mag[:, None] * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.t_eff)
4529            else:  # self.disp.ndim == 4:
4530                return 1 - slip_vp / (
4531                    v_plate_mag[None, :, None] * SEC_PER_YEAR * self.t_eff
4532                )

@classmethod
def from_sim_run_output( cls, sim, sim_state, surf_disps_sim, surf_disps_outer, surf_disps_lower): 
4600    @classmethod
4601    def from_sim_run_output(
4602        cls, sim, sim_state, surf_disps_sim, surf_disps_outer, surf_disps_lower
4603    ):
4604        """
4605        Create a SEASResult object from the the output of `SubductionSimulation3D.run`.
4606
4607        Parameters
4608        ----------
4609        sim : SubductionSimulation3D
4610            Simulation object
4611        obs_state : numpy.ndarray
4612            `obs_state` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4613        surf_disps_sim : numpy.ndarray
4614            `surf_disps_sim` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4615        surf_disps_outer : numpy.ndarray
4616            `surf_disps_outer` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4617        surf_disps_lower : numpy.ndarray
4618            `surf_disps_lower` from `SubductionSimulation3D.run`
4619
4620        Returns
4621        -------
4622        SEASResult
4623        """
4624        slip = (
4625            sim_state[: sim.fault.inner_num_patches, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]
4626            - sim_state[: sim.fault.inner_num_patches, :, sim.ix_break_joint[-2]][
4627                :, :, None
4628            ]
4629            + sim.slip_taper
4630        )
4631        sliprate = sim_state[sim.fault.inner_num_patches :, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]
4632        disp = sim.zero_obs_at_eq(surf_disps_sim + surf_disps_outer + surf_disps_lower)
4633        vel = sum(sim.get_vels(sim_state[:, :, sim.ix_obs_joint]))
4634        v_plate = sim.v_plate_ddcs_proj_eff[sim.fault.s_inner, :]
4635        alpha_h = sim.alpha_h_vec
4636        return cls(slip, sliprate, disp, vel, v_plate, alpha_h)

Create a SEASResult object from the the output of SubductionSimulation3D.run.

Parameters
  • sim (SubductionSimulation3D): Simulation object
  • obs_state (numpy.ndarray): obs_state from SubductionSimulation3D.run
  • surf_disps_sim (numpy.ndarray): surf_disps_sim from SubductionSimulation3D.run
  • surf_disps_outer (numpy.ndarray): surf_disps_outer from SubductionSimulation3D.run
  • surf_disps_lower (numpy.ndarray): surf_disps_lower from SubductionSimulation3D.run
Returns
  • SEASResult
